*	Video Ad RTB Is Poised to Surge - If Publishers Loosen Grip On Premium Inventory <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109647990839&s=8442&e=001pthNoCxPYYZn1-s4ohySVh_N_MxOD9y3AtmHOsWUhC0dA5IKhdZjHYx3FwHJFRontjEuA-FNc0cxpsN0A2LPaIdcHQ5yFehz4N8-o74S69d1MD1ZoHEpaDlZHm2k-2Hh9fv1zv0yQfdYBwC_j0W9Yw==>  "Publishers are naturally worried about cannibalizing their direct ad sales, especially when it involves premium inventory. If an advertiser can get the same audience and placements for a cheaper price, why wouldn't there be more pressure on the seller?..." (visit AdExchanger.com)
*	The Sell-Sider column...Moving to  <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109647990839&s=8442&e=001pthNoCxPYYbbMTDIbFBfbLthGnltguKB5qunJj0U2XUTgO-sFSBU-FiW4EbIleHrWP6zNqS1JCcK6HNYCUyKte7xynkuohLpYmkiHXcQpmuNFfLJ6rUBBJp6jQOJBmPzfNpAEbGSHfP3Ch0XuQ1Fq29zqazX0N6iO-3XxDyrkdrst42AhUBQNr1DreC4oICj> "Viewable Impressions" Isn't The Answer by Tom Shields, Yieldex "Let's do a little math. C3 Metrics claims that CTRs are understated by 179% because so many ads aren't in view. Wow - CTRs will double! Except, publishers will charge double the CPM for 'viewable impression', so the CPC (and ROI) is actually the same. On the publisher side..." (visit AdExchanger.com)

Measuring The Outcry


AdWeek reports that Rep. Mary Bono Mack (a Republican) said during a congressional subcommittee hearing that she's wondering if online consumer privacy concerns are being made up by regulators and the Obama administration (a Democratic administration, of course). Playing politics? Sure - at least, in part. This is Washington D.C., after all. Still, Bono Mack is quoted as saying by AdWeek, "Before we do any possible harm to the Internet, we need to understand what harm is actually being done to consumers. Where is the public outcry for legislation? I haven't gotten a single letter from anyone back home urging me to pass a privacy bill." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109647990839&s=8442&e=001pthNoCxPYYai8-zIWTFoXfVr1fXJW-KmGcKa9wxlRvtA803oeF25i-yYSG4cT0ixLbo515MU9PboY-ZR5MM6OUdKsQPqfLGg1eNOBZN2-s0ZWlQBKDJyFSoKu3-zgGmLeZ-upgGuD8tIcm_GPs1Y-DCxE4y4pGZLYPsNcFz4JhRXUQJKQQRN6N9m9mUX9JelTwBsm78bqPw=> . 


IPO For The Millennium


Mobile ad network Admob sells for $750 million in 2010 to Google. Quattro Wireless sells to Apple for a rumored $275 million in 2010. Pundits everywhere said the exit had been capped if not closed for mobile ad network players who had not been acquired, including Millennial Media. Yesterday, Millennial Media had the last laugh - pending market gyrations. On its first day of trading the company's market capitalization hit $2 billion. Read all about it on TechCrunch. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109647990839&s=8442&e=001pthNoCxPYYbRI9i7hUlxmxt9AGmUvTpcTbw19WlAUymeOVSV7i91XRhSq9y3dGBYVuFu4ibqaEo_ApLjUzxPtvoNMezcvRlGNky3DKeP71JHebQw-wOoCIvqY6mjXH_umvEcIWFjcwMILK_wAb3rkzM5nqqPE1MEt0P551Dj1odHo_lKMZ2EXz8-tAOU9Rjvhl4535SOuKG-bRptn9R0oLF4krgm34yZcYnNbd9IHoY=>  The IPO gates are open. 


Survey Wall


Google has found a new way to do the paywall without having you login and pay for a subscription. The "Survey Wall" requires that once a user hits the landing page in order to read an article, for example, a user must answer a question if they want to read the entire article. According to paidContent <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109647990839&s=8442&e=001pthNoCxPYYYwD2YvFCICA1mrgLrVIXw12bP5owb7L50uDsjNkhRgSBmawHSIqvS2XiQ1nG88PxMBOtwlnvZ1XWUdnGWZ5BcD28Du3QM65SriDFSzldbdkjWuRV3zr-7sAx5SltH1m_4koM3xVclBccaWrK7-dBc_dhEO2j7QklM561Cxm7fTAJtlV0nJUR77uBf-APRz9TyfOc1nW_y54Q==> , publishers get .05 for each click. On the other end, Google is arbitraging market research needs and charging, for example, .10 a question. Google therefore makes a nickel. AdWeek says <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109647990839&s=8442&e=001pthNoCxPYYY7tD4AkE-yvInIBCljBSYUunOkTdjc8AaAiFcXpQG0sf7dabptwnm0qeFOqglHwae-_gUyFAWiZTIdSnhCH6woD0XvdYmBhzyltJerV-4XV7V5DOcEllkNgUdcIQUFLdIq5KLcqFUkpbkSvpoCqPOwoYCWMSauOT8gRGUKmFEPptrRNIDiZKXYCtCn0Lw9Q6FduFOounwqZ_AqI-FCNVyw>  it's gonna give it a try. Read the announcement on the Google News blog <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109647990839&s=8442&e=001pthNoCxPYYarQp7ZDWNHkEzde8eZKAdaRtdYpofKqMoxnzgcaQ3uVOn4dkwgAwY_lIZMIjsUKUC7SU3dRdPG0CnvHYx4XQLPIWwtx3_A67SvkXZoS8zFRvfHyaTFgRTvlZXYZMJSLrc3GR0u_ZjUHdljIrhS1Qfj3VsBWsaU6EdjlkHUvXNIkSx4M08XMshS> . 


Q1 In Review


Unable to wait for the first quarter of 2012 to end, The Jordan-Edmiston Group has released its review of Q1 2012 deal flow. According to the release, "Marketing & Interactive Services accounted for 7 of the 14 largest deals of the quarter - those with over $100 million of value." Tops among the deals was SingTel's acquisition of Amobee for $321 million in cold hard cash. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109647990839&s=8442&e=001pthNoCxPYYboLdCcv7MQgAm1bXUA1eVw0IiV7ay8qFecP5OVb8tjpn2Vq-KkUMzA0VXFYUD7grmeH1p9OuTAUt1R0GUhwyyce6ZZwzS2XhPq4_yeeuqOyrsah6PJYIuDfRxG7RFxyk6xy2xKmYAN1HS3XMJqZRKJx8EBe6OdSaRqRN80AaOfivT0mZXMXyW7mO4_BH3hJ56WNqXOzZL1mfxvSzseprSPQdajc-atcP-WW31Qw8hkRM6nlls3PNDY> . 


GRP's Online Tentacles


Video demand-side platform TubeMogul announced an agreement with Nielsen "to provide actionable gross ratings point (GRP) data from Nielsen Online Campaign Rating." Who cares? Product Manager Mark Wagman at OMG trading desk Accuen does. He claims in the release, "GRPs change the calculus by letting us allocate budgets purely based on where viewers are and make apples-to-apples comparisons with television. And unlike television, where ratings can vary day-to-day, advertisers can know exactly what they are getting for a given budget given the optimization available online." Read the release. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109647990839&s=8442&e=001pthNoCxPYYbvUJWubAw6J8bqWnrUy9AE1okGlgVOCX51-OFDw_X70dFrby6UBNhjvIm3a8UZoUtxXC_u9KSW8PYnkJ3IFgidcj_VWBBvsRBzkRaLlH0GFYI_hSPSUAFr-1waHCgADXJ-g7CkrTP0eh1_h-BP4E_9YM8QKhnYiWc6JgV0eZ0Q0klWTmqoXXh5XsKy1tcXNy27DrF9DjUDlJHrHHWU02dyOwpIK6ky4_lMOZdT_8WBHvel5BnTVD7_kD3gZ6kXBwQ=>  


Viewing Impression


Cory Treffiletti continues the debate on Viewable Impressions on Mediapost. He sees a possible solution for pricing impressions depending on the viewability: "My suggestion would be that only ads above the fold are able to be priced on a CPM basis, and any ads below the fold of a standard website should be priced on a CPC or CPE (cost per engagement) basis." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109647990839&s=8442&e=001pthNoCxPYYYUW6EDEGnZsmimlDO34fULlmT2mesOlmoGgP-tH4GuoTUBknSEOZ5Nyx2FVeNhCiXO3OcMiLfFV_UDMExnMGTDsCZC5IXJk3MTRTzsGf2V8MTYeC7Ugm4CrpJorY-A69vZnlwXX7tbJa-j4u4uOdScOxuZFDOJA1i4sO7UABwYBmGV3vVwxRfrMz7_dPtZRyv5HTRy62z-gQ==> . Yieldex's Tom Shields responds to Treffiletti's idea in the comments <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109647990839&s=8442&e=001pthNoCxPYYYBnL_PhNJCp-GzJnpzIpwcQsg911Wuqfljwexg8y1Aakz-j_iglzJnRm8TQ4U3tWCJiR3GLIRc-HWhmADxiu9UhoXliymxRTdeGWq63Uvll-U4hTCFe1539z72auOMxTZc7SASlCfWtvRRgEyso6ZPL4BPIuBdYTnCax0Bg-6dj_dFQHAEUximHIPj9Rl_a_5z_Ct8rL7ygQ==>  of his own post on AdExchanger: "If you measure cost per unit effectiveness, then intermediate metrics are only about shifting risk between the advertiser and the publisher, and I don't think we need a new one." 


Crossing The Channel


DataXu has published the results of a survey of 300 digital marketers conducted by Society of New Communications Research (SNCR) and consultancy Human 1.0. The survey found that marketers do not feel they have their arms around their own first-party data. Among several nuggets that may be of interest to data miners panning for insight "gold": "Respondents report that the lack of a single cross-channel digital marketing platform was a significant obstacle to their efforts, and was most commonly identified as preventing the allocation of additional budget. (...) 20% of respondents report that increased measurability was a key driver in the rise of digital marketing." Download the whitepaper (pay with some PII) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109647990839&s=8442&e=001pthNoCxPYYYbQJ2Q8zK54R6zTlJpqbgN6yfgDcOeLnrJH5OB3JUduN09fbMJkEA53NO0ikMsZi29RCTv_KpEnjU0LUxSmuQ3ltnx2bqqZwMqRMU5cOxcU3Y_YiHGCuc7B4nR9D8Yf0I_9tczQb1kbxagXQcwD4Cw-wvsCgWLDmylCWM_kYx45A==> . 


Mobile Ad Trends


Good news for mobile ad inventory owners. User acquisition costs are going up (resulting in higher CPMs for publishes(, but it may be at the expense of smaller mobile app developers who still need to promote their apps. VentureBeat's Dean Takahashi looks at new February data from Fiksu (AdExchanger Q <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109647990839&s=8442&e=001pthNoCxPYYbT4wudIPHkUSl-0mteHaWJHF-M2tiJj39Zd0ulPMdEkAugWKFbtWxahbPyx0DHmw4E4Y4i3EIYq4Um4Q02QJF8_avuc8vu-LQAlGdc8y1BitS1vM_DniAyxUe4FtsnvpE=> &A) and writes, "That's a sign that mobile app makers are placing more ads to promote their products in the Apple App Store. If the costs keep rising, then smaller developers may find that it is going to cost too much to promote their apps, given the amount of money they can generate in revenue from those apps." Read more on VB <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109647990839&s=8442&e=001pthNoCxPYYbspK7HfR8EOL9b7PtHIH3AFm1h65cDCJM7R5Ce6ddEHYXzmAub4OS4ksd2NOMFtMHZxF7LhkGevaNNCWFm_tAzacTF7wBwIKWgXM1URSH4F-xYnS4SCo5DnZ7l4xts373EKeHl9-_VXz2Ugaz-GC5CodkfkJqaIWHdHJUlj1FmxXIiZmilfMNhnGd0iPfwHrqfvHpOyCTG3A==> . And, read the release. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109647990839&s=8442&e=001pthNoCxPYYZHNnhI_1JUql6IPCm0n3b7xbq5nFJDMwBNOL0mcN3-7k0_Ym5RyGndwmZzEe2ziJVfx0pWrp8HDF1VnTVTw0JgdC3zgnQsTxnQsQqzKc_vXMO3SnG-r8utezCNiPXzQ7NIrZSKflc_pa2PBjFRmXu52nZM_xZyd6CJSYFjzbl5gT24EoKrIalXHV1HL2RKUobPluA13BgiVhPVjWLs4QlgF6xgir3J3tBRmECzekkkwPhCD9KXU_tJTP0IQAI3oP5E4heRyQvYYrh6J8YLBzTp>  


Online And Offline Comps


In a note to investor, J.P. Morgan analyst Doug Anmuth tries to do some look-alike modeling with the latest Best Buy financial data and says that the closure of 50 stores by Best Buy is positive for Amazon. However, quoting his own fellow JPM analyst, who covers Best Buy, Anmuth writes, "The [Best Buy] expense cuts are designed to right size the operating structure of Best Buy to the new reality of competing in a price transparent, online world. So these cost reductions are likely to be used to fund BBY's investment in price - driving increased competition with AMZN over the long term." Offline stores are restructuring - they don't completely go away. And at some point, they will grow as online companies look for a brick-and-mortar toehold and its valuable data.

Optimizing The News

For Thursday, March 29, 2012

Today From AdExchanger.com...



*	Thursday, March 29, News Round-Up <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109638517611&s=8442&e=001ktiaSw3ZhRIlqrK3UhpmJrY8HCg1rwH1hZRXzXv21daf92KZCrf8Ce7EEnscYx-ltAbpEWT4OHwZ_b3Tdk3X0pRlcJjt9-aXgLzEOMqZxSJ7LStTdOpxzVxBHy6AlGP0XFgp5b5PfnDr5pholZ9h2L5d0OB6vYJvnz4lgA5IKkg=>  (see below)
*	Client Data Is The Battleground Says Accenture Interactive Exec Shah <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109638517611&s=8442&e=001ktiaSw3ZhRLU0j7T1bfEE7jZArUGLVmVthun2M_s2nEB3dR9IA13lIa9fuBW5MWzBgd_EXommLp1GiJNvDdscZkHB5s0PAHvKzIV4DyacZcAjowL1N4rUcnsM7x31NVbC9tl2vr1TgJ9nnAZE4RAaPEvAQ_ekqtge_oqbppSaRA=>  "Obviously, the Holy Grail is when - from a consumer's vantage - the distinction between ad and content and experience is gone. It evaporates. Today, it still pretty much exists. But that is one definition of relevance, which is you're so relevant that they no longer feel like they're getting spoken to as an ad. But there are other consequences, as well..." (visit AdExchanger.com)
*	Jobs <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109638517611&s=8442&e=001ktiaSw3ZhRLzCSm2Yy7ZdUxePMsp2wNenIeQf0vEo9y_g-0BXcY8LR7RqIAR-QjoyWlqqVNbM9d1SYN6AbUc3neTOGSoUG2kRRajc2_2QSJmL_QE4O6Zqzr7VsNb76kf>  (see below)

Hail To The Chief


As reported in Ad Age <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109638517611&s=8442&e=001ktiaSw3ZhRJgOzIpdia5TOv0gLHjSi7OnxWkjkILDXQC4EG6fKlOvud9RJV3ZizlU5UC1k2LJvOYts93RBM3UYVn7mSRWieQYP9VBKgvq9wqHwuRsQmjtipkQUlXH56Hsb_W6G7_xdjRnpSMb8y26BZX0jptAQItzOwMEntg_R6CBUAVskZ4cDBl_K1KLAswRxHWCHIZ39-cE-dBBSK0ATXBWYFbCKU3> , Nick Pahade has left TRAFFIQ for agency Initiative and now the company's SVP of Client Services, Lori Goldberg, is taking over as President. A TRAFFIQ press release explains: "During [Goldberg's] time at TRAFFIQ, she has successfully led the account management, media planning and buying, search, creative and business development teams. Lori also played a key role in developing strong strategic partnerships within the industry." The appointment leaves the door open to bring in a CEO, or move Goldberg into the role over time. Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109638517611&s=8442&e=001ktiaSw3ZhRLw33E7bkcmtXq0VE-rJ3Aaji80G_8ACdmMsVl4ZPkCLGPQdOwoZBZ-ylzcF2-fxQRHadZ2i8H3vKbSlQBEASbt-jQyVYbhBi5KL-wle4y0KGMkHsJno7TA1cTXrgToMoexiMNluQ6X0UZ_wh1D5zuJgNLM26kO2DN5byA4uJ5AEL5S6dDQb5LcrulVmF4eX47dwSC1SH7ogja7B3LIxRTZ>  


The Doctor Is In


Efficient Frontier's doctor of data, Sidd Shah, returns to the EF blog to tease the company's upcoming State of Digital Marketing quarterly report. Shah is seeing flat CPC quarter-over-quarter and year-over-year. Economic stagnation, Doctor? Shah writes, "Not necessarily. As we saw last quarter, backed by growth in query and click volume, spend increased 14% YoY despite flat CPCs. We are seeing similar trends for Q1." This has an interesting echo to Google's Q4 '11 results <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109638517611&s=8442&e=001ktiaSw3ZhRIzcz9vhZrcSLIelIUOBNI56mA8-bvKXbwU3czYGGEB_3X0GHpTbOOEcmI-oQirJbumGBF4WJ9kO0xu29araLvV1xV_XQApiMDtBflUAtROe4TNItyikVPWbe9sNjlodtDUa44YIQSUbLCqVZuoumemWrJJAIe-EZA=>  where Wall Street flipped its lid that when Google missed revenue targets in spite of an increase clicks - but a lower CPC. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109638517611&s=8442&e=001ktiaSw3ZhRLLUYG1N84WJT69pXEtbU6TuraGHKU3o6ImzAjCwDvQaFxjBpHPjSRX4Yy8ZT6k0QDsV-ZA8Qyg4qc38kGnnzKOcEfucI8e3IhnSl9E2m_o0q3iLISV2j2FV5wGTZ2dN9I59SC3pvtoWIEiOTSOQIvkuBx50abSuSa8aBxU2dJcSMMKJHbXRIexC_bBFKkTj1ajthGd6m2YlRF0DLWQopbK> . The world is getting more clicky as tech/content/advertisers are better at eliciting a click through better ads (hence lower CPCs)? 


CTR And The Brain


Former Dapper sales maven, and now Mintigo sales exec <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109638517611&s=8442&e=001ktiaSw3ZhRJBw5neBgLLWYRc4GfSFmM9WwZAVzM2aD4z8jq_ikMaIDG1PyFX-UocvsTeMPEnnraZMd2pm3VZxle0Q-yjcbo0wCXtYEZVxFBkSnfWH7Yn9d37WT7ANwD6a4sGEGXuVms=> , Chris Zaharias takes to his personal blog and takes no prisoners - again! This time he's aiming at Facebook. He carves the following in a post: "While researching Facebook's metrics over time, I stumbled upon two data sets that, together, confirmed a hunch I'd had, namely that Facebook ad CTR and intelligence are inversely correlated." I love Hawaii! Zaharias tells all. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109638517611&s=8442&e=001ktiaSw3ZhRJ1SaMKs1Iy27IY9XrsK-I3BR_xgVplHwQMzTiulGeVOWae-Wsf6WyTYM-R39GQ06zq3KOWud7OtVD1BbSbg3h6tja7wNk1gPqg00_uRV5E8AZ6Dy1wqPMzq1GaWiK3SMN8wKyplhIAQhvoqdRubwSmzCkq0bRVaX-eIoyi35FwTKMjG-juZN8G>  


Buying Leads


This week, Access Intelligence announced the acquisition of Jay Weintraub's lead gen trade show Leadscon and Daily Deals Summit. According to Folio, Weintraub isn't going off into the sunset after completing a successful deal. He will continue to work his magic as president and founder of LeadsCon and have an integral roles in the new "Access Intelligence Customer Acquisition Board." Read about it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109638517611&s=8442&e=001ktiaSw3ZhRIPLLH6x_D-li4YfI2rA0K0jsoIQrDdGvFyFE1kfFGDDDqQdHCkPFSsQMY0sd-vv46qk62em9y5hSZKN4R9-mMK3tTCBzM6J2E2EOscUXkwImpcVfKCVAxMsCDT6-9F4-9RmE63lNIka6E5hDZQ0SHOrV6Yi2nbgkiES1tLF6SgDugmg5hMcZFwFwK2eqI1Hmc=> . 


Rich Media Media


For you rich media sellers, MediaMind has released a bit more data, but more importantly, a couple more graphs that are going to look good in your Powerpoint prez. Clients may enjoy that rich media and rich media with video far outpaces for "Post-ad site visit lift" than your standard run-of-the-mill banner ad." Download the PDF (pay with PII that's just short of your first born.) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109638517611&s=8442&e=001ktiaSw3ZhRKEj5WhI3PAlPF25x8oXF4LT9xp9eayzyhlyDUA8RHdXli4XS0GkurJ9odZdHiBoddni9XJoM9qigpuh34ih1EQkaX6Mg7lpOaYu17eVK5QbHwuMNZ5IPFmdckCCJ7tQCIk8pGYc39wYX9_Gx0ZZT7eoLA3HzeiAfeGWJeyXPUDacqgEHeOEELS115b6Tx2WqUNqELjJffrPV8PlIQX3EVUPvVuvZUUx0aazPalqmiYqEaFmFOp8cZLj2QuZXWkc9EqCGgUtyY5igf1IMIrY_XS> . 


Data Brokers


The IAB took a look at the Federal Trade Commission's new report (PDF <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109638517611&s=8442&e=001ktiaSw3ZhRJgWXza5oXI-4FalsyPA0FFNI9m9RWXEkZZsHcUqyGGPyeuRTxLXZDT9GkePPYlBRZl4Dm9oWtlVAiZXslsm868bMG6qHip7QrqB9kwS4tizfd0XZHX4xXYydXJTpD6WeExkakQI2aH3OIfW6JN4lBg> ) on consumer privacy and isn't happy with the use of the term "data brokers." As MediaPost's Wendy Davis explains, "The report characterizes data brokers as companies that collect information about consumers in order to resell the data for identity verification, fraud prevention, marketing and other purposes." That covers just about everyone in online ads. The IAB wants the term narrowed. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109638517611&s=8442&e=001ktiaSw3ZhRLVR2gVCaT1lLuKemTSexOpF-kXT20BzRz-LZKkujODxkirz91lziLTtV4TRMyycw74oyGxx_A06SDkd7PAnfqJ-qMC4GlhuAoRH-ff2VxMms47ZnUdn_oORZ37KcARar7HHPW8LrmAXtqFhWVcSYfFm3HMKLKny4WTwi1s_NGLgtcIiAbTMVk-2PvpooHMmyDN3EDb3JHWVTOJGDAaBCtaQ7eXCLfoWXg=> . 


Dynamic Opacity


On ClickZ, DataXu's Mike Baker considers sell-side, "dynamic price floors" in ad exchange environments and is concerned that they may be a step backwards. Baker says, "Short-term, this may indeed increase revenues for the seller, but long-term - as buyers become aware of the practice - it discourages buyers from bidding higher, or from bidding as actively as they might otherwise." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109638517611&s=8442&e=001ktiaSw3ZhRL0VIj_wCYMMo80IdlQwjtBPJn3y-t_MN6D_Qzm5YdMust1FYBsHYcCpFnxQtLvLHiRisJMVsWRf5SwlXQO5CPmrUIhtNichgW-hycDPHlb38LGgY4Oi8XceVxfsX-Om5X6Eevnm2g96cS8fkOygPp2_jeRNiAce3g7sR4R0WLkuTX9rsQiZeX8Or5xCC5GWsU=> . 


H. Dumpty


Lotame's COO and GM Adam Lehman returns to Ad Age with his ever-loaded quill to deliver "Stack Wars" as he explores something Luke Skywalker never envisioned: the race to provide an end-to-end solution for addressable, digital media. Unfortunately, Lehman only sees point solutions and "Humpty Dumptys." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109638517611&s=8442&e=001ktiaSw3ZhRJlRQiZzO0XrzsgRLpg9JvjoY42H6_LVqIPEFkyszWKQovy9fEpL26mzQs35swt5u3_Crgth3Gp8FTN61SXak0yYkRQvCenbNIuHjP_XO9-65qw2t-n5Q0rCN2xXi6lZIvNmvLyq2ZE-a61UWI6yBfUILy15AfQgXMX4xv6pRC3BXuDV2s6uOQX> . (reader alert: First appearance of Humpty Dumpty in this newsletter.) 


What's The Diff?


There's Google retargeting and then there's the retargeting that demand-side platforms do. What's the difference? AdRoll's Adam Berke explains all as it relates - and inserts his own self-service, retargeting company, AdRoll, in the process. See the video <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109638517611&s=8442&e=001ktiaSw3ZhRK3TJQugK9tTX0rNO0aAVrGUi1M89CrFijajRqPuATnDtnIk6WZ4m0Ca_opjEszWa5fGMIX5vBhQWr3I8R9GJrCb5VHHM4rOf4Ukk6Os_cWTFhqTCFicCUk5IK3Kyed73MHRtbCyumZRGzliZCNEFBZrRJ7UNowEIHIexmt_klmUg==> .

*	Trading Desks, DSPs - I Mean Demand-Side Platforms - And The Agency - @4As Transformation LA Conference <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109630565269&s=8442&e=001ZTwwnT1tJK4TYXbgBNURl23yggpGO7fXC5NL7KZddXvO0B7Mvl3UEEmqCJStxq8PcLYAGGMyppiEmnqqqmJMuXXVLeubt5sKfcCldmEksELul8woEuMT5XS9ggbbeYqTamhP09saFwo2osY-DJSIrNXy-70CGvlUctzyIfv4BcWtPP8l2H0cGQ==>  "Moderator Dave Morgan probed the 'Wall Street' metaphor as it relates to trading desks. Accuen's Josh Jacobs said that the industry needs to move past 'arbitrage' to serving the client. Systems integrators made more sense to Jacobs then the Wall Street analogy. Xaxis' Brian Lesser said he expects that over time the data and technology services that a unit like his provides will start to move back into the agency..." (visit AdExchanger.com)
*	Data  <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109630565269&s=8442&e=001ZTwwnT1tJK4PO-GMlg3Y23aU-ZnT53JrjeMFR4k5YsucoSPY7h0GVx-NUspDyHFl3g_XgP-VTH6Q3TjfpgvBD_P_DvCLhvev-caFj29lY0kDA9oGjGwKrGjk2gRAO_nzsHuuxY8Cl9Grn2GydYcWscrCA5qPK7ol0kRW7o7LL76Hx1-Tm0HYMQ==> "Scammers" Are Hurting The Magic - @4As Transformation LA Conference "Sorrell then offered a few thoughts on the competitive landscape. 'Google has become a friendlier frienemy and a much more focused company under Larry Page.' He saw five legs to the Google juggernaut - Search, Display, Video, Social and what Sorrell says is the most powerful leg - the Mobile leg and Google's Motorola Mobility leg as Google gets clearly into the mobile and device businesses..." (visit AdExchanger.com)
*	Theorem CEO Kulkarni Eyes Rapid Growth Of Mobile As Company Leverages Ops, Creative Expertise <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109630565269&s=8442&e=001ZTwwnT1tJK68VULgTRfVayXsqMVJMQjaBIv_L2-2NaS-mbQLaDM3sf_R9HMPyGx8mvM_8cI2UqXWROWl6c0zO1XLvxsSBO39vKKqPAPXhTfglBOfbdCpG2tsSXuBamVqMgpUQtBZmF_s8D7ndyX422OFmD_Xgt2_>  "For me, programmatic buying, conceptually, is an economic problem and solution. If you can cherry-pick certain impression-level buys through real-time bidding (RTB) - whether the platform on the demand side is a demand-side platform, on the sell side is RTB/SSP - it doesn't matter..."(visit AdExchanger.com)
*	Experian Hitwise SVP Bradstock Says AudienceView Using Largest Panel Of Online Consumer Behavior <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109630565269&s=8442&e=001ZTwwnT1tJK4PwR1Ww3OxM_QHuVZ7pIpBj7T20KJCugYbKAjtdwnZR-0TShiCMBx9Fog1g598kqBP-U8Gr-_lxHQL2v_PQCsy5wQiToDwBDjdqoKbbyjrWKEVPLHQ9K36Xkjsfxpc09XAfLhcxGlBumHXTiiXszvgKHjwJC-gqcc=>  "It's not just to look at the direct response and the click through, but actually to look at 'Did it change the search terms that they're using? Did it change the time that they spend on competitive sites? Did it change conversion rates on competitive sites?' We think there's an opportunity to help people prove the effectiveness of campaigns that are being implemented..." (visit AdExchanger.com)

Active-ating Audience


Boston-based IPG agency Hill Holliday continues to add to its media buying platform (AdExchanger Q <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109630565269&s=8442&e=001ZTwwnT1tJK6T-ZV9fHd36VrUxIpmkpjYW5v8KovGfglGvfeqUqlyTh6JpG197RAXcADLKVwHXa-AFqwNZORk-gKu9DpoHOu_NCOfoZdTNKGexXl2DkyTJ_UBMHLm00wtyZzFpC2MXWRpqyGi9e790iqAdV380N1wb6sYOvp1gH4=> &A) capabilities. Yesterday, it was announced that the agency has reached across Charles River into Cambridge to partner on the launch of a new ChoiceStream (AdExchanger Q <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109630565269&s=8442&e=001ZTwwnT1tJK65BrcxI-Zqp60qmbbzfci-W-KhvbgdlT64F36SgjA9SL2s106GzsmPTFMq4PtOWVNhHHbOYmxkv3T8VqYjf4UBaVrIvhxy-qXOmrCgXoq_XExu1Yq2A6iEtPFkWmToD9cWg5tCcDWMbtCGeC_KZ6z8rTDykBMcXYZeHPtco4ge6Q==> &A) product called CRUNCH Active Audience. According to the release, "Using a simple, visually engaging in-banner poll, CRUNCH Active Audience invites the consumer to share a specific trait or attitude, thus indicating their affinity towards a brand's product or message." From there, first and third-party data take over and help hone a profile for addressing media. Read it. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109630565269&s=8442&e=001ZTwwnT1tJK6T-ZV9fHd36awgQni2vrQ_NytgaduxVKPHFm1AcKMmMZtYUS-aJxo9FMSGjWbPkkpJQzIuMwZige151W7JI_BUJsevKjKlQ2Kp_W14I5JksuWqvb5A0l_t-V4Bn9-syCPYRNyVH-H_BLYHrplH2C1h>  


Showrooming Prevention


Internet Retailer said recently that its research showed 29% of in-store, mobile researchers wind up buying online. In other words, you want to buy a TV, you go in-store to look at it, and at the same time, you punch up the best online offers and then... Read the IR article <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109630565269&s=8442&e=001ZTwwnT1tJK6h7JJKtv6bhyhL_MZ2eVkEUjzAUMFLLRounSYt4W26sAnFmKM9xf4HDQDmVyZy_kuLSpXMsW4gklEeavndpPpSXlkmweUmQFJI25bWuYuNA850uWt3ajDV8h-e7yAzEFI__uNfIJokWsdQTRwEiF4XgfY6l4ehgYOu6bKfsclULt_F4LBkjqLr62iFXPrFsMkbmjFguds-IQ==> . Referencing the data, Thi Thumasathit says on the Adchemy blog that mobile retailers need to amp up their mobile search PPC spend because "A mobile smash and grab is not just a lost sale. It's the loss of an extremely purchase-ready customer. And, because the sale went directly to a competitor, it's a direct shift in market share. As such, I believe mobile search can make or break retailers." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109630565269&s=8442&e=001ZTwwnT1tJK5kEqlyP4AhYzlX1gAbAGL0BVESuNdcJ5RzHjKK8RWBnwuejZ3XgnYbwuJDCSMSL8qQ3JIrNjL7VhNep_QUBBpZu099-AY8uCxqxAtbXwMJxgvXHCHoiM1hjY-mmUivFbshqRS3F28z5amBLbqjFTKuv-p7HkiwtBbmeXylIt7WXkpxlB6r-BEiybM7s8fRvrJN3Rl9LRNmrQ==> . As Pew Research also chronicled in January, it's "showrooming <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109630565269&s=8442&e=001ZTwwnT1tJK4FopQYxLyJARom7b8aaKA7XJqvC2dA3tY_DG6RJhppsJC7fSxwfIkf9Ijp-p1wKZSXvICMa_-5jmAr54uEJd19EoF_nfB-8I03t0snlH2hpgi7LY3BuTjx3axXjj6iJkL6LkCmfvt_RX8DiI0YjL8w6guA2D0KpPPRrediiUSyLrnEc5D1xMtWlHeH8GWT-88i5V4Tfi0woPhO50uBZOUlOkKzdyCwUcI=> " for the win - or lose. 


GOOG Display


In advance of Google's Q1 2012 earnings release next month, Citi analyst Mark Mahaney reviews GOOG's prospects in a note to investors and sees sunny skies ahead in spite of regulatory concerns, the integration of Motorola Mobility and social network competitions. As it relates to display, Mahaney says in analyst speak, "Detailed GOOG Segment Analysis Supports 20% Revenue Growth Outlook - Extrapolating from current trends, we see Mobile and Display rising from approx. 18% of GOOG's Revenue in 2011 to 21%+ in 2012. Given 40%+ growth rates for Mobile & Display, this all but guarantees a strong double-digit revenue growth outlook for Google for the foreseeable future, with 20%+ growth in 2012." Display is gaining on search for the biggest search player in the world. 


Mo Money


The funds expected from Millennial Media's IPO keeps on going up. Reuters reports that the mobile ad network has raised the pricing for its offering yet again and will now raise $152.5 million instead of a measly $129 million. Read a bit more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109630565269&s=8442&e=001ZTwwnT1tJK56U34RXi8b7STVxx1wlAScr1ow9uqNjsrqpDte0SFmupcLdbgMiD57gzg5ojaGPyVTPzi3K72p00a7DxGdvOdyvikGrBfiCfKCmxPwlrkfeCfIz-7dlsZQlgFwcDw-n2tVElSrarUlNBEUzKEzwk8v2sLDmMFLRG79Eo0BoCydPVUcMi_2OQVReX0ePuxbi2k=>  In January, the total raise of the IPO was going to be $75 million according to the original S-1. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109630565269&s=8442&e=001ZTwwnT1tJK6LBqijB0R3E7e5WrjVDxZcq80aiANLcxZbpnd_3sfdeklGbhRMOaiWutnr0waGPFmh3QJa71p8E2iyulYfWERdhuj-cW2Xx89_adgBLW7Lo-Y3DgvmUw8h0Qn7FsQfScjlxYlThLHIrLGZJHolVZYhuS7_hAKaoPn8P4FtP8s_ZYPYbug8rKpgh-_T2NvlcVo=>  Millennial Media will likely be an active acquirer of mobile ad startups with new and different tech - unless it gets gobbled up, too. The company's valuation has now reached nearly $1 billion according to TechCrunch <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109630565269&s=8442&e=001ZTwwnT1tJK5V2hAYoh-gNdWGuDD8W_SQlAAt3lv8hTEZdrJlWePU29cw710usB708hXlMPJ6-52dRrgCzHwDBFmt7R1I0FxyJggdmH1DcHEuP4AksKRt0QHbVkh-s-B406UD1QW76Ao7T6XzuiFmRtpU6VIo0aD49IgsKZ3ZcK3XNj_TIeTdytEYB-z7rq4XzSx6uqCiK0j4BgwK9t1S52gg0iWlrKLMjmOMd_oTcaXv0-EQM8m0FA==> . 


Signup Mobile


Positioning itself as a mobile signup ad platform, Pontiflex announced yesterday that it has launched a self-service platform called AdLeads that will enable mobile signup ad campaigns. Speaking to Pontiflex's CPA roots, the release explains "signup ads": "Signup ads differ from existing ad models because they allow businesses to pay only when people sign up for their ad - not for wasted clicks or impressions." CPA for the mobile masses. See AdLeads <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109630565269&s=8442&e=001ZTwwnT1tJK6ixFd6eFDv-Ctu_hUeYsswNM7fbO8kNogFF5fTFW4l2f8m2MB3WJOyHrzIKLqsvW4Qkw7K03HpRv6HmmuRs9htro4B835VFikQe536PTjslN_R3b-SWIdJ> . 


Mo Money, Series C


Media monetization platform for the travel industry, and airlines in particular, Sojern (AdExchanger Q <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109630565269&s=8442&e=001ZTwwnT1tJK77yiFt4jrOi1dqe16hHnZMuKamRH3DDDdkFtcl2IeZmBiD1j-PLsj8KlUrtrDSH-c6ZQczH-nW4cBK3F2AedMIYK1kNSBHdqcgWaB6Fvnk4BnylY72FJQWN1Y4C1jHGsd7vbVjCnBQZA==> &A), announced that it has raised another $7.5 million. Read it. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109630565269&s=8442&e=001ZTwwnT1tJK45Mhl9krftAR2q45pS9CaIGnyli3OYrHAaBxL40MoMaxNpaamcARS_9G4JGGxwD6LM4AbMSspjomaZVJ_uJpC9cHKFCyGr1ruNhovHZzw1zZ5sXrFUwzdOZQq2DCvdSdGj51fN8qlGub7N1PfPZBboGf_y8c10IOVJJ_bS_V5joqcgLhIgOqAv-ANLLgq7Yz9Ali6p1ZUIDKbETSOj7fi8>  This is not the usual large round of financing one might see in a Series C round - perhaps enough to tide the company over until sustained profitability? Crunchbase <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109630565269&s=8442&e=001ZTwwnT1tJK46W-wehy3ZsC3dWspOtHUYCrUQrCK-_qaF0BZ_QUgZwNYGAHPfh0q4ZjZDDOMchJG23kj5AxKVlU-UJaU8BffxGnkn5xK0xk0M4Eijw7cBN9ab-VF4RyoUdQ-6tv42kis=>  says this brings Sojern's total raise to $32.5 million. In the press release on the new funding, the company notes "To support Sojern's continued growth and expansion into audience targeting and data management, the company has embarked on a comprehensive rebranding campaign." 


Attribution Solution


In a press release yesterday, Adometry claims that it has launched the first attribution solution to use viewable ad impression data. The company explains the Adometry Attribute solution, "For example, if a user were served multiple ad impressions, other attribution models would give all impressions some credit. However, Adometry Attribute only assigns credit to viewed ads." The viewable impression discussion continues to burn. Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109630565269&s=8442&e=001ZTwwnT1tJK60s-z33F9SUs4ZdbJjnNv6TAMBYRNtojx-DPM88AETOuh4NabjLkoLCE1CY9WaZ1AmO3XSvWNfY0P6g9LYGp3-hq-Xa0Uh7d0oGvIXymVAgvGODZpMhnI9J_TMcCuR-sAZeE6PMYI67BQn6WGrfIud>  


Ma Ad Network


Through a partnership with Celtra, AT&T AdWorks has taken its ad network to Foursquare allowing users to "check-in" through a mobile ad banner. Adweek's Tim Peterson says that AT&am;T's ad network is growing, too, "AT&T AdWorks' interests encompass mobile as well as online and TV. In addition to 10 billion monthly mobile impressions, the network serves up 450 billion monthly online impressions and 4 billion monthly TV impressions through the AT&T U-verse service." Needless to say, cross-channel advertising capability through a single source such as AdWorks will be very compelling to advertisers if attribution can be tightly managed. Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109630565269&s=8442&e=001ZTwwnT1tJK6xCT-lJNYy_VSMJg4bq20kZ4PamJS0MWlpjfuQYVvd1Wx09dM7i9LgT5UYtF8XEbABhYfvif8yCpX4aDdUvSEWjrNyP7fVybnfNLwZK06TTVBmMTv6gzQPRw61vjEH-141dWOfje9vGd6WpyEt1EucKkV-b5ZKrSco5W6DyNBEPB9ApjG2SevTTmF38JkR7E0=> . 


Vote With Ads


Though the media business is relatively small for digital, political ads, it's growing. And Cox Digital announced that it has expanded its political ad targeting reach by cutting a new deal with David Kenny's Weather Channel. This follows a similar deal with Yahoo!. Cox Digital prez Steve Shaw tells MediaPost, "What Yahoo brings to the ballot in reach and scale, The Weather Channel brings in breadth and depth among local audiences." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109630565269&s=8442&e=001ZTwwnT1tJK5Oi9drYQDWRWGKyVVa1c9RMxsr6GnGmmEH42grklNTtbhsxNU2fpd4dgN03JU8kXChieJPF3GaujPNFmGLJu_awQF432KUAfJuEcEkv8Ch609KYcTospntVuJRQs0iZgB8B5Kzb4xicq9FRV_zRssCnIkGWBH3fXZQp3eg0KMEFM7E1VjLKmxeJ_myI0E8he9KXziaEHEiMEYkJ3R6_G1coMcnxQqGtAk=> . 


Geo Hiring


Mobile app marketing platform Fiksu says that it has opened a new office in Northampton, Massachusetts, as it looks to hire local talent. Given the talent crunch around development, future office space may be increasingly determined by available talent pools that can connect virtually to HQ. Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109630565269&s=8442&e=001ZTwwnT1tJK45x0b2I3hI1SBHTVx5bhvgdVJA9JAjC9BfFqen4zZC36OwCUC9V09SXp1GXZhhfy9lfVyjsJzXdhG6BxZ7RixA2_VcWZn1JAYY7iaxKUBekMnFu2Q9kVFlWB6cyDYAhT3gFuYEfPCfxzVEHTSsM6o2cfzWtPc4i1bhyHc7JfQFxp4Vf0SI947CFtnxJLBtaeuOy1GMG8JDALaRQzUYk1wpQpyKn6GGmdc=>  In Fiksu's case, the Northampton location is not that farfetched in that Fiksu CEO Micah Adler used to work at a nearby university.

FTC Releases Report


Evidon CEO Scott Meyer looks at the new FTC Privacy report (PDF) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109620170287&s=8442&e=001QLmPYFd_JUx5f-TG8pb0KMVnknfXmEsV8aNN6VcncgzdfIGQj3FW6DcfXye-kXRwWENuegWudOpcDwTESacDMgJd0MBFX-qx8spC38Z2QCDDafXsc2QH1S7o1OYOUX2Pll9guY18iJqPuEFr9d7gKyq7rZoiacRm>  and offers a few observations from his company's blog <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109620170287&s=8442&e=001QLmPYFd_JUwFgBsvdavD2bISoZ2IG7qOIySreB5Gfsh4o7Tx5HXkSA9-w84GHrgA6ry7pEzBxHKU0OcxxwNQ0SpMaTLfsQuEiXiSihRWVblo_qOjSoM6RmIWty26dX3fSI6Muprt7xeg0DfM7Y9RefFO2YPZ9OgsYDrCZheEWUd2uVhiJ0ngPk4nnLmnw-lK>  including, "While calling for baseline privacy legislation, [there is] no specific endorsement on any existing Bill proposed in the Congress to date." Read more from Wendy Davis on MediaPost. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109620170287&s=8442&e=001QLmPYFd_JUw54KWvZmEDSEY5fXZOpsK00nJbmkauY-1rSnjLMAdZj95KudJh2qvQI2BudzWLj1EvEdnlV6kNAjkKGNzGLsSn7kkh3Lfa85OqwUL-Crz3efh4_dLFuc5rOFFGkhLU_D0_ahc10rXi3ngx_H4gJDygHgu6MyYEzbbRXRsMgARtqcDKfr8QHMly6C4m9RG1qN3dLfauAIg7LlSpvY_4TJrVYjEsKP686D4=>  On that note, the IAB's "first-ever" privacy tweet chat will take place this Friday, March 30, from 12-1pm Eastern Time. The IAB's Mike Zaneis (@mikezaneis <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109620170287&s=8442&e=001QLmPYFd_JUwH4nxsSLJJyM5m3c3lMZC_6I-q8IbCX8C-fmrGXoAwo5G5D9IWwjRkTTz5OIOkj52TfZLnKbRuS_Bfhl8tJto9WY8Vt6KiVAXdy5KRkQkct5kdmuFUbf3U> ), "who heads the IAB's Washington, D.C. Public Policy office as Senior Vice President & General Counsel" will be driving the discussion. More info is here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109620170287&s=8442&e=001QLmPYFd_JUzfGABtgh6QupWBeZBaBorkMDaWyzgXxvZZt5XjuOWeSo5a-XtScZ64urpcrxyPzQDSM93b9DQVV_jKQxZcxynf8r1eEDPQlCQl90DmI06APg==> . 


Google Ad Spend Momentum


The Wall Street Journal looks at the ad spend increasingly pouring out of Google as it looks to promote products, smooth privacy-related feathers and gain market share in various segments - including advertising its ads capability. The WSJ's Amir Efrati says that Google's ad spending last year was well over $213 million, but it still has room to grow: "Google's ad spending last year represented 1.2% of its U.S. revenue of $17.6 billion, compared with 1.5% for both Microsoft and Apple..." Read it (subscription) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109620170287&s=8442&e=001QLmPYFd_JUx1UXYFsh8hX2I4BJ6B12jvjcbeJ5rfxfkaMWkCnbkMJlY9xVB1js6dRs_n-iWN7wYIBjjYYnVtWc-r3lnPbmQ58WcbZ_UUwWFsvHoXIR3oURLTZNVdik80HOdVG8y3PBhw6w7Fmju94nMafNwfDaf5RH0YNSCNn6khPFR5zeROwoiYOVyIYFBF> . Just think if Google had bought Groupon - that spending number would have been through the roof. Groupon had spent over $600 million <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109620170287&s=8442&e=001QLmPYFd_JUy_CXUs_3InYlmkb7aEHWEiB7PSdo8L1Mos_10xVpi6ODqncjrHIwqO0EkjMCp00nYl6wU4K6sA2nuPm-rwtn5oSKE7K4cHNVRlNcBrT4OYLxYdBpe1Pmi06v5x09gFktC4BtcUKwD_qUpCvBYxHjRmfF0E67XjNS5S0gM6AwWS-UCvSTLwejMn>  in the first three quarters of last year alone.


RTB For Video, Europe


Adap.tv and BannerConnect announced a new partnership that will give BannerConnect real-time bidding (RTB) access to real-time biddable video ad marketplace. According to the release, "The deal will also allow BannerConnect to help its publisher partners to enter the video RTB ecosystem, which will increase the availability of quality pre-roll inventory available to buyers in Europe." Read more (PDF) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109620170287&s=8442&e=001QLmPYFd_JUwZ0lpJAW2L6S6fm1vINCs71gDiGEt6Ln78PAjs2raDp8_VKNA5a48tZi_UBYWbiMAIOuUk8tE-I7hrnoV60RndWHrd5F9w11Cre3XUBuT47ZM7Gg7SabylW8uXiXNhySLYidI3j5jrFYnZ7xH6HtMTL24w7IxmGBXlwxwSG4m4NBNOZ6zjaE7RYeq9INZ8zeU=> . 


In Defiant Defense


Former Right Media Exchange CEO Mike Walrath shakes off a few raspberries thrown his way in a follow-up to his original Tumblr post on what Yahoo! should do with Right Media <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109620170287&s=8442&e=001QLmPYFd_JUyhSWl8nEaI_W55QpNxMtbc4F0FSh3_ocBkdDDFU3fdIokAn6ItEyE2tEgctNztFSsY3W6Nktshsk1RIza_bkvOzjzTTZFqe3FVGZ2Z7CPhHiH86ON_Wys_pxFn5g4gEdADdMVbtTSorL9-yUaoL8kctOekL826rwc=> . To detractors who declared he was filled with self-importance, Walrath looks to the heavens with arms extended and states defiantly, "When I was starting Right Media, popular opinion was that ad exchanges had been tried and had failed and that this attempt would fail as well. I, and other like minded people on the Right Media team chose to go ahead anyway, because we thought we knew something everyone else didn't. We thought our alternative vision of the world was better than what existed. We thought we were right and the naysayers (most people) were wrong. We felt our opinions were more IMPORTANT than the opinions than others. Self importance." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109620170287&s=8442&e=001QLmPYFd_JUx1Vpo_pOesn04fku1a50H4aPEd6r6rDRSz4Gffbf7dPZWcRdw3GDl0ReoZM3qE_DcBLE4XFz1CUWZwfkRhJjYB6DYJ46QtCG6EpS7dUjm5aGznuU8Xvm0NFRanEYXc9xL_PP-msswkLY6TrsKkNh-V5qQBTn1jn_JDBKBDBdVakA==>  


No Yielding To Competitors


In an opinion piece on Digiday, Rubicon Project CEO says - unsurprisingly given the competitive set - that the Google-Admeld deal isn't a good deal for publishers. He claims Google's Admeld will play favorites, "Google wants to keep 100 percent of the revenue from an ad placed on its own publishing property; therefore, GoogleMeld is naturally motivated to place the best-performing ads on Google properties first." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109620170287&s=8442&e=001QLmPYFd_JUyBN_t2b7QYU1UgYv0vxgC375Wm_lxK-GiOtS6SUOuqV8cAgQfLOpmDbfVqZGwkdKxbl13CRVPTiCkFsAnC5dNrrq5_iyAZ_pCbcaygj8L_fTfsPEqoghbrnoInbH4eJCBAmUP1ULthoKmvPK7Mb-qDhaf4vgLdMkM=>  And, read another "Case Against Google" on Gizmodo (source: @MellorTime <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109620170287&s=8442&e=001QLmPYFd_JUwUybaNzs7OJpQ3ftVLZ54AxTzKjpu0r_BbTGm14r18d_GtF7cn9pGNaU77wXoiRblq4uJXMMhIrwc0TCYe0SBfOgr-6CT8uE1boHmiWQaMohRThpGP9BCUP34Dpi0I6nD_QNMF_pD7o6F_RWIttQmFgHWS7zAb5tWqTFNEh6eoQg==> ). 


Marketing Yield


PubMatic announced the hiring of Larry Harris (LinkedIn <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109620170287&s=8442&e=001QLmPYFd_JUwda7GEwtP6Lysh_yRfXATIhkUEdUk3avYxhuyKb-mkeuhLWp4VPKb22dJDSTD4YN8a3RKa8xRRAw6im-_Rh75huhclg75CppgZGy9mHP1aAuj_N5jWYUalHHBbxthW_WcBEYT7lkeLeanlF4_Nd50o> ) as Chief Marketing Officer. Harris was the former CEO and co-founder of Ansible Mobile (IPG), which may lend itself well to PubMatic's recently announced focus on mobile and the acquisition of MobiPrimo. Also, according to the release, "Harris served as Executive Vice President of Integrated Marketing for Draftfcb, where he built and led the global technology team and oversaw the company's relationship with Interpublic." His agency experience may also speak to the need to attract buy-side participation through PubMatic's sell-side platform. Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109620170287&s=8442&e=001QLmPYFd_JUwGvZEC387U3Pf3qvfDh_Cc_Cw-AGVKOsH7WageML7WLv3RF1fkNTGWsK7UTobkweFv6ierYtGCGDip47yJRylRLLDGYcq-2Coilqc_EgcupQ==>  


First-Party Data


Google announced from its DoubleClick For Publisher blog new audience segmentation capabilities from first-party data. If you're offering first-party, data management capabilities for publishers, well, Google is now in your competitive set - just like they were yesterday. From the blog, "First-party segmentation involves no implementation or integration effort by you. Simply define the criteria you want for your audience segments, in DFP and DoubleClick technology does the work of populating them directly from the ad tag." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109620170287&s=8442&e=001QLmPYFd_JUwx_PkMBmH8nYcPTtwa9Z12JYvASZv5ljrDEC6GeQNdRz828FKYMl7iygTJ4co-okFve0yYnlVBkGjdwC4bpK641HsdcvOc0a1-uPrJh4Ym5pvypf1W9lBFVOIxLbYnInV8qJxl-CPpbuO6Nyh3TpxzFUy0vV1QCKuzfYcyGg4MwcwQuxdEfK57CS3Vq__nFfc=>  By the way, did you know Google was doing a limited beta of in-stream, video ad inventory in DoubleClick Ad Exchange? Read about it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109620170287&s=8442&e=001QLmPYFd_JUzz6dQ3MRO6v5tvI0PSFnYv5YoWsKOLo12Egs-lSf0i6pHDBXfyF_u7aaDb1aJjXJJOp6q9GEZ84GhsrmTGjEbtfonQ5BZRXrQbctJtRYAOFJtDlWAQ-MOtEMnIjB-82E4vrx8smYIVlFm2IIVk-B1gI_9zCmLiPc0jg98PbfacvDGN-omLT5Ed> .


Leave Me Alone


Mojiva's Mocean Mobile ad serving unit has released a new "State of Mobile Ad Serving" study which evidently says that maybe all the data everyone talks about is just a bit too much for the mobile side of the house - at least for now. According to the study, "Few respondents find intra-day reporting (5%) and publisher access for revenue reporting (15%) to be important functions of a mobile ad-server." Intra-day dashboards make more sense as mobile revenues scale. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109620170287&s=8442&e=001QLmPYFd_JUx85N9qNJqkr1lwjelmgn-RRhQ1UTA2x-8LRSBF9HWb45SRa3y5ZMfvqwzBcm08kzjmRYXU1YWdKmtkCRYFMNPniD6iFdxNmit8bOM6KiHkqAKwim7DoSWdk03jeSGbhc3djI_O_VfY2UbH7f7ps4XEvlJK-6sqwuPm1eyOM2nsfGyjvUPHVk_397XxCmbYE1Do7IVQwSpthrq38IhRNYd_QU2-pcyeRaAyZY62we2sjvWbnnPtGXGY> . Perhaps, Mocean's findings explain the heart of Phunware's Alan Knitowski's post on The Business Insider when he writes, "Digital and mobile managers are extremely well intentioned for their brands, but they are also extremely overwhelmed right now as the amplitude of the mobile market noise currently far exceeds any discernible underlying signal that is easy for them to see, hear or recognize." Come on feel the noise. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109620170287&s=8442&e=001QLmPYFd_JUwqrOgy3pw3a4gq8sG2jyJkfU3iC0Msx0m1lRpXphl6BSGkFsX_rj3I1rpLh25AL-SvxBHEFMcHfUeo0M3LeRwUbukMqIMhLghphM24C7B5QR7j41yuNJBVZsG_ZgIQLuD8JyLZ8t8zXSW_I984pbTCgHbtWDbOuos=>  


Offline And Online


BlueKai CEO Omar Tawakol's presentation from the recent OMMA Display conference is summarized on his company's blog. Among other themes that Tawakol is evidently considering today is where data management platforms (DMPs) need to evolve to. From the blog: "They need to get away from just offering display solutions and become digital in scope. They need to open themselves up to the enterprise where they can merge both online and offline data. It's vitally important to be ahead of the curve. The more intelligence pumped into a DMP, the better the results." Read more talking points. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109620170287&s=8442&e=001QLmPYFd_JUwJYs0CkslV3m4Alu1-Vaxwf5H1-dNRrThGC5LjV0wWVgcvs-WULgvP_a8XPgb8gAroamgUVUNBzZVvWH77sgvb9pq4wnz7hm_URgHnVidiWQ-F2as6pwSOJgvBlz4Xp3PPfxmo-Fz_sSwYFV-ljUDxlJhFl7XJLE71an5Ca7plk0fqu7Ls9O_iiRwvffqDtpuCZWIPy6DDHw==>  


It's In The Data


Former CEO Judy Gern of dynamic creative optimization firm Adroit Interactive (acquired by MediaMath in 2010 <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109620170287&s=8442&e=001QLmPYFd_JUzQ2eHWaEQ-U2Yh4T4Rx-6DZ-FzvGkSV0blp7W0Vsv4_-dyPXkboDFA-3l3E8wl0Bd7yHYy3a4TPKQFmS5Pz92_1zy1lvpf9W7jy4eLL5jQZyfw9eaFURmCUl9fBqo9Ph-EJNw_xAs8aJEmnA8-v3vKcKvv9tSAT2cnYnAZGFfvK1zAKwD0qi-KeALgZJkltP4PzYwQpvlVl8NU-25ud0Ma> ) remains enamored with display and its creative opportunities. In a think piece on iMedia Connection, she sees conversation as a central component of a successful display campaign, but adds "how do we jumpstart conversations that are meaningful and relevant to each viewer, scaled across millions of viewers? Well, we need data to do that -- or else we're shooting in the dark." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109620170287&s=8442&e=001QLmPYFd_JUzWSXTUZZoaKTXjZrCfjPLNEQ0IUzlvuzCpv8GTwT6ZYfqe84yHRH6IXDI9cK9FsWvkdWbNLJPcFzMpT-fGQta7_LJhC4zgSvEiYo77Kj5W_Ot7anHH7Bqj4Nz36oI9U6yollP5cxQs2iliBcxLSCfFUjYo3--F7po=>

*	Monday, March 26, News Round-Up <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109602812744&s=8442&e=001QKqItyuLXKQ3wVDvGZlRWzsexhLO5AKDM3fxBrY5-auhSitcu4j3g9hiwJ-YFwQjY9VzlH3o2Do7KPyA1NkEZF4w79SI8eTn0cF1u577tgHyBkejBgUzy7vO0GgcySz5tam3y3IcJGjMa-QAsbdgjbOY62TU8vc3h-v6mbyEqUw=>  (see below)
*	State Of PubMatic: CEO Goel On Apps, Impact of Google-Admeld And Milestones Ahead <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109602812744&s=8442&e=001QKqItyuLXKRNOgt2pZLrcA0TF7yAt0BjQXkwgCCmY7XOLDUEl7L8_zBuO9kcG4icRYhmV_oiunQ-ECHXtu5le_tNh8M5qOnRPiK6zQZUIM7kCxLaMisHqOAUFonLnp86iPQnWV9Jstr6dWfqFgrk3g==>  "There are absolutely aspects of our offering that are exchange-like. It's important to understand where this has evolved from - which is helping publishers maximize the yield and revenue for their media and audience. There are a couple of approaches for doing that...." (visit AdExchanger.com) 
*	AdExchanger Comics... RTB Games <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109602812744&s=8442&e=001QKqItyuLXKSdfni-EAzjwY_pwKkPEgVTyeH5WDK8vIMJW-ACXz4IiH5Qd3WWewj6fpO0XqFvEdP75H1brb3dxQB37jLi4H0V7r1QhM5jSEyfviXyHLBH5neiZDfHjWKgni-kz8xnOTao5f4aiyXnG8Lk4vGDwG2-miZS0C_KIbg=>  (visit AdExchanger.com)
*	In The Comments of  <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109602812744&s=8442&e=001QKqItyuLXKSoaRlYXfcNY7QMzS0a2s8TU2xoV3GMunydyVm0pRQTsRhbC5hhlaGmXcZhp2wW7vbWgkP6lsfATCf2RkBTG7djbbAVwljC6u3syRLFw5K3ebMdpEaqAEJdh0r4c-KEgwK9pyGMrkSGUN4D7Oxyi2451sK8Pt6KPTexPqY4W4v0A2L1jZ0BqjD7qCxfOfmxdfI=> "Private Exchanges from a Premium Publisher Perspective - What Does It All Mean?" "I believe we're all doing a disservice to the industry by continuing to use the 'private exchange' term so broadly with multiple meanings. I'd love to see the term possibly go away completely and instead be replaced with more descriptive and precise new terminology. The other point I want to make is that I'm generally of the belief that the 'private' part of private exchange is not such a good idea. It might make sense in use case #1 if it's "private" with respect to who is selling, i.e. a seller leveraging their own brand equity to create their own marketplace...." (visit AdExchanger.com)

Targeting iOS UDID


If you want to use Apple's UDID to target or track users through Apple devices, TechCrunch's Kim Mai Cutler says the long-awaited deprecation through iOS (read Bob Walczak's opinion last August on the UDID <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109602812744&s=8442&e=001QKqItyuLXKSu4Yw88Kt8Rkj7FUT3AchQOwjwJCnhnZo10f_PUwZHBd1zGxYQIjZljQbOu1CwZwhP614z6lahETHbCB0WVwOAoD87FW5_veH7cf_VRAT2epwVCBi8BErFTUBjMPFJzslpJFUR9hmNKuHpquKSLaEaC7yLXAVAFSs=> ) has finally started. Cutler writes, "Two of the 10 [Apple] review teams started doing blanket rejections of apps that access UDIDs this week. Next week, that will rise to four the ten teams, and keep escalating until all 10 teams are turning down apps that are still using UDIDs. This is a big deal because mobile ad networks use these ID numbers to make their advertising better targeted." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109602812744&s=8442&e=001QKqItyuLXKRknT9OsCxWrU77s8RAL8bPPnUntKDXE06TeBN8UFGSWgD6CCyMYPTXvuHu6PVxUgl_JHdM17H3CNVSvNg5TUWPVCKr6sV8YydPDoKxhE2JMRe_5f-sBxCueHpqevF3OiTXd5Omr3pxIw==>  


Give Me Futures


Newspaper owner Forum Communications says that it hasn't benefited financially - other than more ad network dollars - from a recent burst in traffic due to a now famous restaurant reviewer, and is quoted by Ad Age's Matt Creamer as saying, "Having a nationwide exchange, or placement service to take advantage of these unforeseen bursts." Creamer adds, "There is a strong sense that something is missing from the online-ad ecosystem, namely a service that allows national advertisers to take advantage of these tough-to-predict spikes in traffic and attention." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109602812744&s=8442&e=001QKqItyuLXKSUZXU8Ky_jmQrfUJ1bzAdX3WLZjgDOFJsYquwNplciYjCTmDJkPI-QtUwz_jJy0J4_UaAIhl3zCJUorGP1FP8dQf1Zfydb3teRVNx_RNf1R6bIxwAiqAdcRsFSNOG8eR9hOBLEGiXCbdy2FznubDxVpSqteO5JIle-WJ3K3vLFT5OgrlexbMnx> . How about an event-based, media futures exchange with event categories for purchase?


Retargeting The CFO


Display retargeter Criteo may have gotten another step closer to its long-rumored IPO as the company announced late last week the the hiring of former SAP SVP and Chief Financial Officer for the EMEA region Benoit Fouilland as its CFO. According to the release, "At SAP, [Fouilland] was responsible for managing all financial activities and for driving the growth and profitability strategies for the EMEA region, which contributed to approximately half of SAP group revenues..." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109602812744&s=8442&e=001QKqItyuLXKTB0T-z66pGKSKFZMjf_f2U8f3vDvHrIi18iI9DttNei_4j4Yyy40gqh_PkoyhSge_RfOuYS6OV3W8SG785y0ptdfBZwvPIcGvoV_71SP4umuqtVl2zFiaMQ-HisJ3tZ47QLm6OxWorA1Uf5tcUrHYHAoS0n0l1TnP9nN-sgUWRI4DZkNto8lY_idvt8xGK8qjrvO9PHfn873O_1q2F48RMhcIjv5aQSC4hXxa1JK2spA==>  


Agencies Transform


The American Association of Advertising Agencies (4A's) annual meeting takes this week in Los Angeles. See the site <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109602812744&s=8442&e=001QKqItyuLXKRNihsShzKD5o4eO6hUfQes1MSVPq2kUhcsT05MBJBNdR7HeTXyNfTiyRqyvwl4bxXfMhtbskGSj-yQ7O5Hrwo-13QJZgOWPltvoE2ONfnlfroZDtidBSOV> . Social and Data are themes as WPP Group CEO Sir Martin Sorrell begins the conference's presentations with "Technology, Data and Social Media: Does It Make Us All Different or All the Same?" View the agenda. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109602812744&s=8442&e=001QKqItyuLXKTawLObfhBT2iJI_GRUpPufjL20viQ1m05wLA5Gs_3arilDu62vt8lJ1hHubQtnblVVWM8rRgBLWxWuDqvTk92WCfu6XmphTGmR0MRvgo13HKRLBYC5ylbk21HIz-d1htv_NqA2cC691g==>  The 4As meeting has come a long way as it bridges its traditionally-focused membership to a digital future. Proof point: there's a panel on agency trading desks (ATDs) and demand-side platforms (DSPs). Also, the 4As is looking to supercharge recruiting efforts for the agency lifestyle with the Open Advertising initiative. Read more about it in The New York Times <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109602812744&s=8442&e=001QKqItyuLXKRGQW_vIYXxDskXVTHF-hpx3aEIJnbLIIjkW_H7JtQsZudnz5B7KZVFlaczLwiaVglc9w9o9S-5yqThPhjnnjLAk6YYMwnsJu5MkC4ZpcwKbM8UFQLx_x6INJOGWZNuopLyM_e6QLeWFo9UV1m_1smFzyog-rxiJodm715j3RNvJh58G0owIQNXBpSZWC4KHhRsIv3ADsfNloFKGF-iK4Vl887fQrEs2--IF-aVrfctUw==> .


Akamai, Ads & The Cloud


CDN and owner of retargeter Acerno's tech - now known as Akamai's Advertising Decision Solutions <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109602812744&s=8442&e=001QKqItyuLXKTeVYUh5BM9MxMjkiXkCvLKt50-qSx9A0I70qca84rgYEN5BcfSjcxhYRN55nL7OvDFil9dMT2F05jjFuAqcVscrp9uVexswZYGIUlqtUBfLb8jgXAeuIySUjOCtjN2MXE_4DZdCkv8SYj-khdS7pgq9hNrgPRhQ1AaTZ9QVuLtlBsv5aZ1pqeTupKuvi-TLNBZYY6sWdmqlrmPaXVXmbwOoXD5yQDi8VfRA4XHhZBVmVD5V2X17p0A>  line - has its eye on a new revenue target as Reuters reports that CEO Paul Sagan wants $5 billion in revenue by 2020. Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109602812744&s=8442&e=001QKqItyuLXKQaor7DZ-QbMjxYpkZTSByeLIs_1_JUEtxmZjH8ZAvTg6hYcqmRHSbJ37qjprOX5me5LM82U3EOJh1W9YX8RxdW2koBglxl-VwkxiH3DNtozPMuT731lEs7PaGQ4ThFRUsKELJ3yOwsEoqpmpj-pWg1ptbP1OXpxp884mU2nb8WnNP3epSIlNmi> . Akamai crossed the $1 billion mark in 2010. Mobile, video, security and the cloud are the steps to the $5 billion future said Sagan. Except for security, the others could mean media and ads - which now falls under Akamai's new Aqua Web solutions unit <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109602812744&s=8442&e=001QKqItyuLXKTbfTuj2illmTS8eKCjjNhVbO2S1JfiN6zkIKG1W5WiWym6HmaeAB9v3uAzM6i0RyMvE8sz_dy7o1mwBbmiP6opFsz-8_eQmi5bft-3OghpgCibM84oI5e3lx3adxXgspaZKebeDImowFU0qMh3uUFS> . 


Content Marketing Abuses


In an opinion piece on ClickZ, Evolve Media Corp. CEO Brian Fitzgerald says there are problems with today's traffic acquisition strategies for publishers - also known as content marketing: "...the negative practice that I am seeing more and more in my interactions with third-party publishers is that people are buying traffic more as a means of arbitraging ad spends than they are as a means of growing the long-term value of their publishing brand." He sees good practices, too. Read it. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109602812744&s=8442&e=001QKqItyuLXKSRiV9DmTSprKdZ0doZ17YKL71Ltqsl_kpEoKH4A1jVzVi-Ikpo_cY8xQXZt_yA7HriBfPn4c2hqqrEXCxZGZEd1jhI4wrZXcTH44n8dkCWf2ltoM52Ey0bTXRcM54zpIekV0l3i36eLgTCKfiw-sljVN5wbnkx_ws=>  


Search Retargeting With Bing


On the Microsoft Ads blog, James Colborn explains how search retargeting works with Microsoft's search engine Bing. Colborn is careful to remind readers that no PII is used in the targeting process and offers a few tips including one on campaign setup: "...if a keyword drives 90 percent of searches in your campaign, with Bing Search Remessaging that equates to 90 percent of the display campaign budget being consumed by that one term (unlike traditional search advertising where the payment happens on the click, with Search Remessaging it's on the impression). This is particularly important if your client has strong performance objectives..." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109602812744&s=8442&e=001QKqItyuLXKRwPCU0i0aUG5SZeeQkQaUr0_uET0pRjX6TY0zKq4kaiPuDUIT1bVR2BCZPeE6Ej2m8zxR1iX5zGTt6U3-Fn9MVq4c4_lNhV1DVaY2L1e-8RSIdkkh2TrLjDHUtBS8pNKIipwtMgvtkSXf3T7_V7FRwhNE1pptb9Jc2SmQe3A5T9O2KpnLtwwHYKDmXwzDS4VvBrxE3-cIVbIRG0vcZG21UyG0eA0cLBospPyU6s26nbg==>  Google still hasn't started implementing the search retargeting feature for its search engine as, perhaps, concerns around the perception of a consumer's privacy loom.


Dutch Display


From ExchangeWire, a new report from Deloitte and The Netherlands' IAB says that "Despite slow economic growth and declining consumer confidence, the Dutch online advertising market was over 1bn in 2011 - a year on year uplift of 12%. However, the lagging economy has an effect on the outlook for 2012; participants expect growth to slow to 7.7% for 2012. The online display number of 336 million is up 11% on last year's figure." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109602812744&s=8442&e=001QKqItyuLXKS6tX-ahb3ceTtxEQHk146O_9HcRZYoFTH9yRpmYVGFG9Im53G6IffA565irbVv6dKr7_48ncDdLcSV-B24Ef0R7duBVZp79BcCOAUXDOET8Mb5e4z_CoMF4FVPkle9S8C0L0lkpD1VPo00eGqUm_BFl0OO_y_GzY2JiYcYI9SKCthn_DWZzFcbrWNnOQ8TsGutN4ifCwWRbfyEaBX8uMkbRcPsxBAJoUp-LzYaO6Qhe1b22w_8G4ab2kVeKH0TDitv2uZrkU93MvUE2dpKqcqG0xL0C2QOu7E=> 


Cisco And Video (Ads)


With rumors swirling that it might cut back its video initiatives, Cisco CEO John Chambers tell the Atlanta-Journal Constitution the opposite. AJC's Russell Grantham writes, "Six years after Cisco Systems bought Scientific Atlanta, high-tech giant Cisco says its metro Atlanta acquisition is critical to its efforts to profit off the rising tide of video streaming around the globe."Cisco has "a huge commitment to video," John Chambers, Cisco's longtime CEO and chairman, said in a telephone interview..." Will the commitment ever come to video ads? It would seem inevitable considering the data pulsing through those video pipes that can used to address advertising. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109602812744&s=8442&e=001QKqItyuLXKSWf3z21fkYjaXS9EjhEhUx4Cg5v7ym4yX396_Ak9975sPp0Us0GkkRWPTwT9FGyRZrbR240UICCr6uH0mwVHQhZ1wAPtZDskta26iYfxR9BxVD9Chs6-_3LwM5JwiZJ_anW56_7hv7iCkZtRmvkYe8EO4wSKNqk5Q=> . 


Thinking Display Troika 


On Ad Age, MediaMath CEO Joe Zawadzki offers his commentary on how Yahoo!-Aol-Microsoft can make their partnership on non-guaranteed display ad inventory successful. He writes, "To make this work, the portals' sales forces will have to change drastically. The portals have to get good at selling 10% of their inventory with unique and amazing integrations. The other 90% they must sell programmatically -- and do it better than anyone else. In both cases, they should focus on marketer results rather than media properties." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109602812744&s=8442&e=001QKqItyuLXKRz_1kT3j7XZe82-2spwDdwUqa7wFAiYwh-UZyJcYKpMmh2Vh-SFJqNnO04Bl4ZOeDMRjmKZCshnWm-xGhfG_feoIkeAUMLSF6kvdkYmMPfSEDPLUkW-OxhBAdSP8_JlZKd4q_vv2xjW-ObSmG0reoBGeu8505aynNA8YdtakiOlK_IJN7x_TGedSCTBO0CjEY=> .


Like Water For Ads


On Digiday, Jack Marshall explores innovation with mobile ad banner format and how gamification is replacing banner ads with rewards. Quoting fitness app product manager Chris Goode at MapMyRun, Marshall writes, "The rewards model is a better fit for it than banners - and less interruptive to the experience. 'We're serving up ads for free water when people have finished their run and hydration is on their mind.' Users actually appreciate it which is a far cry from user's usual interactions with advertising, especially in mobile..." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109602812744&s=8442&e=001QKqItyuLXKR2iaBaf0K5LDiWB__6DhOXq0xsE35i3VMvlSLp05DJj2teLfs1kNgeWAVAaVCZ6JVlT1L4qCsjTpLW04SYpw1czU1_lqiogPXSmwV0emfhqnx9cpxC_50THp3c4O396yNpSGNbge7s-utirUWrtChfiOa8VbppZr21-Fo2c5fCGw==>

Publishers can start by looking at their unsold inventory. (visit AdExchanger.com)

Updating Display


Google is more clearly bubbling up the display opportunity for search marketers with a new update to AdWords. According to the Inside AdWords blog, in the weeks ahead, display is getting its own tab in the Adwords interface and will be "built from the ground up to run display campaigns." To date, display campaigns are more of a feature of search in the interface. Will the long tail bite? - certainly if they understand retargeting. What's more - Google says it has upgraded its contextual engine to allow for optimization of a contextual, display campaign down to an "individual keyword level." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109591529313&s=8442&e=001zgCX-zv8H3g9aC1d7nCpLnKzu8TAtjU__aD_XAexyQZLwhMGT4vfGlIeLJeqNLTU8TXawYdB_AkpWCf9ELsqxVLZSoQZZso-7YQieUA3XCVOJzUNtNmbyrYND5ynzExLAWP-Q0C-Dk5EJA2ch6jIuImcRgk3LktqSxp1FHB5DiDvoZstebU2-g==> . ClickZ's Susan Kuchinskas looks at the update and quotes SEM Zach Morrison who "thinks Google's upgrade of the AdWords buying system is a shot across the bows of DSPs. 'This is Google saying, "We know display is going toward DSPs, but GDN is here to stay - and this is why it's better than those other guys."'" Saber rattling! Read it. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109591529313&s=8442&e=001zgCX-zv8H3jcIdCYdoFb_zn8S_H7Ak2Yu5NccxuJYfI9tTMz4sp9TcrF313ztoWbQd3rDIRjwQ7ETs4GGOFO4KZzQXRg-lIgvXe5kuD3XpnfyJQuc0NXYFLmYk-rBPcdxb2jy-KyIbbNq0Ay4hVnSTr74puqlpkvU6kY5URXAkfZV0QBn2VwRlg31aU08Jf8>  


RTB For Social Video


Adweek's Ki Mae Heussner covers a new partnership between video demand-side platform TubeMogul and transactional advertising platform Trialpay that claims to offer real-time bidding of social video audience. She explains, "Unlike companies that serve preroll video elsewhere on the Web, TrialPay doesn't charge advertisers on a CPM basis, but only for fully viewed ads, Rampell explained. Also, the ads are only seen by those self-selecting into the process-presumably those with an actual interest in the content and, potentially, an intent to buy." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109591529313&s=8442&e=001zgCX-zv8H3i-RHL-Qwu4w1WeLeEf29kHZCAqZ4U738JK6xir4r1iNAwIZJUDKKxPYI44wabnCfhqE3j9Og776HDn1ymPYgYwQT1wBj53KhPz1rIdhwMm5YFgkSvyxUYGNwRsGEyFbNIBDvZlmS0Of3c14lTjcVVXJQvy_oQQlF42NljXBjGQ9E_Jk5VGlcOr0KwR94AGE69TLc0_wUL70v_IQMyGXLyW>  And, read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109591529313&s=8442&e=001zgCX-zv8H3j1wWM5DDSIUT0vPFnuw3FBMBjxr7NfoBp_4XxcmSTrPAA4t-Nuw7E_0nAsc_7gUzEJnAXLkHDdPSBgmzoA7V4xXydkavMy_TrYjjU3VEHulkwC8moBFbYbDc5fXMT7zvUcLkb_7QKSDg==> . 


Merging The Workflow


Mediaocean CEO Bill Wise provides his company's story to New Media Age and discusses the ramification of an agency OS. NMA's Lucy Tesseras explains the near-term challenge, "Ahead of the Mediaocean Operating System launch, the company is looking to take all its digital assets, of which it has 23 since merging the companies, and combine them to create a new digital product portfolio, which will happen over the next six to nine months." Merge more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109591529313&s=8442&e=001zgCX-zv8H3ju4-bdbYMVkktPWzbsFx6x_CdRACtL3t0MLtwuzhS6SZgUmjAWdlkT2gYJkA09bluyXwGjt566cwleqVo0RAd83buicxAlsN8_y83loVH50TftbPHzs6-Joy4MpQcPqm08atsa3JyHv11Ui63juE7yDame-3kWq4KLj5ddTbtsf3lUu0Elh67X9aP5gu1sIDWsNN1D4PA3XBIHL9DvxV62T_TRBNaFlLM=>  


Aggregating Apps


PubMatic is the latest to get into the "app" game with "PubLink" as the iTunes-inspired app model continues to sweep over online advertising with companies like Flite, Adzerk and AppNexus adding plug-and-play functionality which connects to a variety of solutions or "apps." According to the release, "Publishers can access seven different categories of point solutions via PubLink: audience data, ad verification and privacy controls, enhanced analytics, malware scanning, self-serve ad serving, mobile content optimization and mobile ad serving and mediation." Read it. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109591529313&s=8442&e=001zgCX-zv8H3gHtNLW58ySsHM4uAWBn3QpyBd7b2UaSkIsQeSQ5q0SoRDJJhnsyCHqi10p8jag6h7Xaqnc9_cesEO2kgN8F7YXCnwK4w5J5pPyZekrVe47j5-6WBA4FxhuMpxgOAQhOh19hyqxGQbb6g==>  


IPOs And Agencies


Marketing automation and email marketing company ExactTarget Inc. gained 32 percent in its first day as a publicly-traded company. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109591529313&s=8442&e=001zgCX-zv8H3h4Ekbl0GSNZgA2-esAnQvMIT70g5C4XjV1jbrGLCXcG_Qq2xYeeOY0O_VyU4QSVV31Ahz0IhWW1K0__j3CWSGQE5_N_D8WyzWSxBcpTDfXAxzSfEx5fuzp1dWt-y2Zn6TKgCv5bZNzSVSUMMFE3_NvqdtTmq43ayIksNvlIgMXyIocmZFefvZLfSEiR8yqAkH6BueiH3J5NA==> . The IPO market is starting to look pretty darn good. According to Bloomberg that gives ExactTarget a valuation at yesterday's close of $1.6 billion <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109591529313&s=8442&e=001zgCX-zv8H3jAVc8aFF2Bu71kgMJ8Uvc3792W9RNRodAGOxfi-VQRE8FggsUbIe1_oNhlRD-cqPEF948MJSCssTgfC4ySzce_4QJ2jlWlMlc26q5dpcS7DcB9x677lYTBTIB0A0i2Q0Y=>  - and that's on 2011 sales of a little over $200 million. With some ad tech companies wondering how they're going to exit, adding a (more robust) services layer and selling (more) media on top of their existing tech may be a way to go. Employees might be ecstatic, too, if you believe this article on  <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109591529313&s=8442&e=001zgCX-zv8H3iiQ3Ndc1-Sz5uUyuavLoPJFNMfjoJWmafwWdDA98oeq9uqJLZVWLvEIw-QINoAolV2XLJqSf4GrBBll4rB9gGu4ict7p8_2EA5XBGLo7Sfd1yc4dL9OH9j2sQzGkCWvl3otE5E7-mYG0AjD_kcku00a38H24CoG7eeES7h8uWfYA==> "equity culture." 


Buying Video Ads


On The Business Insider, 24/7 Media's Larry Allen offers to advertisers a think piece on the ins and out of buying online video advertising. He writes about inventory challenges, "Early on just about any pre-roll ad was worth about $35+, so increasing the volume seemed logical. Some companies would even set the video to auto play when the page loaded and classified it as pre-roll, regardless of whether the consumer actually engaged with the content." And today... read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109591529313&s=8442&e=001zgCX-zv8H3jc6GZmSKfdWvZ2Ms_1JVRpaYzprhQ2G3TymBHiRe004N9bPFC61cajd8bra9V7sBa3-Lr-LdWXqX9RrQJiPfTADFpCYMsMrlndQmk1zJGXKZVdBuqmr9nrGXSbu9_SYZ0Mf09_URVGA1r5pLOTEqYRwEp3OwFByY0=>  


Sales Spectacular


Upstream Group's Doug Weaver revisits some research on the world sales and writes, "...trying to win long-term loyalty through product innovation turns out to be fool's errand. Turns out that our customers are often just playing along with our own obsession with feature comparison. So then how does one create a sustainable loyalty advantage?" As it turns out, there are many ways. Feed your inner seller. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109591529313&s=8442&e=001zgCX-zv8H3jEyLMHc34xuIp08sCjaky8OrZxxr1Ic9qmbojf8XrKVKhQ-l3bzKX23jywbi9BZJLht5I3RyG4hsaq0xqKjes8kJAp-TDLb5ZF1ufbOdIHa6Z1x95ydLXbtQdTVzDhK37KMF4WGzU0QQ==>

Optimizing The News

For Thursday, March 22, 2012

Today From AdExchanger.com...



*	Thursday, March 22, News Round-Up <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109583582699&s=8442&e=0014e5Mp1LokOprCYZTSckxsR27iNx_jrxhQKQj2uSPmqUwME4yCSOaqiPIlFNvoW2MvOotLZsDEIXaYQKt_e-zWNqSUMMLN4vnywa1kuJplSsSi5ThLYam0kstbc850s0OYbRg4s79m090WxPV1lholNHEfE7v5I_KRZkp-lDFjQ0=>  (see below)
*	The State Of RadiumOne: CEO Chahal Says Company Building Signal, Targeting Social Ads On Open Web <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109583582699&s=8442&e=0014e5Mp1LokOp_WjXf8t16zIXymylNO1_nb82nzfPsd8FqOU57yuSSdix3lMmdevUE0bxoP234y_1l7l5D7P7xiSO37H2iUoTTSAdaL7P86lEKVk7LfquNHkwwlO0ECjZzhUAM7gORIpkYMaBIJMEL9In4rGfsmfVM6UpJsRQQ_uWO93Lct3MswQ==>  "But if you're an ad network trying to rep long tail sites, the value proposition you have goes away because the demand isn't going to be there. The demand's going to go to the DSPs and trading desks. If you don't have enough ads at a premium rate, you serve the inventory that is funneled through exchanges. So the thing that will happen is a slow death..." (visit AdExchanger.com) 
*	GraphEffect CEO Borow Sees Facebook Sponsored Stories As Opportunity - And A Shift In Advertising <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109583582699&s=8442&e=0014e5Mp1LokOoIrEQkCPuuDBw57BmvMAh6EACfzcyLLb-bvMWbu7mK4ukTXU8opLcVa1QqfI65LaRG52ydlahrJflyCgInMd0ArJfOxzPvDUXaHs3eVyyQMh_jn6b33s-jJlIEZgUY5v4_MCLKMZfrSKotMlwBe_yn>  "What we want people to understand the most is about Sponsored Stories as a means of advertising. It is not something traditional. Facebook is truly disrupting the way marketing is done and if advertisers commit to creating great content, they are going to have success on Facebook..." (visit AdExchanger.com)
*	In The Comments on  <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109583582699&s=8442&e=0014e5Mp1LokOoIrEQkCPuuDBw57BmvMAh6EACfzcyLLb-bvMWbu7mK4ukTXU8opLcVa1QqfI65LaRG52ydlahrJflyCgInMd0ArJfOxzPvDUXaHs3eVyyQMh_jn6b33s-jJlIEZgUY5v4_MCLKMZfrSKotMlwBe_yn> "Four Ways Viewable Impressions Will Change The Industry":  "It's quite a different thing to say the majority of online ads are never viewed (really big shocking statement) versus saying you can't measure many of the ads because of how they are served." (visit AdExchanger.com)
*	In The Comments on  <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109583582699&s=8442&e=0014e5Mp1LokOoIrEQkCPuuDBw57BmvMAh6EACfzcyLLb-bvMWbu7mK4ukTXU8opLcVa1QqfI65LaRG52ydlahrJflyCgInMd0ArJfOxzPvDUXaHs3eVyyQMh_jn6b33s-jJlIEZgUY5v4_MCLKMZfrSKotMlwBe_yn> "Private Exchanges from a Premium Publisher Perspective - What Does It All Mean?":  "...there are really just two options for a publisher approaching a private exchange/ RTB strategy: 1. place your premium inventory in a private exchange and charge $14 as opposed to the $10 you get direct; hope that buyers are willing to pay 40% more for the privilege of using their DSP..." (visit AdExchanger.com)

Measuring Across


Following yesterday's blog post <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109583582699&s=8442&e=0014e5Mp1LokOpf9q9oVq7cZUx3-zTTFMNt_k9KVNWQgsupS3wLvlbCdA_EhYMlEi-C2kiNy6CnGGpn2MuCqCeS-t7WXTYLmOOnCueqR0Ay4ldkgnDT9304tenvixcKfwXOdjAWqeJCsIjClhRXdldv6gY5KRdCxjaO5dEVIxh9BSQH_hJjq-u3ooxP9ad5Gl5n> , Convertro formally announced it's entry into the cross-platform measurement race as it looks to leverage the company's attribution skills. According to a press release, "Convertro provides a system to assess performance, and, for ad targeting purposes, incorporates demographic and psychographic elements such as country, gender, age, income, education and geography, including multiple user touch-points and engagements in the process leading up to sales." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109583582699&s=8442&e=0014e5Mp1LokOpPrNPBx2gAKlVmRUrUoC77MwRM4p9UJGLzZp2fZEQrh4VKE-e6wShSYBAavGOujGBJpwhLzU5eERYBYdWus4fFWxjLtWjjA99O5cVIH0mIDFxeTb6CjoiiMAkRpzBJ4fHdpRTTw67IziG-gljXunzYZr4J8YPOAtBc9FhkFWoEzUpM4Fv7SgnQWgalPj4Mj3fcv-qhw-0e71A9_3m6SULIHWAlaWnboGpzW4XlwIfIUr9G45hxZ8fwcCCm_3b_fjo=> . 


The CIMO


In preparation for Federated Media's Signal SF conference, Microsoft's Rik van der Kooi riffs on a few ad-related ideas on the Microsoft ad blog. Among them, he sees an emerging role alongside the CMO: "Lines between CIO and CMO are blurring. Today's CMO needs to view technology as both a delivery tool and as an analytics/measurement tool. The CIO needs to think about building-out Big Data and actionable analytics capabilities to support marketing. Technology is the bridge between the two functions - hence a new title: Chief Information Marketing Officer (CIMO)." Read more thoughts. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109583582699&s=8442&e=0014e5Mp1LokOrxW4fKSqKygIZBeJeHrtZQ7CUdfjeYLpeeGAnWhqzrJffp31XQUIEbCBwlQ5WxpqPa0QrN3cTEHoZnnRrpHrHrqyjpgraFHq9MXl2YRIz784CYc7U_YQYkyEKFU9SMTtWYWnSrPwbFD1cejwCV_LqEwBRmpHQmUgr6WiNZWL3PwYavgBhDKMiEOP7iodBYrV62IL6-0LeBkRlHo0kkgdgxGbZ-LAiPMNZ2T1aTRTvDG1hDHUcaufXYylvQj6pOLk4=>  


Twitter Ads Are Here?


Digiday's Jack Marshall profiles Adam Bain, sales chief for Twitter and former Fox Audience Network exec. Bain talks insomnia - and ads. He tells Marshall, "2012 will be Twitter's banner year. The ad business will see growth, we'll extend to completely new platforms, and open up to a whole new set of advertisers. That's what I spend my time thinking about." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109583582699&s=8442&e=0014e5Mp1LokOpzr9QPQT2XLZjcQP6PLD93_6UGWf9rY2ee3XBJe1u0PffIZWPOVvqgXUeDBvVKTfx5CBqDn0x2hiGgRE2bZ-cAA-UUuYm-RxvJcrXbdLHvrcjOVykz1z5pVrHLWIOudQz-cxPn7k79_A0XULyNpURO>  


Rave On, Right Media


Former Right Media Exchange CEO Mike Walrath is a little miffed that no one has asked him what he thinks about Yahoo! selling off technology assets such as his own former company. And so, he unloads in his Tumblr blog! Walrath starts, "Here's the simple version of why it makes sense for Yahoo to sell these assets: - Yahoo needs to unload the complex tangle of advertising technology used to run its business in order to save money and focus the company's resources on investments that are more core to future growth. - Yahoo has proven unable to be a leader and disruptor in the ad technology area. For example, Right Media has languished, APT has been a failure, Yahoo's legacy ad systems are extremely outdated and expensive to maintain." And then, he keeps unloading! <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109583582699&s=8442&e=0014e5Mp1LokOrrkuG_OjcilBUUQiw39oxgUEbfULBGRKfrMroS-Kg-oAWVc__O9dsWDFehRN79-vpCb1rUgthwrbmSFhQsgqV6IkOvj6M4lKwMkNxC0kwatxV3kkZXj3dnRnzssc-cv65CP6ofTV0cRt2ycBgpC9mObBtd20TXfB8=>  


Ad Tech & ATDs


More anti-agency trading desk (ATD) talk from ad technology players who buy and sell media. Following Dentsu's Ignition One CEO Will Margiloff's piece in February <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109583582699&s=8442&e=0014e5Mp1LokOrDJHPCBbwZSPrzr3pE8CTBSFPOVhqkFeviiLvjWQ-cAgW1PK779CkQS_Wip_sb2SMqr56iaRmaKvLI-566p4wlhq3c3WRaziSNK2roPPIoHwFt92UdzV2R4o_Elb729NWWSu-n46xkit2wS6LNjDap9_2s6w9M2eTPM3Gz3KqJNlfO0RYYNrbI> , video ad network Videology CEO Scott Ferber - whose company is competitive to ATDs - writes on Advertising Age that agency trading desks have failed in display, yet, "The same drumbeat is being sounded by some shops to replicate the effort in digital video, an even steeper mountain to climb, considering video is faster-moving and more technologically complex than display. As tempting as it might be, agencies should pause and reflect for several reasons before becoming tech vendors." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109583582699&s=8442&e=0014e5Mp1LokOrInNGYzW94yh3_qfb48QUE0z535VQinVmwP6m01lyY3UpX_Pnn4O-TNv6mY3g5rDtD-Iq4PqvvQRmeXAwfVGUmsvypmlp0Lu5Mch-V8fQWQIb8B5KwOGlumnktDkNydM0t76Rx7imG9SwF9XACuUsqeBPuqchIZBbeYdOV66LagCmMUVamSYDO>  


Online Offline


On MediaPost, Laurie Sullivan looks at how ad platforms are bringing together online and offline data. She adds that Proclivity Systems announced it will turn into Proclivity Media and launch "a private ad exchange called FLX that offers the integration of offline and online data. Sheldon Gilbert, Proclivity's CEO, said the company is working with advertisers to buy media based on customer transactions in stores." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109583582699&s=8442&e=0014e5Mp1LokOrJkvmeAuIyivBHb9iMbdpmxgvobu_C-ZUgUKUamjRHObCMf77UdncfXS1EJfOBn6ZpmoLANcAVWJ7uQ5ofm1QZ1zN9mTfRO5ujY_UvPTr-GO9b7GsnTcw9kIUW1VAePmQGqOfj091Q6sB1RNdOhoRtFLCa9IMnTKFMz_kZBc4WD6ieGb5UxhMR6TiN6D0C_j9DXxL8fPcZC0M_ipwsNX1m>  


Hot Hot Hot


Liquidity is coming in to ad tech from the public markets as marketing automation and email marketing firm ExactTarget priced its Initial Public Offering (IPO) last night at $19 per share, raising $161.5 million. Today will be the company's first day of trading. According to Reuters, "ExactTarget's revenue grew 55 percent in 2011 to $207.5 million. Its net loss, however, widened to $35.4 million from $12.1 million." Read it. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109583582699&s=8442&e=0014e5Mp1LokOpcJVVIQ_YH_hg2l4UVMou8xc3sbinSHvv6k9C68tQP6U_lg0ZRLeZSwMVf3-dIAeIlybq67ONZHjPWdo5_rsR4AQZyR6VnRT83guCsCzW9Pl4i_8utWmV0xu1ECtDWeuA0dJ2E36poZxPoGpjYWIPVMif65q6ZMV-0yTE7L-IlE7owsiP7CUora0i1jtwoIAw=>  $160 million to spend on expansion. The market is open!

Score More For Retargeting


Buysight - was Permut <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109583582699&s=8442&e=0014e5Mp1LokOrN358bFVyQaSgo63r0R_qFFx1yT5uDUdcHZ7R05PHLqz--m7GIkeeMVolaYCiFFX3QLvNq4n8IvHztC7GZmuPQrLNJLYPZ7ks0SLK33DDj1BXDZpXBAba7fsR-gHGhx14SINAba5indFbvg4b2OHP5TqBaSleaIEM30zG67IkGgQ5jPa8B6OVY8W3VgU4Qa2XQr8PvpMOvUA==> o - has raised another $8 million in funding to fuel its display ad retargeting offering. Retargeting basics are simple enough - yet, investors remain intrigued. Company CEO Armin Ebrahimi says in a press release, "Buysight's growth reflects the effectiveness of our retargeting campaigns; our client base and revenue have increased more than 5x over the past 12 months." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109583582699&s=8442&e=0014e5Mp1LokOrSkDV2H_DexHz72rfwcSkygzgJDg-OIr9RbXiNYkwY_hJvW5dMtWO1yg8zvKMTATCASLFCiA1WSmPQwvkclwLc1vniJj5KtyjB6gY3d4-5rLL5xytal2p_yYD3xfMTcIvfhVTyw0ys2gRbooepM1baxWmQK8FhAtsC1VPX8mAJfhivjGGJyIBDuVyxR5pMp9KJKuv0Ua1pJptkBmneXWTJ7Z3Or8PXSGc=>

AdExchanger.com Newsletter
Optimizing The News

For Wednesday, March 21, 2012

Today From AdExchanger.com...



*	Wednesday, March 21, News Round-Up <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV0baQkdhd84TLQvpmCOy-B0hew4Azxj3uqhuuVtSL5zTISIoQkBNAliTI8KcLzruTiK1IZZ_4sHirN6P5QWmatazmP4l8bY9RXHs7HbV28jW1DK-Ev8nRflxlN5U_g6OaEsRgZjvGPeYeX2zoRvH4HwV0Z1uWHRBoE=>  (see below)
*	CRO Brody Says Aol's New AdLearn Open Platform Is A DSP-Plus <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV2v8jY13cnoGBqnbyuCBp5aiSKXzPMSfprApJNuVTN6P7ViX3GWilLQCC6tTNGpm00pIDnG2AIwg6FoTVOiJAlSKgIl4PGe7elSFaXvm8iMgZjhxdMej2wspSQ3iQ_MGSxn8Qg_zp8zklNE4_hAJVgK>  "It's a couple things. One is that because you've got RTB and AOL data, it allows you to set frequency caps across a much broader set of inventory than you otherwise could've done, which helps you with efficiency levels. It is a unique set, because the AOL properties span everything from Huffington Post to Stylelist to Autoblog and so on. From a behavioral perspective, it's very useful.." (visit AdExchanger.com) 
*	IPG Media Research Team Discusses Display, The Big Ads' Ad Network And More <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV0t26ANw0scsvHT5wVG4iBxiyYSjJqosdAB8umId9pGESyHxwlDzhXwVoQL75R4pgpXpe73YfVMhIXJbOaK4dszGrzTbYDjgg76lGeMDg9JYk70d0E3HyQMGi-a3hh9Pugbh-W38rc5UVI5rKy15O1c>  "It's all about scale. There are going to be buyers in the market looking to buy these big, functional ad units. They're going to want to buy from people who can clear significant volume. So really, the question's going to come down to how quickly publishers adopt the Rising Star ad unit..." (visit AdExchanger.com) 
*	Data-Driven Thinking column...Four Ways Viewable Impressions Will Change The Industry by Mark Hughes, C3 Metrics <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV2LkUW-OnsMyuI3fEpxdi27hfN3ykOpjN4h5ysOyumOr0Xw6uhoS8EZas7rBaUIenValKSwyJK3nzH-DiCLo5vf8m1Yw8_QevUdW4GJPVJ38apfiwoo430TYoRefksulisRSn8c3EiepKTvNaz5Xlk0n5TDXnti3xoUSBBkJiPuug==>  "When talking privately to publishers, I hear whispers of the pendulum swinging too far, and fear of economic impact (revenue drop). Advertisers will want new pricing models based on research around viewable impressions (...) Going forward, four things will happen..." (visit AdExchanger.com)
*	Jobs <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV1yCEf2RLvLJ_gTkTYDoOBo17CEhkfCTlYGRIHh6fedjvqcsL-Vu3B_TiuvGn48i4Gx8jNOiNBpBMaHIgmUCng3QVGLiOBXPm8TtPQBWfEpHahqa87TyD3w>  (see below)
