Pixeling Investment


Personalized retargeter myThings, which saw an investment of $6 million from Deutsche Telcom's T-Venture in 2010 (AdExchanger Q <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV1LCcPL9kyoMIQcU_XCIh60DL-r6fbVG8nxkc2ulHI8pKmjJk4lFHQoV3TGpBIT_-sC0QbDIEUPQLuYtS8ud_hzmJ9kChxbiB7Eekl7uH1o8m4nKdJR_rbWNrv_SF2f_hJ80zkB6ZuYp11ZPJxlJnu-hk5xeGwPb0M=> &A), is adding a new telecom investor as Orange, Publicis and Iris Capital Management will leverage their very own investment fund to take part in a $15 million cash infusion into myThings. German telecom meet French telecom. myThings CEO Benny Arbel tells TechCrunch <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV00mPchGEFQ6aRPBJdYOZ3Zk__MouujXq1rcITDjf7AqsA03ViTu0cDwOftx_J3rUi7J4Nli1bhWY78j3R0xRhMccmsD86XHz881LVDPMN60taGfbpUep_0-S6I01sM6TjBpyExQkxAJN6uBTzxI3SClTuWbOo1GiBBjWuBdF3wvnO-jLaM09rgfngvPiPB_mqjDLrp0a7bAJZewgdCbKZBgNZou4VMEZae-U7zinHM5Q==>  that "myThings is one of the top five buyers of RTB in Europe, personalizing some one billion banners every month." Orange also has deal with OpenX's exchange - first announced in 2010 <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV19pSc7BxUreUf6dojNiH349uXnmqaCSIxcWzIPOsfC2n6WUCS5jNtuPsltaEGdCIFVUdTvX0DgajvpH3XotFneh6_lEDSUYeownAdYQ_S9YTPAnEdP00zxY1qZzW26mto28b5LjW7AFBBaQhBs1aanMnDI2Aknf1YgdW7WU9etWw==> . And, ad holding company Publicis has a tight, ad tech relationship with Google <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV2JuvxZ8gmkVncKNQ8wH7-ak_8RgknPh0CmKk5VabEaABs_gaVq2mRzzaNjB4xdoQCdQyKjeaYdm0YVz87qkKxBjx1WWdyaKxcAJob5tODMp5FFY3rFBOWmT8BqTQgT7q4MwOPy8HNqGBTGIZjBIr81BKbO9O01HLk=> . Oh, what a tangled ad web we weave. Read the release. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV09xhVQSmMPB3EbU1J1mMAYjl-vDEybKJEnqCpUW-8f39lrjz3V3jTrrZX6XxTAPtuZogFGifc1dCG87NJgoVSlavvpcrt-1cEN8prwwBdO59YAVksHmCeFlRAZ-d15DQjU_ayB9jSxbbjvRYA6xSd6aDBdWyt540zOW9eiD_klbKezVIdyBAhJEaVt-SO2Vo6Tokw49MMmJOvhaAcOjlYhE0IvOYn4tMmELPZuKQUlUmDLcm2xopJ1wBVuQP_lBRsr1dEvzIhxKnmcpYCUtWErGEQWCYdGaY8=>  SingTel's recent purchase <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV3nd_qTbdQX_k14cyk6POWRARDWIct_vr6sAPiMyJ8PY2yAuwaGjlxZnKkedSPj31DmgELVCa8cLIOQ0Vpy4K6ABB3g4rixJbIu0FfABSa9jiaVPynu5IlGW13SmBS--M9Q3Yv421LevYyq_tGQb8y5ANvXjepKaVEmqPh2Un18xw==>  of mobile ad tech and services company Amobee makes sense here - telecom sees the writing on the wall for communication needs being overtaken by the Web and need to find new business interests. 


P&G's Digital Future


Forrester's Tracy Stokes looks at P&G's recent pronouncements around a shift to digital and improved efficiency. She sees something slightly different from P&G, "...the efficiency play is a red herring. Digital's draw for P&G is to get closer to its consumers. P&G is a smart brand builder that is laser focused on understanding its consumers' every need. At the [recent P&G] Signal event, Pritchard, declared that their focus 'is not on digital marketing; it's about brand building in a digital world.' So it's not about being digital, it's about how digital technology can help them better build their brand with consumers." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV3sSWUlbOQTASD2Rp7qMPpOi7SEuo4KRrW2CO72HPdkNhUaCvH4LccQ4Gl5I7iQXcVdgyy1fohvPwxq_Tw0zxoPEkIPRJ1OZ7vtnteF9RDoDiVGEOEwAoYKlXr0XUIRpbQyObtsYLfV3jNMtX4Sxg7LZhZWMbvlEMD4DuvGdbJ5QanlvaWcCaLgqCvPzGdZ5fxIV8oudrbk9NmutUbO7WwIkb0NM7ctBn4iD-deUvTE7Q==>  


Divining Ad Impact


From the company blog, Convertro's COO Armen Avedissian isn't a big believer in the cross platform measurement announcement for ads earlier in the week <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV2fUjdrxvHMDA0D2KFawKa-i6UKh7y39Zkg4-GNmaErekyO9kqIt2QmeD8N_kMMfPIjaYpVwRSeFa1x6l065x_EBfkokt6nREXsPpEUC0vxiaImRfz-uhd4LA6CutUHBMrvc42-2XNEkgf84KOkjXb_4eVC2E05lXRXLwQAaGKdIUHaJXp_s3xnitSb7gLw24J2lexf9zPqWJNzKyaxKx8mUTWBGHeWUXU2QkyiAGXgXfZ8e2kvicuPT_62AP_US28=>  from Nielsen in partnership with GroupM. He sees creative as a trip wire, "Nielsen provides virtually no way to measure creative or its deterioration over time in real-time (or even for testing purposes). Typically, 50% of the performance comes from planning and strategy, and the other 50% from the power of the creative mix." Convertro has its own plans for cross-platform measurement. Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV0FFByJOwMKjSEKEtRebLiu4ELewaUk7hlGF_rf4GGP_s9MReZPXOgDnPYv75JUuKzZfya3g7wcYU4KJU_j7trfYOb4DWps0XwBW4cV1Pni2wDkqeCnEQIenjFGuWEcLDW-ry-oy0r64CiZfjo2XOhPvjqIsTn6XMkvh_E0-U8kozwUGTAH9pK7>  


Xu Moves


Is DataXu co-Founder and CRO taking a "European Vacation <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV1P4HgGJjPUtSg7Rt5VWfBxoGIppYSbVJKl6_qrnmT_lIKiYieVMqRy5xQCGG7NFLLGvY9FgfVcvTDEpwYyxQ4yZI2BVPaMEDblzcfVebaIXoR3I1xb3JyTKrJVmp0bKaNj-_snJ44Siw==> "? Not quite. DataXu announced that Journey will be moving into a new role of "Managing Director, International" as the company looks to expand outside the U.S. and help drive business for its Cologne-based Mexad acquisition in January <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV3ayhdoF6Va0TUdxZat8rJilJBBJqAwkxnzOCYjRhYKdkiOFz6Up5axhZg4v2QFnCH0gezjDpUxSE3afMNLxtpMwKQSet65UmuemEV_Hw_wQ-9szDtUjmcfAdkgAY617_63JIr6PxbBm2ekAW65vPUSQNF3CdjKXREi5mEEDz8zDcgaSi_WJheeUfUxtzKDHM-fPa4cRJyu8wh28JnKF-PBSbiZcTt5wxb7qmnCZIYkzQ==> . Read a bit more in MediaWeek UK <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV07Hiv01c1Q4wxZSqUik6uF4rlIJ-2rLLwE8nC-Re9TbbPJL-GzlnT3uAFdqJOm8KwtNgxzM8CtUakvNTsC9USgeX61erMYmb0jFrtgdKx9fFV4ZOsS80V-Is7EtUnEspiu9_DqsF1JmdobbFrhG0H8SyehYcia8vAV-fsuP5ic0yluGJamqKhpVndPlA-l0_M=> . The company also announced that Salesforce.com sales exec Geoff Dodge will become the company's EVP of Sales and Marketing and "spearhead the next wave of DataXu's expansion." Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV35nCOMkRRyL97KhJk5Lq9T2E0Z7yzwzXtpoye90bOnfuYOu7OC1B8rqpLh2k_UsTatOZab3HtB3_fMF58etFSqthRSdoZ9aNsPiHlAid9by8StDM1Ozr2-nqr2jI4lKSEDQbvSDQQoYBMX1LrVfmtLWde7geLzMaYXIX5IVRDWastIG3XdJMFmKf8GvIe3qY05TfvBitFIgyDhQBnVjmaWRvlnp27KWqnMsE-R1f56-A4YQvq4itU_XspO1wSG5z8=> . 


Gamification


Expect more games with ads as marketers look for better stories around engagement. BlurbIQ <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV3b85Q1kbivkQyiSGbTLYtI93dGGsEMoKa0ogy2tpn9XyN1yLcPI4ErEnqo5y3q2_ZOC6ifup86q_Eqwfzn8fqxw1Zn6Z3ZoSzplF9LJKn_pw==> , whose management <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV3wL7po0E1y3EmjzAxBVagL8hGpL6kuMlahuglArrY0PoUfZ43Zfr8xfYwHjGAy1U5aNSFEFH4fsGUi8HzTabXox1FrKHef0aUVaJ4VSrE06IZI1JX5SeQR>  has an online games background, says that Mojiva (AdExchanger Q <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV2RAdPBOSszGOBSl9j3Cd0T9fKVQHSJt_eT7x8l-dps8aEGweEogLIwPbtlsPvwqP7gg4DP-AMrbpHljeZJF-0n_k_OYRwP9dDPBmXWgEvVdrP1C2BLtzzHJJuxGGcXQt8=> &A) has become the first company to install BlurbIQ's "cross platform interactive video advertising solution for mobile." There's a connection here to the CAPTCHA crowd, too, as the release explains product features of "dynamic insertion of brand questions within video, [and] brand rankings to encourage replay and sharing." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV2MF-WIIQdooOHFzlUWRvV1jg3Rs5cKILFNM8DP3eBQtz6SbyXSidbodU-bmxCYsRheQUXabct01AfP9IQev1gnw5vpeqLkXR6KRuyLbqjBwfuaE13WDqoJzUfPc8386G0=> . 


Injecting Ads


"There are bad people on the Internet doing bad things with ads at the expense of honest publishers, and it really pisses me off." Harry Callahan <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV20FWWzTBqX3PjuaJCpXSDcB80ljz0r-Po6sYuLZg9Xcy0Y-AcBsqmwwEHryA8yvInmOMc9qeVahlfzEHuzgJ6o14s9W5gGJDuhj43uzaH2SY0WHc7VsCczmOL1jvnpBAcBrLY3G9YmAg==> ? Almost - it's Walter Knapp from Lijit (acquired by Federated Media in  <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV3EEcDZKQw31xtDEKg9ynmb14dhU_miFV9Y8dgAQvJe6CKGju8LrljAm1K6lp28q-fWxfOZLEiMMkH30_J4tB-b4JCJZez_O9yLbfRgS3-8fktXcYGdQJfTB7UCLvQUt9COpAh_-9fbw2k81cO99qrl3Vl06Qwpzxg=> October) and he points to the effects of the nefarious implementation of the ad injector browser plug-in: "These ads fit in the same slots as the normal ads they're used to seeing, but this time it's obnoxious teeth-whitening or belly-fat reduction ads. The ad injector has effectively stolen from publishers by using the browser plug-in to inject its own ads..." Needless to say, he wants the industry to stamp it out. Make his day. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV1g8tWRWQMO0Qnj2zj_7ZhxnK1rNG11zzziVb21CMp6Y3lzipJPY2N4QcwnwfImNVrnk4LboIbGZBQZ2F0XblUMlqTQN6rwmaxPvzf7f9iEcitdh85ZahpQu4Xum0Qxy1opyNlHAwVPLhNDryWu14PpFARjAul4GwEaoUfgnd1SBw==>  


Your Russian Sales Office


A new eMarketer graphic repurposes data from the Russian Association of Communication Agencies to reveal, "Online spending, which in 2010 grew 40% to RUB26.8 billion ($91.2 million), led all media with growth of 56% in 2011 to RUB41.8 billion ($1.42 billion). Online is now second to TV in ad spend in Russia. With companies like Yandex and others pumping funds into the Russian online economy, a continued 50% growth rate for the forseeable future seems possible. It may even be low. But eMarketer isn't guessing. See it now. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV0iXorY64FJ3bwHEK522qLJPV8TXcXEpCN7Km6NSyvC86el48ET2XgX0aAtgrdUF1RhqEmFUF42TJUgE7Fkw7E5SbC0z8GLeuomKjk5659-fJ3DK2mpPPHhWN55A-WmMP9K5qTmsR1Tcg==>  


Digital Share Grow-eth


Consulting and research firm BIA/Kelsey says, "Local online/interactive/digital advertising revenues will climb from $21.2 billion in 2011 to $38.5 billion by 2016 [in the U.S.], representing a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 12.7 percent (this figure includes mobile)." Meanwhile overall spend will be flat. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109572252972&s=8442&e=001H1rLvTm1bV2kWwj-KFRcHIscyU5yorRtKMXGqZAmXOG80uM4nLEeoKNHUiUCsodZD-fZsrHGht9MTVOWgf46Wr4BVF_lnDFkDAxA5zF_U15vrNi8AigGTHNm0FvEbSQFn9VcKzllo7nN_XbuPWlX7_OMvSvQAR5XUUqjJatV1yYVcWDw6Nsqf0es-g3aEyPUyz2h4bSo3GWszQewJN-wEjcBRZ3aub0133s7ihavW5oNDRd_4X53GMxiFIYeYlC4BBvHtcSSi9Xj7Ql2rECkqh-VGaARDx0izZZZs0vQMAY=> . Digital is taking more share.

*	Tuesday, March 20, News Round-Up <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109562365396&s=8442&e=00158xxLE44L1hIuBcB3JClSecW280LXSRedtQurW-QhyVKMf1dffKYWlVJtM_aWxFa8t9k2XCm35QslHxL5LJ8wq6FqFIo8Hosu9WN_cSFR97jW2er098Htu6a9wxequ2DoE7UtkgQfk0_FeBrZOUQ3lY8NrzAJt5wCs_PX3Y4sj8=>  (see below)
*	The State Of Rocket Fuel: CEO John Sees Impressive, Real-Time Bidding Impact <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109562365396&s=8442&e=00158xxLE44L1gfkHNF6jGV8e2ctGT319IpGOwcy27SLt-wAJFBQs9iGHR9Xeyh_u-oOjUSUEzmmFp9NZaV0nKe0dAcH7arj_Jx3ql1K4DqgZlTrpOlP-KHEpOGkgwTe4sV0TOb6iJ0ZIgTpbBEhsGBJWzGJcLQBfgh>  "We did about $44.5 million last year, which was a little under three times the year before. This is the top-line revenue. So far, I'll say we're significantly ahead of our plan for this year. My sense is that we deserve at least a bit of credit for that, but also the space is growing..." (visit AdExchanger.com) 
*	QUISMA CEO Paul Discusses His Performance Marketing Agency's European Expansion <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109562365396&s=8442&e=00158xxLE44L1jKZnCRkyZrHqwfRfuMSsdUMxGYOTAsfCkq9Hk7QpgCBXJqwQm-i5Ax3291V9dJ_TwAGQfcRQa2noP7g9n9cZmz7ccjLWS5H315vTlduNOM8SaSJ-ekD-4v0roiQ1kIqyod9A4CGg2CiA==>  "We strongly believe that no two clients are alike, either for the set-up or for the campaign refinement, so we provide a bespoke approach rather than ready-made solutions. Our own technology ensures that there won't be any knowledge or idea drain to competitors, and the build-up of proprietary algorithms, based on our 11 years experience, makes sure that we have 100% control of the entire roadmap and resources...." (visit AdExchanger.com) 
*	Nielsen Upgrades Cross Platform Insights - But Look To Upfront 2013 For Full Use <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109562365396&s=8442&e=00158xxLE44L1iACtqhZwOGiNHUrGwn8R-d4irrZjXfRvrLhh6mnvQPpNySazAsvYooBugTKo0MjPvY60pS71-cnHkXIrhXZXtCO2a3OlUwJUDW2tieQ_TtYri67dZzIdJiDoOq-6xIdiy3L6gxtxKb3gP8B-92DiBgLvlaJ7s8Vkz50cpmGd84XCJHWmnHHgNSgI6Jl8bwUqGesBjW-kFniV8QWU3JuhghWi4kF-vOIMfggdSu-YR1cg==>  "We have this idea of TV as this screen in the living room, but rather than counting the number of people tuning in, what we really want to be able to talk about is the level of content absorption. And that doesn't matter if it's delivered to through a computer, gaming console, phone. Engagement puts a value on your attention." (visit TVexchanger.com) 
*	Taykey CEO Avner On Targeting Today's Real-Time Trends With Digital Ads <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109562365396&s=8442&e=00158xxLE44L1g8lxgJesxhFo0q5TlQVaWXVQae66EmYraTh0fPrCp9l6mmeFers4BBW_JWqcSnUfjAfcAjE-lWZgyTHkrmUVdtAOiTJmnMBEg5ZguJpX8SWltSNS2pZ2ZiA40f_z5IzEZj_rNHbrsNADIHXSoYiGR5>  "The IPO means that Facebook will be more focused on generating revenues. Facebook will become more receptive to working with more clients. There will be more competition because it'll open up more APIs, similar to what happened to Google and the opening of APIs in order to work with more people. It's good for everyone..." (visit AdExchanger.com)

Adobe Reports


Adobe reported its fiscal first quarter earnings for 2012 (ended March 2, 2012) yesterday. The results met analyst expectations <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109562365396&s=8442&e=00158xxLE44L1h93YtXAdtLOj5kq1m6G3arNBpxgPdDbvcUAXZKqu9qaEeV_wheNDm0PLAEcKVSE5x0kX308xExKGwjL-6Irt2-e8PkaKkydzym3bdk1vUONysRn8zHXSNycvNnGFZylAgvVhSHyy1bnA4_ARcG7Vv2btrXIcHeXX87htdCyex_r6Z0gsQuAtXJb61najCv0Gsqwhh0amTMIw==>  as the release stated: "Revenue in Q1 FY2012 was $1.045 billion, which included $9.6 million of revenue from the acquisition of Efficient Frontier which closed in January 2012." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109562365396&s=8442&e=00158xxLE44L1gAmudEtio06TfZObvP4Ttgf59rs3SrNxGMMyI-7yH9q-KQd4JO8WEPVNxlepmx3zgVrgy7UlCPidoiLPbn2EYTj-1nFFC9CV725AzgeoK8lMyxIj1jcj7E7tBL0nCXdJZSreMigaobWYp7rIvfCHEhHnIgtij-Yn61Moeu5pT3zH79U01s9ogUmg_cjGL1gn0=> . The company said digital marketing solutions revenue was up 30% year-over-year. Among the highlights of the earnings conference call presentation, late Q2 will bring launch of the next rev of its Creative Suite which will further propel HTML5 development according to CEO Shantanu Narayen. Also, Narayen said this week's Adobe Digital Marketing Summit <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109562365396&s=8442&e=00158xxLE44L1jhQ00O9FG3HI4ou1ScpUrEEnvjjWFYrHTVOg1_a78MylpNa8tMjAGp1xlpexsalfbqBhxBonyG65wBucFd5if_Lw54hgAPou5M2mR6L511aMVE-v4FwPs0QaTOGFFc4-0t4JupmcQwVA==>  will also include a slew of new product announcements - and double the attendees (4,000) of last year. The Q1 2012 earnings transcript should be available here on Seeking Alpha <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109562365396&s=8442&e=00158xxLE44L1hCI8XXbIm-TyVz5wAwGjBSGa_hQOB0hEPXeCmzGDMdcngS4n8XN-rHTvbkG8LYRJf8BbLVSunT4TT5oIRmwgOzlSFjvIotPpmzYN8vrARBzZUUnbCClj2iBAyvMybfEC_59yjknvn6sg==> . 


RTB For Search


Russian search and digital media giant Yandex announced that it was adding real-time bidding (RTB) capabilities to the inventory of certain owned and operated properties. But here's the kicker - ads are being RTB-enabled for search, not just display -so says the release: "The new technology has been implemented to serve search and display ads on websites in the Yandex Advertising Network (YAN). The first clients to explore the benefits of Real-Time Bidding are Yandex's partners in the YAN - travel.ru, forumhouse.ru, newsru.com, and klerk.ru." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109562365396&s=8442&e=00158xxLE44L1i0mV_1VR6ptQq50UmVFWRfk0m3CXT-5-9S58mlS1HzqM6i4dDxZd7n3CX6KAfuxCV_Y9ZBqvGCSNmpOwJms1c3M39DrvmJ3BVMzfvOE_TouseKu-PTCqG2XL904MAN61nJ2FEfe7QtF8qdifc_NdIEZTVWX9MLclY=>  This could be, potentially, an enviable next step for Google and Microsoft's search products, too, as they could show ads that are related to the user "audience" rather than keywords. Certain advertisers would love to get at the high-value, bottom-of-the-funnel audience by using a cookie pool. Search ads are display ads in the end. Bring on the auction? 


Consumers Heart Online Retail


In a note to investors, Citi analyst Mark Mahaney takes a look at comScore's latest eCommerce brief figures and sees an upside surprise. In Wall Street speak, Mahaney writes, "Online Retail Spend Up 19% Y/Y in February (16% in Q1TD vs. 14% in Q4) - Excluding Travel and Event Tickets, Online Retail spending was up 19% Y/Y in February, a material acceleration vs. the 14% growth reported in January and 10% Y/Y increase in December. We'd note that this 5-point acceleration came against a 1-point tougher comp. A positive trend in our opinion. All in, we'd note that February results were ahead of Q4, which reported a modest 1-point acceleration to 14% Y/Y growth despite a 2-point tougher comp - a positive trend, in our opinion." He also says online has been the beneficiary of a "share shift" during the recession - in other words, versus traditional channels. He sees the potential for 20% growth ahead. That's a lotta retargeting. 


Gifts & RTB Black Boxes


Jack Marshall pens a Digiday feature article <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109562365396&s=8442&e=00158xxLE44L1jucSo9IEvBotObH7W9XMsfyecTN0Gnj4-eF8XZ01f9bEEnvu_Fkpb9vqURgUFvucpoTDtv3jK_lD8RubsTxM_L30NGXG8xdSdHqkvL8ztdhmPRVinjxKa42CG3utYKq04juNazrBpxIcQaRJTLjTfor4IDWmeeEMTrwX-Dcg_ZMA==>  that says a robust "Gift Economy" is used to influence vendor choices at agencies. He writes, "In some organizations, sales teams are less concerned with building relationships than they are simply buying attention and favors from agency staff." On iMedia Connection, Tom Hespos of agency Underscore Marketing offers a retort and points the finger at ad tech: "My team and I have vetted hundreds, if not thousands, of ad products from companies that operate within the RTB landscape. The vast majority of them will not permit a peek inside the black box that constitutes their pricing model. Many of them don't want to disclose how much they're paying for media and how that compares to what they would charge my clients. Anyone who takes their duty to their clients seriously understands how appalling that is." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109562365396&s=8442&e=00158xxLE44L1jBA_FH_Ndcx1NvckfEmrc8QjbDZGBxmKEKlRD6AGrUuCO1oGhsVU-sA6cgh2czSWMY_3J2pauc9rd2dmcJCVELG6Iv9Cx0P9xiH9iivHWsc21hLghWU8iNnFKijiLzFV_KMl004uFVfZT5VQFKdTpRRnHRhxaHHOR0jSZHzRz06L-hQRXUR29h8Zhm8ylFEr3JtWbtZQ1MbEhbNcLT7DGxoK_d5xPe2_80w6ewDMtC8g==>  


On RMX Sale


On ClickZ, Zach Rodgers explores the possible sale of Yahoo!'s Right Media Exchange with industry insiders from the agency world. VivaKi's Sean Kegelman tells Rodgers: "It's about the inventory. We're not using the tools of Right Media Exchange to access the inventory. We'll be able to access inventory no matter what. (...) Right Media is a great piece of technology, but it's old. The normal feeling is that anything over three or four years old is generally due for a massive...overhaul." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109562365396&s=8442&e=00158xxLE44L1h2sDl1OdAu2FY-vtqt7fDlaVzEStRz0MSEZmmdKDqv3HbMDaVV1DHxr6ZhpvWC6tuAWcMQETE1MIA-106kvsixux_vxR1ZE7RJD4sczP3VuEdTeNpB-NooeMSdO4zEUajX9Iyu4OEyzzhoacK0UqZ22jeafDq8EJQdQ0CvdOkRd6dsVh3STI7G> . 


Digital Life Raft


Yet another Pew Research study shows challenges for the newspaper industry (previous news <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109562365396&s=8442&e=00158xxLE44L1i-SfWQYn40IE1mIClIJvmKBOJvhEXurBJYTMzoO6oq53BA7JijvvugvODPfowCSbySUIBGmT3RCpuvw9NDlXC9WDu_2Ok49qiGhGWfEvY-FSGsp2Q7yYXnQ0tEn8mEaB7xykBbmf2HdXkzCcO00o_jq86mVjcZCwg=> ). Pew aggregates a bunch of data for "The State Of The News Media 2012 <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109562365396&s=8442&e=00158xxLE44L1j2nN8vVAGF4kxWYzBijzrCPxuTXBjna_KftlHyVhCORG6R-dmpeBlV7eYkMoQShkwNVU02yDygwByIUfWUQ9G6UkfA2oF5vmFbrPpONs4wfA==> " and notes the Paywall as the last wall of defense: "Perhaps as many as 100 more papers are expected in coming months to join the roughly 150 publications that have already moved to some kind of digital subscription model. The move, long anticipated and long delayed, is only partly influenced by the success of The New York Times 'metered model,' which now has some 390,000 subscribers and resulted in almost no loss in more casual online traffic. The timing of this also reflects a starker reality. Many newspapers have lost so much of their ad revenue - more than half since 2006 industry-wide - that without an infusion of digital subscription revenue, some may not survive." Read about The State <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109562365396&s=8442&e=00158xxLE44L1isBLiShlDA3dG72v9wsLH5WxswwNFkeoLl1Pq8Irp4R1QrOtPF5yI-HG27UIJsz_Wp24Q-Wq-0ZXl1NyHpUTkOu6NnA74xpANHYYLzpwAvfN9LZEoXAfIO78nW3IxUSDW8b-46ApyCzJ7qpuVTB-YC5usyNA6W9CfmWwGzqxI25H6Ji6UQU_edzzhGIWpqCC1PEjZ4S12qcZQLe4jk53OsI9v_qgkHWHQ4iXvYTdFeUz2AGWm5yER-hCcC2iJCtOLrUeUnRvEnDsxjHEQV7mSc-_0HOF3oYJ_KjpxUW3mx4UxrJPC3ygLJ> . Bloomberg's Edmund Lee notes that news is losing $10 in print for each $1 it makes in digital. Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109562365396&s=8442&e=00158xxLE44L1hSmfuRuBeEiABM7xskVSdG4OvH2_SnF3fMWTUTsbhiiVvTaW4Ni5MKtauqlgJmH18PPei_UpjYJJXhHwQfmR2m6PhXw0-jGCWlTXOixfeGa6pPAWwcwV1WPReRwA93v6EXOeOVae1yOvVSoUwgrxOolE0clSajkU-8uBjlmvfouW7NOKqN4QmmqKVnM2G6cccsghaTUAK3WzIZ3Tm1MGGd> . 


Brand Safety Nightmare


Adweek's Mike Shields finds a site called Dumage.com which is inflicting plenty of brand-safe damage on innocent digital marketers. Shields goes begins, "On Friday, a post called 'Hot Girls in Demotivational Posters' served as a showcase for nearly everything that ills online advertising. For one, there were between 11 and 13 different ads appearing on the page at once, mostly for blue-chip brands ranging from Marriott to JetBlue to Progressive to Lacoste." Was it on your white or black list? Read all about it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109562365396&s=8442&e=00158xxLE44L1iySVgw8tfMpr04kx3GKtzE0hZnk43dkqiaUpewdCCnyLI2YP7Uolj-_dSgGMtoHYmRjJYg6UdtVq7GbNAUoZlW8c8Q-1st9cafABY9GAVZxDAK0eTpadb543m9jZH_aA7auECwchpDseC9X6M9mfox-wkmcjANj8iiFWMpjqqW_oVUKJtzN1XjF-0D-XkZi-odkG6MsF255ufQPNQHdOKsn4VjUkA2Z0E=> . 


Discovering Loud Audience


Former General Mills UK research chief and, now, Microsoft ads researcher, Natash Hritzuk, shares the segmentation gleaned from recent research of Microsoft products' consumers on her company's ads blog. Hritzuk and her team founds four groups of consumers which she explains in detail: Productives, Media Centrics, Connectors and Mavens. For mavens, she writes, "Mavens are super-charged tech users. They are fully switched-on to the latest trends and they are eager to share their discoveries. These are your advocates and influencers- passionate, loud and opinionated." I LOVE THOSE PEOPLE! Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109562365396&s=8442&e=00158xxLE44L1gpIPwKpmCRVvzjYLd4NlM6TBO6KnEDGZHVIS7Zmd6Mf2glVAncn_9bEFn2GRkJmfm76NWCRzePS1kxEWCM0_5otjngTUVz_oZCvNkLP9r3NTBr84rvi0zl6Cv2GRzNy9KbbV2EfrfaVxUjtR8zBMXBcSW-e4J7c0MIwIus97Y7CuQGMO46Tmn5wFATJ9B1OzVXOwG0cVKKYtOdEhRrYq187bVlRAzvjQydvV0hHGMBCknSoxRCNUwdN2nCE8U4CLC1SqPqz3CmOg==> . 


Amazon Automating


Yesterday, Amazon acquired Kiva Systems for $775 million - all cash - to help automate its fulfillment warehouses. From the release: "Amazon has long used automation in its fulfillment centers, and Kiva's technology is another way to improve productivity by bringing the products directly to employees to pick, pack and stow," said Amazon's vp of global customer fulfillment Dave Clark. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109562365396&s=8442&e=00158xxLE44L1gaSiB6UgAgDJuU21-_JhYSOcc8s5IOis8-l4y1tqXUUwcASqeTyzQYOFx0aFq4BP4sirwch3Z-x_RlVDFUv79g0riVFvNoN6OBrj4ibcDynh9Ns1_9EjH_bGZ3vJblMWkE2IgjGZiN-kMdKgyOsOUB3FFYl1DYHoGlPckjuJu9ZSnIOWtfBRcl24zl_jNU22Xq8HqEMshjOg==> . Next stop - the automation of media people! OK, OK.. maybe just the automation of display advertising at-scale... 


Ecommerce Media & QR Codes


Triad Retail Media (AdExchanger Q <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109562365396&s=8442&e=00158xxLE44L1gH3RmHmzioh-zQByxqoKWkrNseSI5T2bxZ--9-UkahGQr7MkHWqIUJxvUZVqzMEmnTp-m6-zgStbP4o5_eS5T-V4Lnt0YHTFk_3SUthQirXOanSCzT-Bd53_Ozs-WxtusoHYg-0g3QPu1RCiDkH42LUscd0ZAPCNY=> &A 2011) is adding QR codes to its eCommerce media site representation business. According to a release, the company will partner with ScanBuy: "... the solution includes a 'Scan and Send' feature that enables brands to engage consumers with non-app-enabled mobile phones, making their barcodes accessible to more than 190 million U.S. camera phones. The feature allows access to content by snapping a picture of a standard barcode, then sending it to the ScanLife system..." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109562365396&s=8442&e=00158xxLE44L1hVNT8Rr8PPchFHd3eGHAQNP0oOJcAEAIeTO7dCRCVCCzf61QY-P-Cd-FqZbvG4wGRvgieiswlH7I6UP-jFPMglvGZbaYrJ5gldbnjbo0-IIVCtOE8aGI88h6MpRsZBKIHSI0ux2SBRiUV-9R6Kciu7OOhP-_3SIf7eKyfOD8PKUsQkv0OdfVlZ6q1GNWKUoJI7CQBgNpkZz2ncPlKh8jQIXMwN_ivUmKikTNS2sjCT_ZIDT-rVyFCwBsDVQp6YZsPkbnAVmCkcnbRAgJX5MZViilRfYBGsGG8=> .

Exponential Sees $176 Mil In 2011 Revs


It's the next phase of the ad network model. Exponential Interactive, owners of Tribal Fusion - Firefly Video and Adotube - have moved into the IPO phase as the company as it looks to raise funds in the public markets and provide liquidity for existing investors. The company announced that it had filed its S-1 registration statement on Friday. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109546390914&s=8442&e=001x_ud_8jbaPpKELeH7XBSJtxmarAPYCTmDny0xMmXCOBOdg93Ci4CuAMFxTXQifcSd-XTY1p05-UDB9iV8PLijYDXGOMsy88LEIv_EgHDkRLklwwOinUi6VvEh9Ewv2NKcHVRKR7ybnsmTCpAXaQWdQyolSPflRUYlADjkRjX7ENi3JEfYamttiiEI76czszDH_AX-858Aingr06DtmgU_xcUVoOi7o2FwxRB2JmH3A9rr_8O7QznRwfaLXTpr4ct> . According to the S-1, the company will sell $75 million of stock and is billing its solution as the "Exponential Advertising Intelligence Platform." An excerpt from the S-1: "For 2011, 66.9% of our revenues were generated from advertisers located in the United States and 33.1% from international advertisers. We derive revenues from a broad base of advertisers, with 85.4% of 2011 revenues derived from recurring advertisers. (...) In 2009, our revenues were adversely impacted by global macroeconomic conditions. However, we maintained profitability primarily as a result of our business model, which typically involves our paying digital media content providers a percentage of revenues, as well as our cost control initiatives. Since 2009, our revenues have grown at a compound annual growth rate, or CAGR, of 35.2% to $169.1 million in 2011, our Adjusted EBITDA has grown at a CAGR of 31.3% to $22.0 million in 2011 and our net income has grown at a CAGR of 51.2% to $6.9 million in 2011." 

Interesting to note that the acquisition of AdoTube in September came to approximately $20 million inclusive of projected earn outs. Revenues for AdoTube were $6.1 million (with a $1.2 million loss in 2011) - roughly acquired for a 3x multiple. Though Exponential's 2011 revenue increased significantly in 2011 compared to 2010, so did personnel costs. To provide some context, 2011 revenues were slightly higher than interclick's according to interclick's projections for 2011 <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109546390914&s=8442&e=001x_ud_8jbaPrm3HKEcwVrFIrYMpGZpXUOiysKddZXM7VfoHmiLttXR0_pIN-u37w2-u-pHmgWEC-gbUDyPTfg2PTh5kaega5C9093-n0qMnG04nphFt3UCSq3BPS6qLgp65AEB_zWGTUJVLn2NL9Tzur6z3F6HJPo-1esoQJ88QE=>  which as acquired by Yahoo! in Novemeber 2011. Read the S-1 for all the digital ad details. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109546390914&s=8442&e=001x_ud_8jbaPq7ZG5J4aOoe9XLxWB1grbkNgSvr-8akph2PuPayq7qq0MOq5Q0sAyFORpZRoKaqloYMFKZoCNDnNCTfQXgcSWZcQgF8A-8AnK4GdcKGdzDDRyw8EPPNWOjQK5WJ9BCq7QopUaLFA3dqy-oGMtZLI12XcQdKc7QwOS8WFZrFRIQTnTefyng0Cba8bwyHOEjcdY=>  CEO Dilip Dasilva owns a healthy 74.9% chunk of Exponential currently. Shares have yet to be priced. 


Cross-Channel Ratings


The New York Times' Brian Stetler reports that Nielsen is ready to release its system to measure online and TV. "The new system, given the name 'cross-platform campaign ratings,' will combine Nielsen's existing television ratings, which measure the reach and frequency of ads on TV, with Nielsen's new online campaign ratings, which apply the same measurements to the Web." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109546390914&s=8442&e=001x_ud_8jbaPpRHFhzA4oqqMaZTl7SGvle1rca2KcPlJYW467MCtLHj_D5Y3v9vVaiW0GdOVXdKQENWAP5tJPn43DtVqRAJKHWRocoacohEDpJ9hh7ahQG0pg8OlkBgGzu0WwLsbU0ZKhaybdv9gEkLklAaWDCcKRNDx5yoiUAhE-_3EGWhCaSiw3YdzJFFK97uXDnxmvcJUvXN52hcUtphWgWT0ft_Y9FYPBdl2WQxts=>  


Ad Tech Getting Hotter?


Baltimore Business Journal reports that mobile ad network Millennial Media will raise another $50 million for a total of $129 million. The IPO space is getting hotter - albeit we're not talking about '99-'00 bubble numbers here. Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109546390914&s=8442&e=001x_ud_8jbaPpY1odwkO5AiSM4cVujhppiEFebBPFmbY9oORb_Cy-mBuEysp4oBrS_i1-P7WjdK6oZfpLvDB19DC4G8I4R-Ba_QMioOhxdDN-2xNfLVfMGXur0FFCeYd8aiD1deItx8rXw-OrktS7c2VNjsarPy4gPk4rAadbEL1K5ZrLHHkg4hq5-bwNJN8O4j-C-iDKdcyJyRyKdbsiGDw==>  And, read this - the amended, informative S-1. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109546390914&s=8442&e=001x_ud_8jbaPpY1odwkO5AiSM4cVujhppiEFebBPFmbY9oORb_Cy-mBuEysp4oBrS_i1-P7WjdK6oZfpLvDB19DC4G8I4R-Ba_QMioOhxdDN-2xNfLVfMGXur0FFCeYd8aiD1deItx8rXw-OrktS7c2VNjsarPy4gPk4rAadbEL1K5ZrLHHkg4hq5-bwNJN8O4j-C-iDKdcyJyRyKdbsiGDw==>  


Salesforce Targets HR, Media Next?


All Things D's Arik Hesseldahl says Salesforce's expansion into the HR world through Rypple (acquired in December <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109546390914&s=8442&e=001x_ud_8jbaPo9S685vz2ChxRy0eooWUELM3wRg5s9P-dAVljvW6-VTA3qh6Yb6HICt4BWnFNpmbzN-iKCFG4cc4Skc-1QcSibgyDpvRKjzkG6D1v6APKMFawSd_vNyfShyMgr-GuNvzuTx86GHCESWMbN4pOc2Ppw0g8cd-rwjuvMpinyFm4ByWNsspemcgYWPb1RkR51w74=> ) is taking effect as its stated goal of finding a "fundamentally better way to recruit, manage and empower employees in a social world." Hesseldahl writes, "CEO Marc Benioff showed off how the Rypple acquisition is being integrated directly into Salesforce's main service as an add-on app in the company's App Exchange. He's something to see in action, and manages to bring together numerous strands as a way of making his arguments for the cloud and the social enterprise." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109546390914&s=8442&e=001x_ud_8jbaPp5f6xk-tw8PsnrUdRYZRKH_mPo8H8BjFbc03BDFgPDFuH0M8Hbs0HGNWvT7pCkUxuIw8Zu8gd2glDS_3o4Z-YABhWDONrfH72i1qSwVdsV2ns4qU0fRHSRNaU45DoCa3rqDIC-ICevJYfTSJET9L0zG3H4bKKErOnkhWTVAZ9dUnzQe3XlT7tM0eaYnBydbsv5dH9d5IwtKw==>  Could a media/ad tech component come next? 


Australian Display


As promised in November <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109546390914&s=8442&e=001x_ud_8jbaPpzh4gFmDxXiHbFBnisLclpQxQiFF71Fnqn2buCMm5h-eWW4mCBBWwUjyWR3PwuG3bFORHF9BVlSGpWq44TVTrvFXo4IL1W6OOPFKFhNAx1VrTAHGAUHdyAm7Yj5CmWFEi5vPjcp0TZMjLpYtABK420> , Microsoft and Nine Entertainment Co. have undertaken a joint venture in Australia called Mi9 which signifies a "coming together of a portfolio of digital investments spanning; publishing, data, consumer insights, advertising technologies and online products," according to the companies. There are four different parts to the venture including Mi9 Media, which will be led by former Starcom agency exec Matt James. Mi9 Media will comprise products such as Microsoft Media Network and Microsoft Advertising Exchange. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109546390914&s=8442&e=001x_ud_8jbaPr7xcQ1ZHw6YfzLXivhkgetAMu-kmLxkp0FUpf6072ek3r8qr98IJLD9kgrCw3xe0GAQQJG2lyTf7jnyntcbc3xevwK-dOz07Mg6D1FQz03xyczNX_4az-HGxaPp5ZzeqM=> . And, see the site. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109546390914&s=8442&e=001x_ud_8jbaPrws5TD0KP89jDQOmK6x6s0j3ggVxtvYT1duPDuO2i1jy3840oOH20pJ9HA-XLhp_6IeqFwMP6DRVR3lhUPo4fjRe7JttimXIU=>  


Telcos And Ads


On TechCrunch, ad tech investor Rich Lefurgy (LinkedIn) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109546390914&s=8442&e=001x_ud_8jbaPrjgBNpniAztAD5noysV8hxqo6ZAtmg8AORSyWbT3tBTmEuVot9iDCTGu_XpBvlc2OK-tUZAb4uGkUrCPaCUapR2XKjhHFdJCP5vVY-n2PgtYzQlbpl1KUR8xSAmGmIPdg=>  reviews the significance of the SingTel acquisition of mobile ad company Amobee and sees a telco trend. He writes, "The big question is: Can telcos add the advertising expertise to create a great value proposition for both brands and consumers that makes them both happy? It's a $22 billion question - or roughly, the estimated market size of combining deals, geofence mobile marketing and location-based services." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109546390914&s=8442&e=001x_ud_8jbaPpePeebT69GkNArCkoRO-ABoGImUKrRFaNQPxPjPkasMLvaCorU-jE5lFFL2ZzEi6Bx92KrDp5CXy8B79nATmo8pcWS3KZI2D3zI5DO6rlw5R9o2V4JrDyb2DdZbs9rP9FXlj55SzaptTBy14h3-rVN> . 


Apple Cash


Apple will let the world know today at 6 a.m. PT <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109546390914&s=8442&e=001x_ud_8jbaPrNuoXHe77zA7SDzdGMarbMjAGN1LMqIN2ehLUK9HA26vF1ez1oJazfKJFuOOhhsj85e1kj1SYAikGS8jMOPjjG2zljkDku7bc9XHDEPu1ROE28QrKQHMrQQdzHPf5ldutkNxkkoLzi2DwLb8bC6E0PFKYE0Q2HipzPVpZ5r1SUng==>  what it's going to do with that $90 billion in cash. The New York Times' Nick Wingfield covers Apple's rare Sunday news announcement yesterday saying that though a decision on the cash was imminent it's not so simple, "While Apple ended last year with a cash balance of $97.6 billion, it cannot easily gain access to most of that for a dividend because roughly 66 percent of the money is held by its foreign subsidiaries. To bring that cash back to the United States, Apple would have to pay hefty repatriation taxes, very likely more than 30 percent." Read more.  <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109546390914&s=8442&e=001x_ud_8jbaPpab60TQuKI2M9Er7OOtwIAT6X9-bWoJHJ22Dd4PPEF0iIewKln3Cusd9e-YzEZGH59LErKDMwNKBxY3jf2ZbyT_ibRAPOpuTTdtFJFlVsCq1Q0qLRndYoDc-DaboCCV9YqqLVyH7XsAIHt5XW5646E5AYDZPfXMMnMvNMwQSkGDrNo0eH1pYnp>

Trading, rather than bidding, opens up the inventory pool to a number of buyers. Essentially, everyone is a bidder, and the spending is no longer confined to the brands with big budgets. The networks get to be bidders as well..." (visit AdExchanger.com)

AMY Update


On The Microsoft Advertising blog, Senior Director, Display Marketplaces Daniel Sheinberg says the Aol-Microsoft-Yahoo! (AMY, YAM, MYA - you decide) agreement to sell each other's non-guaranteed display inventory is now "live." Sheinberg writes, "Starting this week, the Microsoft Media Network, AOL's Advertising.com and Yahoo! Network Plus are leveraging real-time bidding (RTB) to offer advertising opportunities across all three networks' premium, non-reserved, owned and operated display inventory." Read the blog post <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109536484329&s=8442&e=001aruS94h3HyGOPzCFz-hC4ofY365mN2X1S2VCDM2lMRghZm6rdlLFqE_W-sCfUh7FfJ4v9SD0RY4_P43aq4Xlzbbqs7Jp8vlCPKprXBhSO9p4ICAnQcuifcLZbphK6GuG_2lc57PeRc1w9izTSo5CIJvR30Z2HSaMGjBxqRiXTCS_vk7rtTrS-RnTTQwX02WXicFZgVbHd-3oLR5szZeBCajqpt_oF_2NK4WTprg4h8ZL1LA7WC8bZ7ZkdwIJfAMoZQJiFgq0nvV55RxFzZ8d30LMSGPnWUtk> . Will marketer demand for scalable, "premium" sources of non-guaranteed inventory get AMY rolling? Or can the marketer find it elsewhere, for cheaper? Or could AMY turn on itself in a state of data-driven "Hunger Games" as each of the three ad networks battle among themselves for an edge? Tune in a year from now! Read a bit more on Yahoo!'s ad blog <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109536484329&s=8442&e=001aruS94h3HyGLwT_cRXluNjF6phEQRdvjs2g-sZFmhxH_u7kD_dEHMnmmqQGS7oF2X2GpZ1WY9-UdS2WvvmEoTQWXS1uG38s9gEw4ZVujZkToBrau-vQsvWkX0bsqIteLAmwXskHRSvFl_nXyYwUrwhi6JLsdVMvuRk-xMIplByIj9sLy5gdoPHngLc65VicZzygeW4CRwgB33vVgqo6fkIhB88JsPIrp-vLkjS8jw-0=> . 


Enhancing Audience


Experian Hitwise, which provides online measurement, is moving more into the audience buying game with its AudienceView product which leverages Hitwise panel data and that of other Experian data products (like PRIZM). According to the release, an example of the buy-side use case: "AudienceView can help deliver insight on online behaviors of a retailer's customers by matching them to the Hitwise online consumer data sample. This helps retailers get a complete picture of their current customers and find more of them online." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109536484329&s=8442&e=001aruS94h3HyG-oD-zEUWe_LaN-1FXyWq6zxNAmq4lziBjGvZ_-QYXzzHNqlmJjG8A6b2tECTvzfK5_JRkMhDacIoXAMK-4kwGiprbrY0LuU3b-7jyjG53ASoUtwDkAgSSDbo7Xw7kEqVyNV5uHXcIAh-dpu_gqp9jrkZbrWIpCf-uMxi_4vVQJsnedENsLyYB-mh8rej2Km9Sn-H_TvdV6Q==>  


Semantics And Ads


The Wall Street Journal's Amir Efrati looks at what he says are changes coming to Google Search in the next few months. He says it's all about understanding semantics and quotes, Google's Amit Singhal who "said in a recent interview that the search engine will better match search queries with a database containing hundreds of millions of 'entities'-people, places and things-which the company has quietly amassed in the past two years." Over time, prediction of these "people, places and things" has turned into certainty. For ads, the same holds could hold true across Google's network of ad products. Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109536484329&s=8442&e=001aruS94h3HyG0N-fYYZLzLN_BJk0s1B6KM23iUo6_5u_FQRcje-wO0XYSttDKhZrP1rF-p6gHEYVfnFsnayF5mjs1wWpY0IYtkoP5y81n4qozP1wmE429Oggrg1c7DQY2hqdDJbuQeXgh23yUyLLnyvXB0pKZdJ4braaSmgZnDmsTxuUFtYtkDpl4Z8oU9H9M>  


Independent Checks


Stephan Loerke of marketer trade org World Federation of Advertisers <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109536484329&s=8442&e=001aruS94h3HyG70RtpXOAoIpk-H-jhuIner1PUumRmrSH60oHYndmFv7fVKYcIh7VRzIpsnka09-VZO2bwb5HY-e-obnVmb1ZVNY_8mcO7l4ejIwnGfcOP8g==>  says just what verification companies want to hear in a new Financial Times article: "Advertisers have real concerns about transparency in this area and many now feel they have to invest heavily in independent checks that ensure that the advertising they are paying for is actually appearing." DoubleVerify, Adsafe, Telemetry, and comScore's Adxpose are singled out as coming to the rescue. Read it (subscription) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109536484329&s=8442&e=001aruS94h3HyEKAiCr7t0KTWPGyE8FSbL9ekDNB_iH5QCS3xgVjE9xvEEgXZBxzT0Thi9SBITLrPz2tGpf4N2ltzVAeqJm7Y5g7H7ONUKXE5Sw5V9_5ULqtMOAHxDBELu-mk2nCtHTcB03f0R7_izujU9FV_YpdgC03h2kwTKr4fY4_7g7OyurpVmZxq19StIN> . 


Real-Time Facebook


On Ad Age, Matthew Creamer goes through the fine points of Facebook's upcoming release of real-time insights with Facebook product manager David Baser who crawls out of Facebook's pre-IPO caverns just long enough to say, "Changes in data can drive immediate action. For example, you might want to change a post that's getting a lot of distribution but not engagement. A post with a lot of engagement is maybe one to pin to top of the page. With real-time, the underlying meaning of metrics are changed. You see what happens and then you take actions. The data itself becomes a form of analysis." Get more FB real-time. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109536484329&s=8442&e=001aruS94h3HyEZxDHdY-JcltIAdoeT6vvFEUk_2tYqS31Q1z8Q1WyS1T8gfr9CeF1HHZu5_ctUoAaXP4c0IA3HLZsonsPmeX-zZptkkbs4ftV6CtO3gSQt7hPbyi04yfA_XFVRAw8EBCfzAt6-nq9BRrdaZnKJ-bbjb0VhWSzppr-tknlXI_Jj8Cpa32nF-fgL>  


Pvt. Exchange


On AdMonsters, Gavin Dunaway explores private marketplaces with Andrew Casale of Casale Media. Casale discusses the keys to success for publishers, "Private exchange success hinges on making the publisher's brand known to all of the key agency trading desks, independent trading desks and demand side platforms that buy on behalf of their own managed buying services." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109536484329&s=8442&e=001aruS94h3HyHvcQkrUgIV9sSa5552cODQjR7tUj0EadrQnvgHBgAVXOXfqt9wwtYo3xjKDT9EaXaSky9l94GEoyxjXFN_dy8l8OZU4trv1WMB2oabr4tLo5xDgfR6s1Pf5iegVXICstYpBCId6AVv0y3c37UOpBDq2NNRHWGZe5kflnAisbqNUKsxwELAgEZLWONwO-xhvYopNnahLFZwdw==>

*	Thursday, March 15, News Round-Up <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109528397570&s=8442&e=001F9rkoJfc6-pAsQ9iIHfX8GAaUrPt5Z41Wl0iYDp8QLCRmnNuW_LUjIB9_Aop1l1jhwWR83SEB25BOBZJTzhtg5G4o9UZuSB_iSHQUhhC_CBz6j9ry-dcez8PC8g41mKuZKIvUfOMSsmPff5t5dnXjCIX6OR2nq-g05L3kWlOpQY=>  (see below)
*	The Sell-Sider column...Private Exchanges from a Premium Publisher Perspective - What Does It All Mean? by Esco Strong, Microsoft Ad Exchange <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109528397570&s=8442&e=001F9rkoJfc6-rUmnzfrFHsl-Cd5tb3SOVaSsB1AWjK8l9cG-U3wCtvDDLCapYyCGBH5tmG_OQdz41RqJBS2zcCOLDGps1LZGBv1Xko9d5pVyJVGmLWkd-V1Hklvnblqu6py42VzOdYmphFdfTh7SMFMcr-W61N-5GvVPyNBWmFbWuxQUMpzRMayg==>  "One potential pitfall for publishers to avoid when implementing this flavor of 'Private Exchange' is around guarantees and passbacks. Similar to my assessment of tiered auctions, siloing off inventory for delivery to a private ad slot is akin to that same concept of putting up walls around your demand and introducing opportunity costs of not selling to downstream demand that may be willing to pay more for some of the impressions..."(visit AdExchanger.com) 
*	Adelphic Mobile Founders Aim At Mobile Ad Segmentation With New Platform <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109528397570&s=8442&e=001F9rkoJfc6-rrw8tNjS-btiOx1PSCdkWWVr4aYAhZQKlsV6RD9q-3PbS3V9yq-NgCv7gAey_KIBnlcVOMAnGq12kdKSqpdxoPizb5J47zg_aFR-2XSdr2OaTx2kUSQfsoE8CeM5yq6PtP6LgPj9RdQ5sv6XLnJGHm>  "As we speak, we're integrating our RTB capabilities with all the other SSPs out there, as well as other ad exchanges. In fact, we're in the midst of doing three more integrations now. But, we don't think that RTB, on its own, is sufficient. You've got to bring in intelligence to your bidding strategy, and that intelligence comes from data..." (visit AdExchanger.com)
*	Jobs <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109528397570&s=8442&e=001F9rkoJfc6-rjlmE1ZKr7BPO4yGHsw32DcxQmaxUwGVreIRTFQPNducmZXtjsGXMCZUAaL-yBOVvqBalvc0voLyIJfMx0NZOz4IPlRNCaRRLuR3BGVcu4uX9Q54E2mKKn>  (see below)

RMX "For Sale" Rumor


On All Things D, Kara Swisher's sources are telling her a sale of Right Media Exchange may be imminent. Swisher writes, "The most ideal plan, said sources, would be to sell Yahoo's whole advertising technology 'stack,' including the Right Media Exchange, a marketplace for advertisers, publishers and ad networks to trade online ads. Yahoo bought it for $700 million in 2007." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109528397570&s=8442&e=001F9rkoJfc6-r9K_rCTbdQ0s9qS_KsRUYWqLihVq0omK1JD3DE5TKQGd1vrjBvFRzLvdfr69ubB96PQEZcuvxsVomkgTubGXZEoyTuSolAptFuIkOFcmvrYH_94PNhiE1EW3XpAK3K5A4WVU-nyn-XOErrlqEslF28jov242fcXoAF7o-zpsEx87JxgTVAK87Xlnvj4VFRj97PKbidaGBfcpHbWvPZIXeiyl-629n5By-_mnkxN39bGY9jPdxhh3he_23G6RfOuEQ=> . Swisher says Apt is in the mix, too.

This "RMX sale" rumor has been out there for a couple of years now in various <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109528397570&s=8442&e=001F9rkoJfc6-qdaVf4XfGrMxuSGsTX7fUHCMr7L20O_7TasKzUFAAt8d4rnaGFVmze8ro0lOcpW5IxtE2C8YfOAaR9iAaK1-Ha8A9cBeh6wF2DhJQvEGhXc4LNZT0YM1eCo7R4Vq9ayOEPhzFbd71YNnKRndTj92kD53NKYYp3Pys=>  forms <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109528397570&s=8442&e=001F9rkoJfc6-oQOuygSxgELDHT_cRtLdwPfqgCV8h5Lf2WnXJfBRARwR4QlRErywyWDZggyZf-hKWTCG2xy1noiGN8PfhmAEguD4FP1-gAWTQg4WA1rOxXRx9VPsHvELGEwquVQYU3vNl2XBPZ-RqTBZTHqLbXVbLaD9mPJwfxL5Z3m23Qq_REIA==>  (guilty as charged!) as innovation and investment have been stifled and executives have exited the exchange. From here, surely Microsoft is waiting in the wings as its initiatives around Microsoft Advertising Exchange <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109528397570&s=8442&e=001F9rkoJfc6-rbTtANBiru74Kod3t2rf-tY44jVluSmtFrUtB5VRlGb6fQB5ukP0b-rlB4jX3yUPBKdY6a8ECFjEUTEtHvaQFAdie3ks6H32JTI8hEVlRizarbWdVk5dUHX-4HhomE2caL0nY0-kmSKhJrM76wEvTlMadzPe7gVp6FJ7W8mQiNKS1j-cZZWIo3>  or brand advertising display <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109528397570&s=8442&e=001F9rkoJfc6-rgJyHGt1SJT_HQAJuE3PCh1MoVrDHXKO2-XDqXZObhOEvIiCIG-00eo5bBa1bsJpXATHoTRi25EmfYChpXOsPYt7BK9Mb1Sy9bMts654wGQ-7oefO0b0EknezfdAbwUWjgxui8Rp7yaDseP5W7CQeVYvD-B73BS0FaXGqVRBWwQQ==>  would be something the company would love to expand through the capture of Yahoo!'s owned & operated inventory - non-guaranteed, Class I, II, whatever. It's like Microsoft getting its Bing search engine on Yahoo! all over again. What Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer may need is a calculation or two on how this acquisition will improve his company's market share in display - and digital ads - and its bottom line now and in the future. 

Of course, the acquisition of RMX doesn't necessarily get Microsoft Yahoo!'s display media, yet any deal would most likely include that assurance along with the fact Microsoft-Aol-Yahoo are already in bed together through their announced partnership last December <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109528397570&s=8442&e=001F9rkoJfc6-otGMSaN1jbIk2vw6KKMcvzKQ3F6ZjExcDKFq1gC9-zswXD0-lkZep44PvP2856LOiS7wKPuHYv3idhg_Dbj_uc6FRyuiUtYy19sQIONdc3ZRnjwawwHesLjrkGpkRP7pvRWmjo1IhPPpCdJARu5RXNb_0s6q4iZrYoh2eCrr98sFAXQNmNP-0YvvgnHGGPlSrdD7Xbn80E98sESS1atty1RnJTa2uWrZKt6tkhpGj9JghGSiAMgRKdtdpLuMTOclo=> . Post-RMX/Apt, Yahoo! would seem to turn into more of a data-driven media company hurtling into the branded content world of the future. The selection of former Travel Ad Network CEO Brian Silver earlier this year <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109528397570&s=8442&e=001F9rkoJfc6-o8WEGnJ7GLIbszIki1QZBYGrmf1hLPT0FQEEyyzBI9X4ugwi-MIIASIAQRweni0d6M_uNaK03j_XTz9lE6N12c9NtSPMfBEXLSRKSVBoDTkMYxjdQqYfHlkRTwqGTJoDUlLsm0B8fNHA8mGg_-HAAbt_Lnr0W_MIY=>  to lead the exchange could be a move to have a C-level executive in place in case the company is spun-out or sold. 


Audience Metrics


On AdMonsters, Tribal Fusion's Doug Conley brings formulas to the discussion around audience buying and presents what he calls "audience efficiency." He describes the metric: "We can visualise audience efficiency as a tradeoff between how well an audience segment fits a client's target audience (lift) and the reach. Mathematically, there is no possible selection of audiences that provides the same lift for a given reach or vice versa." Conley provides examples of "AE" in action, too. Read it. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109528397570&s=8442&e=001F9rkoJfc6-rOAth1djbZ2XbJPiE59-KekjC1BPmcmRCQb5HTaxO4Aj4DA43WSA1onDUE_oGv5x1ufF4j4-rYtyRbQXqZkiGlkh-XitDVShgBITPx77Y9KoFr_czDS7rPJOr2fB46z_HtdGpjP50OXUx36ROghhyVED5A8PCUbw0=>  


Modeling For Safe-ty


Sridhar Ramaswamy, who is svp of Engineering at Google, says on his company's "official" blog that Google is busy implementing to make ads "safe" for users. Modeling is a part of it explains Ramaswamy as he lists recent updates: "New 'risk model' to detect violations: Our computer scanning depends on detailed risk models to determine whether a particular ad may violate our policies, and we recently upgraded our engineering system with a new 'risk model' that is even more precise in detecting advertisers who violate our policies." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109528397570&s=8442&e=001F9rkoJfc6-pYReCKFGXOnOPMPjiC_2AGr_xE7sSMcY_c9m-7WaA61nU_bSrzDsvxfeLPKQbz_REiQiG7-Qi6MzuSb6By43CpiTDGlDygkTpOmSBVExJmcvI32DvoN1A7q_gk_bCr6WmvIxElbHIWGhj1PUmOTtczBVQuS1ZFrx4mYEFxSrHsc19eY9_KdZg1>  


Biddable Ubiquity


AppNexus product maven Ari Paparo gets a hold of the login to the AppNexus blog and runs wild with a discussion about his company's efforts to bring rich media to its real-time ad platform: expandables are now available via real-time bidding on AppNexus which includes Microsoft inventory. Paparo also looks ahead to home-page-takeover type units, "While we were having so much fun building rich media capabilities, we decided to support interstitial ads as well. These high value ad placements cover the content on the page or show a full-page ad between page views. AppNexus customers can now easily deploy interstitials on their own sites or partner sites. For now, RTB capabilities are limited." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109528397570&s=8442&e=001F9rkoJfc6-pqJR3QVRo0xOREBLkkR2cJqyf7kLdzWCZ_WAaTpIkvN6XI2mW1iYcmbmvgz9MVm2hj1zz_jVDtqFKKoDua_4qru1r8l4IOWKVL1Aicsr6VIpPMV0dTvEAqI1u0p9kL40kG0QxZFpdD4mIe2Ii9gZmcj-5LlWgVMGHSdQNio-M2aMy4RmW6Tg8q> . Everything is becoming biddable. Like that coffee you're drinking... I'll give you a nickel for a sip. Too late. I just sipped mine for free. Psyche! 


Infographic Thursday


Monetate's Bryan Eisenberg points to a new infograpic near and dear to his company's heart - website optimization. See it now <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109528397570&s=8442&e=001F9rkoJfc6-rEStJkBd88T6eeotcHcMnJEBSXZSixPSZJhjXC-odeRkR_U7IMRADluZFIw9q1cgzX5RSQkuMpFJcVivUKABC-Xh2KqmS6eQzv8QXbH2deyF3scNH4VoB1wDpWhLnHOGY9j4cr8SfR9kyIk8wlHE6HSN9g7NpSla7espWaIV2Wyg==> . Want to make your own infographic? - Visual.ly may be able to help. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109528397570&s=8442&e=001F9rkoJfc6-qaHW_xDPWCa5_84IHgFO8CNgWx8MXuIbLqzrTfdOXhf6UIFee_ItQFc8h1pKRy2R_YIs6-M_rA7HwWAlVXtbAnssEiTr8tulU=>  


You're Appointed!

Patent Fighting


Jeff Roberts covers the patent Yahoo!'s patent lawsuit on paidContent and breaks out the 10 patents here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109518158463&s=8442&e=001lAK1Zd3pcFzCW5JJ1xX_yKCIUmgQxrOBv7HROzvJNfZkIgaQAwXuTs6Ls4Yoi-uALDpXOaSQwJNS485Jy5v-X7aUJnTx7uLCbK2v-ojZREU03yvxyyV94MRPlVAmic0N3m7UzSD_VT_P1twpwwWhW0YDUfWXHXfhHAd2cgkh7CTj_Oi2KWKxdtqjLj9WAir-MsKaAfWGKsU=> . Meanwhile, patent fight broke out into the blogosphere yesterday - mostly against Yahoo!. VC Fred Wilson said <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109518158463&s=8442&e=001lAK1Zd3pcFwx9sNQlaXA1kKcYZ-GgsO8OyPozASSZlyz7cn9l_LglNEcRdZ86FLzrTqSlKU5NgPwkQaQAqxpkYNT6SO3cSiNfAjJ_oEmGppvhDu78vL-6aJ_BmvAtuaVmegjOZiUU3WOlUFLxiAsyJinjSNRade0VcfPFv8QYDY=> , "I am not writing this in defense of Facebook. They can and will defend themselves. I am wrting this in outrage at Yahoo! I used to care about that company for some reason. No more. They are dead to me. Dead and gone. I hate them now." But, entrepreneur Mark Cuban, who is a self-proclaimed "patent law hater," appears to take the exact opposite stance from his personal blog, "If Yahoo's patents truly are valid and recognize that they got Google to pay money for their Pay Per Click patent (acquired from Overture), then there is absolutely no reason why the same Patent shouldn't be valid against Facebook. (...) The same with the patent for personalizing pages. My.Yahoo.Com was way ahead of its time when it was introduced. Facebook is built on personalized pages. If ever a patent in this patent environment should be valid, these two should be valid in today's world." Read it. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109518158463&s=8442&e=001lAK1Zd3pcFwJSpihuTr35mo4M2rbYQGTc-ItG8TmTFui13p8-ClOjSrcEwI74Ny4V3iQUCWqc8TqaTfzwLxCidrEyGF9WMAvvi8XQcIaAd7BZxcisde6E1zDYleLatRuIURD20CcqpggilmKshFwz9_JAI2KMYKkIfQJK2CD8PNgiCBB_Ssdb57mX6qB7FYIovOoCFy-LMw=>  Want more patent news? Try this from a former Yahoo! <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109518158463&s=8442&e=001lAK1Zd3pcFyuEyIrTW0_GIH6--i9XdN0Cx_3FIxbV9JmUgpH9arS_F5OWhyAYuddZuLCYQPfh4aRF0bdPyRxBn9edtAzL0PORXWkKJPcL94E_KhJoV--FoqIspYp5ERqX6TKp_-g38cZrDpRmWpDOFglTLc29qg_770DA_gUXtaVVVQYBvw_KA==> . 


Tapping Ads


Chicago-based Tap.me has taken in another $3.2 million of venture capital for in-game ads. "Why should I care?" you ask. Because engagement that comes from reward-thirsty (virtual currency-thirsty) mobile, casual game players is very attractive to advertisers - Tap.me's target market. Read more including a brief update <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109518158463&s=8442&e=001lAK1Zd3pcFwG8fonXF3HfMVxHv6D-HJ7ehOJipNWonljWF_3fwApcDfhGupf2skGIku_qQblp8rs_B7A9xyMISk2nsP4oxTQ8kxSaOd0AvB0ZLeIMPBLGM7A70PqtgFpd0-JeUnRwzZyuQGYH1_hYg==>  from Tap.Me CEO Matt Spiegel (formerly of Omnicom and Accuen - AdExchanger Q <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109518158463&s=8442&e=001lAK1Zd3pcFyO7YxHFATL_uRJPcp1k1PekQJa3jAmMEN2lNuwXMoCkhlLUM2J0Yw3pM7xKbuDH4NyJkBhEI8DiBDJB-iCOh2FcgAl_o5L28eFd6163dgOQhNm5FO7Nc_JYAO1l64vet5oExQZK6SsWF6kpZCLoGBbwxunmKwfAhbyXtzLUnEGcpTr35wEcTQ74OujVQiF4lTzmJ8KAHAsYQ==> &A 2011). According to the release, "Jeffrey Lapin, former Chief Executive Officer of Atari and veteran of Take-Two Interactive Software and THQ joins the company's Board of Directors." 


Spending Trending


The New York Times' Bits blog reports on a new spend trend update from Publicis' Zenith Optimedia research group. The NYT's Stuart Elliott writes, "Ad spending worldwide in 2012 will grow 4.8 percent compared with last year (...). That is a bit higher than the most recent forecast for this year by ZenithOptimedia, made in December, which called for a gain of 4.7 percent." And there's even better news in 2013. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109518158463&s=8442&e=001lAK1Zd3pcFzwMGB059zSwOUki_KZsq9Uy1VEIeKTU4x1Q2aEF3sSoj3dYbKrh-kJdL7CJ2QtVsStYvFMOGydzMZ_kZxgWO6fL72bIyGU99AZtro35Zs6sE18L_LDSQopwiWM1-FuJtToDwV3rVh8s_v5QzwTEFSTzd0YX9gcZid4D7tTKYSeZNOcM0Th1CK5XM-79ghio0sLWoGqQCKiQg==> . Are you ready? 


Totally Site Rep


Evolve Media Corp, owners of site rep firm Gorilla Nation, announced its British invasion in a press release as the company brings its vertical ad network/media services business to the UK. From the release: "Evolve oversees the existing media services division Gorilla Nation, and has now unveiled their women's lifestyle vertical, totallyher. Evolve's business structure is designed to organize audiences, research, specialized ad products and sales efforts in order to produce and monetize premium digital content while offering programs to online marketers that deliver content, context and creative with scale." Outsourced sales! Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109518158463&s=8442&e=001lAK1Zd3pcFxCnfzPJ4hUuYfoetfVUK86QRYCmSAf7SL_fbUfnVHyTXjnk4U1c0gr-_dC5Mn730lLqf-8OnQHdihN5UhxRmRHEw7by1IqFjqH3cDwI_M_hEI41gLKXU57VU_kzCPxDJgvKOTWTpzS8Pe1Sshuc8SKjHTizzQvogIJxaMiWBsLsc0YniJSGmnPgYdVwi6Zk-NALFMitWfKsSfqFVKPvrqRZftjcM6L5_w=> . 


Right Time, Right Now


On Ad Age, appssavvy product marketer Eric Farkas preaches a data-driven sermon on scarcity and data-driven advertising in an opinion piece. "The key will be to look for natural breaks in the user experience and place highly targeted, relevant ads to users at that moment, when they're most likely to engage. Furthermore, publishers should limit the ads seen by a user and make sure that ads are relevant to what the user has done or is doing." Read it in real-time <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109518158463&s=8442&e=001lAK1Zd3pcFxW_Kc8J7yfzvNXUv56WRuxhO7X7UBLBlKk0QXjqOj4LWaxoqfan7vPb_EklCl6qV8tasheJ10IHfzgoRDUctUWNQ39m3v9bsRUfVTkgbzyC2Q_9dv1wXPKLXwB8dQfR4P-Ybqkbc3ygPxcWIplD3RWKDmp50Sb6rUXkDaiYd4zoteUbMSSOAR-AmEZFCsuBw_l13dvEmsi8w==> . 


Excel Optimizer


Marketers don't want creative optimization says Booyah VP of creative Sarah Lockwood in an opinion piece on ClickZ. She sounds a bit fed up, "I believe that digital marketers today have become so comfortable in the safe cocoon of Excel spreadsheets that they have largely or completely left what they perceive to be the scary, intuitive creative to others. Both search and display marketers consider the creative a deliverable (a banner to traffic or a URL to link to), not an element with which they should be involved." Read  <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109518158463&s=8442&e=001lAK1Zd3pcFw1n4YTCkhkZunQPQIfnN47f9xd5X4-OHuNHGcU_f7j7Yxq6ydES-vNIQxVci6xwhMeuctxK1W8nBwiMP0ypXMZmXCWtAI35V4j-m6kwLSq-l15HwQumzs2SoiliejDUzI2o5q-JGMiyXyWk51Q0CJKvrfJpdawa4rfI8_jGXgySk6_Zy1Lj-x-> "The Crawl, Walk, Run of Digital Creative." 


Dance Of The 7 Display Ad Veils


MediaMind senior product marketing manager, Michael Tuminello, offers "7 stellar creative ideas for display ads" on iMedia Connection. Towards the end of the article, Tuminello offers, "Although Steve Jobs boasted of buttons that 'look so good that you'll want to lick them,' we've never actually seen that happen. Although you can cross-taste from the list, you also have sound to work with - don't let sight be the only sense you engage." Lick here. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109518158463&s=8442&e=001lAK1Zd3pcFxT4Dw6hxM7bExIkOiYx0M78VaXFOTAf3dyexJt2J9rO6AxuWyg76GuyDol8q95tsdXz2QsjSwK1yNf60bQATZ3zEGl_6hgHW5YDrbA7FeJnsK2ZnPpjeHxo2ArPP_UfuOPOtfYGOUDpLKsmpuOxyuZF3Z4YhHMyJg=>  


Targeting The UK


Microsoft Advertising is getting busy with segmentation and data in the UK. According to company blog post, the focus is finance: "Similar to Experian Mosaic targeting, Financial Strategy Segments (FSS), also from Experian, allow advertisers to target users online according to their financial status - offering highly relevant targeting for products and services where this information is important." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109518158463&s=8442&e=001lAK1Zd3pcFzv8m6KjMh9Nvvpt3H7GR_vAzLShuPK7PJtP8Mn4d4qAZV2grhAs5sEkUzphu1xDOHi0SdI26UNBtGz2NT0UrZXiIeJU4EJpaetKsuS8XEcjuc1QULDaNH4AvzrKxzeYjOVERS6SooES7z06PcfwgWGPAIemvq8Goj_95QNSphemhvMeIz4JadKc6HzWxhgdRr43BLETl6z75YpwsTBeloPIFlq8suhnn9GVbGcN-CWpCsZIidbGBmkFQc0T0oGZsIUP0u9_WRRz_9r-xxLiMC39wd-GypS-L0pVHlOY6Zoe-HYDro9dgwF> .

*	Tuesday, March 13, News Round-Up <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109507059662&s=8442&e=001Hx7ExaIZPA2HXLTMKvjz_t33Tn6D-vhP4sfznPQVhkOP5pxUyNlfQ5r4cSKaJFq15E01Qt1X2IzCuEz5A5RZOpG00m1-QlIQkBj8YCZ4pSxybGOXPK-JJaVvBAirTVTzZ_zcobcOAVLHJY2lrXkxX6e4xO0JIsGc5IisbxeqeKg=>  (see below)
*	Mixrank Unlocking Competitve Ads, Trends - And Opening The Data Through APIs Says Co-Founder Lichtenstein <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109507059662&s=8442&e=001Hx7ExaIZPA1QPh3bv_lpebHIliM02fD26Ojc3h_nmMkjYLn68TCiwTOpgblDc1eBmoK9gdIRATQv2ClXItVM3S0NQp9gZddF9TG2XicEmv7hmBkxw-DyBoA2N5omSm-YkiQMJ62GH_vfWCOSlG0bEA==>  "The challenge is, one, aggregating enough data to get meaningful insight out of it but, two, actually making sure that you don't get lost among all the noise. You have to be scientific and analytical about it and not rush to conclusions. Right now, we're in such early days that it's hard to predict where the value will come from..." (visit AdExchanger.com)
*	Will The Merger Of DDS And MediaBank Into Mediaocean Benefit Media Buying? <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109507059662&s=8442&e=001Hx7ExaIZPA1dBpkgBGDJntWlT2htlodsPNvFXZX3kd8afh2kNGF4I8t8u25gmVGoKN7sJQDAuBsr-9T3yJFQ_J73ZrNBRIkhsP2NNcsSoFC00MBWl1IyDb6Mh5qE1agL0kAJdrtO3-uYkxWH6DcWbA==>  (visit AdExchanger.com)

Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109507059662&s=8442&e=001Hx7ExaIZPA32oer70cD1H9BSutqBgoE74nFclZ0MIg8y8zn_9kULneLqRxJVxO_TcYmW81kijX7j4rL-qis0EJMMaDYYrOTLv-kYTOjQO03pHAIWhQ0t_UQZbvn9NR4T5xVyq_qpsvLuFIGNi3yzVmSrPF0lTwJaHkt0XWIqZ0T5vyz02LDizA==> .



Mining The Data


The Wall Street Journal covers a new loyalty program from Sears called "Shop Your Way Rewards" which essentially re-targets online shoppers in-store (you know, offline) and "promises customers generous freebies for repeat purchases, as long as they agree to share personal shopping data with the company." Even if it's not the most inventive program, the traditionally-minded Sears may have turned a corner led by the former CEO of Avaya who "wants to use technology - and the reams of customer data retailers can mine - to give shoppers exactly what they want." Read it (subscription). <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109507059662&s=8442&e=001Hx7ExaIZPA2AGgLTZIcH8b4HnZTHU3S-RF-ZjOmeMqNAFJR9Gop6k5x2dZXS7SnVeCM8B217tDK4Tb3DJCLXmcPkq9yC1DxUySX2FhJeHGWU9LbbWTFP6cjt1KYjviAQX6aTm3xo3myLaXKHTcXufM9WWzPXtLEusWaKUK5qe8HiXlrejjyrHTQblCbjhLZt>  


The Obama Marketing Stack


The campaign for U.S. President Barack Obama is apparently worried about all the ad tags running around on its campaign website. ClickZ's Kate Kaye reports that new campaign spending disclosures show the Obama team has added tag management to its 2012 initiatives: "In addition to buying $3 million worth of online ads in January, the Obama camp paid two-year-old Chicago area ad tech company BrightTag $5,000." Will Obama offer an end-to-end ad tech solution? Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109507059662&s=8442&e=001Hx7ExaIZPA243Xpv0mmoTfRDCXJ0lvK3eSxlFu7seA9p4GX_xp5jjKr9_97TaDgwUHphUSIxOpvnrJ2dMqvJPNLYKW8b3-iCsdQ9DvNvGxIqWiAehwa10gXWu3cCwpLLvmOxE9euSQ3unFHj8_SmO9nHr2QWo96MehLdeoICcyJiXP2Sw5lGzWXbdZRUNZnM> . 


DSP Expansion In Europe


MediaMath's Erich Wasserman tells Ciaran O'Kane about the fine points of MediaMath's Open and private marketplace strategies on ExchangeWire. Also, Wasserman discusses continued European expansion for the demand-side platform company: "On the business side, we continue our aggressive expansion into the major media markets in Europe. Our oldest client in Europe is in Paris and we've established a great book of business in France. We'll also be aggressively expanding into the German market - watch for news on that score shortly." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109507059662&s=8442&e=001Hx7ExaIZPA0KFGtouxzvz8pXGaR6f3hR1rGxZ4LIcS_UriTwA4LxY-D_w9v8upHjC9JwvuTro3IY3VaaOhSfGDOWLF6ZCaAbxoJixO_m4TgmQ8X4OFWUs3GJc7Gai9Lj-gooEHOjEZd0cdP6vX3ad3UTQ9ZNQXEg9n4kTrbO7POLaWtU9ELsjmDip7flG-SAvtRqiLrtVc6-ft1LaSDe0a_R1p8GBvG9Dy0ukuakkvhiXGYTb7PgBvbpvUyurII3sO4vsX51SV7L_ZssZQB6R9PXKN1pPn7CJvGjNN-iUWE=> . 


Retargeting Ways


On Marketing Land, Shelley Ellis takes a crack at dissecting the different flavors of remarketing/retargeting/remessaging. In discussing Microsoft's Bing "remessaging" product, she ruminates, "Advertising is already integrated into a number of those products including Xbox games. Having access to large databases of users across a variety of interests could offer opportunities to build the Bing Remessaging audience in the near future." Read 'em all. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109507059662&s=8442&e=001Hx7ExaIZPA1PIwJSP177-B8-MTH_HkNmqjlNzRGd5oMho3HwNqLc6k9YyXY7HPPGvoUTJxUY-XQkgH4uCJxhW10rAkLnaTj3q61F6Hnq_YLUlTkmLQaNR9dGSVEg44SCZWVDWp46pO5TcdwRKDkRCpb-Gmo0Ei_jA8T7F8k-X9gcurv2z_kqy_gMjaPpc5Ux>  


The Intent Harvest


kbs+p ventures founder Darren Herman makes his case for why intent "harvesting" solutions are critical - and why his growing venture group is looking to fund them - in a post on his personal blog. Herman writes, "Data to enhance targeting generally should win out on a media plan before any time of blind or proxy-audience buy. The picture below illustrates this notion. The old way of buying media was to start broad and then narrow down based on performance. Now, it's about starting narrow because we can, and then getting broader if it's needed and budget allows. It's not that marketers are spending less, it's that they are more refined in their targeting." See the intent <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109507059662&s=8442&e=001Hx7ExaIZPA0hRPzRCJxJyCLDrvk58OrIcYLrDP3UEXJPFGHj-uQRZzLJ-5H44S7n6f5oY0HEQAD770M0jWWCdUXxrlrsSIfQbD0vl2-7iJmon63nkh0UfckKySvYxjA2OqhxXOo3pJcFm4PxZcA1v7roqFtxVxSZipodJ6zQxgfJHw8Id_Zuyg==> . 


Mobile Display Talk


On Street Fight, CEO Eli Portnoy of Google and IA-funded ThinkNear, a hyper-local mobile ad platform, looks at what's wrong with mobile display. He offers, "If you talk to industry insiders, the 'smart' money is on re-creating the cookie business on mobile. Without getting too deep into how advertising on the web works, suffice it to say that it revolves around creating profiles of your activity online and serving relevant ads based on the intent you have broadcast by the sites you have visited. For both technical and intuitive reasons, this approach won't work on mobile, but people keep trying." He has other ideas. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109507059662&s=8442&e=001Hx7ExaIZPA0Cj92KdVzE8ZVnhA2GOvU1RXqsRVXiO_QR6arGx7FuWMRRWiEjjFRrxapME01NLgwVNNss9gRenEggelWdS_EtrP24NgyJRDVaJ-ut5HLMpPf3rswgNsSz2cycWf_vfUcZOMyTCPaHpCy44re9eWo0iG1K9XPwItusd7vHcKaiR1N2oDgUatbo8Q2Z7AlfQos=>  


What Is "Added Value"


On eBay-owned Fetchback's blog, account executive Austin Leonard discusses what it means to provide "added value" to clients beyond free ad impressions. Given his company's retargeting product, Leonard notes, "Here in the performance marketing space, it would seem that there is little room for added value, as every dollar spent must be tracked back to a CPA or ROI. Basically, what we are told by e-commerce departments is that every impression that is served that doesn't result in a sale isn't worth anything." On the other hand -read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109507059662&s=8442&e=001Hx7ExaIZPA3_sCNAshr9nR1_b8AQHeru0PLRQ1wYaeFC3zftSxIaSgrOzUXxi-Ie4mn4waZ3p6lECqV-HaFHNETmzMbQqfa7bTBvJlUQkhNN34bpxjHjuNCR-t7fsT9cnpUhhn-LrSf0g_00dBOJ7SqHy2fbg2fA8TqTuyse_goQFDWinMoPozJv00bhoN8gtByFGp0DcyjCSIu7EDc8-Hfb2pdQLoDY> .

This shift has two major implications. First, it would solve the larger growth challenge facing the industry by aligning it more precisely with how companies approach display online..." (visit AdExchanger.com)

Standards For Mobile Display


Mobile Marketing Association chief Greg Stuart discusses the new standardization efforts (known as "The Universal Mobile Ad Package") going on within his industry organization - a process with which he's familiar from his past experience at the IAB. In an interview, Stuart discusses the outcome as Chief Marketer reports, "The Universal Mobile Ad Package consists of three small sizes geared to feature phones - 120 x 20 pixels, 168 x 28, and 216 x 36 - and three sizes of banner ads for use with the larger screens common to smartphones - 300 x 250 pixels, 300 x 50 and 320 x 50." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109492746950&s=8442&e=001N0dE4I1t8vKmLmsdCdl4bnPkAIVRqdyLvSqDkSWL6D5Ydnoa7zAzKHXP0d7VOjoDXTsgkZB3Nv_bI1euJ50r8Lphre0ecjb2r3dp8cBExusUtRWJzr_wo9V4LH1ZuPh0j0O9v2EsX96j1cDmwgC0L8AheDCNG7ZwkDVl3FQ_LxnmfMv1Ec0qfW7XjOmI_GoQfd5tX8HPPSZeLgzag_e7lQ==>  Stuart wants marketers to help drive adoption by asking their agencies, "Are you following these guidelines in creating my campaigns - or are you wasting my money on stuff that isn't critical to moving my business forward?" 


Ad Targeting At Yahoo!


From his personal blog, Greg Linden points to a new research paper from Yahoo! called "Web-Scale User Modeling for Targeting" that will be presented at an upcoming research conference. Linden summarizes, "The researchers describe a system used in production at Yahoo that does daily builds of large user profiles. Each profile contains tens of thousands of features that summarize the interests of each user from the web pages they have viewed, searches they made, and ads they have viewed, clicked on, and converted (bought something) on. They explain how important it is to use conversions, not just ad clicks, to train the system..." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109492746950&s=8442&e=001N0dE4I1t8vIvKUW5J7eg069-2Ri4jSlf9NgMy73kTZijmJnqk80IGAwvAL1LZ2UKJSFqWCVLAM5emZPAjUYPU2lxlmzfEEqlUTtB2tETfEGdfGwyaESZpnhIVLW1nDQyShG3-TJaNEbrJCtgbMhQzTNfJ8BgJDsQW4bgPLHEJVk=>  And, download the paper (PDF) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109492746950&s=8442&e=001N0dE4I1t8vK-CabydhcgD1XuUMaUJPAci-kHp51Ya8jBpDNOlpRAUF9gC2XMzBKCOqNlE7Rn-XZBdgw7TEbHlPTfNqGQGPkYhIENbOVWjnyph0t2gqvM4fivIhebSqhCtRqLp0QoM7AwMHQINzu1zzY7623sCRRuyJNz07-HU6liwb9I9xWCExE5-BVbIoe0uReRFE8KXOc=> . 


The Next Big Platform


CEO Amir Mir says the next big platform is virtual currency in an opinion piece on TechCrunch. And, he claims the ad industry is leading the charge: "The advertising industry has already seized the opportunity. Currently, if you're playing poker on your iPhone you can earn virtual currency to use in the game by installing an advertiser's mobile app. Advertisers have also begun rewarding consumers with virtual currency if they're willing to watch a video advertisement. In the future advertisers will be able to create any action however simple or sophisticated and tie it to a virtual currency reward." This is the next, digital stage of couponing or loyalty cards - and it will all be data-driven. Read it. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109492746950&s=8442&e=001N0dE4I1t8vLebLSSxIT2UbMlv84EyjAEdJwVYw2KWRfAgntK_OGV8tCstPwCYS29wJiuWMP7IwMSvqEQRXwZydPr3P9jhP9B7wftPKiM5TG2EwKh0ce_Nab_aFMz-xeeoydwaRtmvPcM3p2tItX8NJhTeJW9pylShQmM0b2g9TugROeu5nsmHA==>  


SXSW Ads


On Digiday, Brian Morrissey looks at the SXSW buzz around the intersection of ads and startups - and finds little. In fact, he thinks "a successful SXSW for most startups isn't connecting with the brands and agencies critical to their long-term business success. There is no long term for these outfits. Instead it's about capturing the in-crowd buzz and impressing venture capitalists until the flip." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109492746950&s=8442&e=001N0dE4I1t8vI4LbF1aBA8tq5aLpRMORcru0ssyMh3Pif8bFH8xa9zX8T6hbPluM0oafmoap7nF9_zdKQChhocjtS_mAtbaoE7zhymEmlBpjNy8oJaMcNnW1k-wqn7LKMVP5mR4laulXRJ7getShq0hjw0AGGXU7MzIrWILTXHkaJwCftoRIx6Ug==>  


CMOs Just Wing It


New research by Columbia Business School says that in spite of talking a good game regarding careful research for a marketing plan, CMOs depend on historical data and a wing and a prayer. Ad Age's Jack Neff summarizes, "The state of the art remains surprisingly primitive, according to the survey, in which half of respondents didn't include any financial outcome when defining marketing ROI, and 22% use the most basic measure -- brand awareness -- to gauge marketing ROI without necessarily determining even whether the awareness is positive." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109492746950&s=8442&e=001N0dE4I1t8vJt7TrRZ9dwCASppJ5WA6UZWtmBwOf1CtQhWAtzDMdPlSrOLy0qfj8eD0t-WcWRsffzmYGaR1oWrEHfd-gZgBi3bA4q6_FgyXAREikwqEi-3wrEUJC96vlJ7YFe_eWeTVpZU9_GVExxrezWzdDsWciN_Awi7rgMxXt0_QHtye9ckXDeoHtxSDxxonGiDbFffKmc_J_W_N3afg==> . Neff points out that marketing effectiveness metrics these days aren't so effective, so maybe they can't be blamed? 


Mobile Ad P-Word


More Platforms - Flurry, which provides a range of mobile capabilities from analytics to monetization, announced on Friday Flurry AppSpot, claiming it as "the first data-powered app advertising platform." Flurry and many others are driving deeper into the mobile ad space (mobile web and app) with targeting solutions as the limitations around the mobile, targeting cookie present challenges to marketers who are ready to spend more - but lack effective segmentation. Read Flurry's release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109492746950&s=8442&e=001N0dE4I1t8vL5cJlQX9UyxP5U1nuIzuevzFlr9mP9QWG_4T02yVpfYYiO3QvvzpUTjx2rkTeu22OHTed2d0DsgwQsLQR5rTk93p0DY9I8KV7ZG7ZOCB4O2wpy3ic1HOUB5g3M--qEWjMw4J5mfF5mL8dm-ajwAuBa72FXyQOVb69y44-_0HFNp6n4bRWf62SZv52qzyFpQt5-g8wAFhDPueQZ83eqknzFiNf-GHGT9TCMLGdTOwRqAQ==> . Flurry says that it's ready to help mobile publishers with sales services, yield optimization and free ad serving. 


Facebook Premium Yield


BlinQ Media CEO Dave Williams discusses "Why Facebook is abandoning 'likes' for Sponsored Stories" on iMedia Connection. He writes, "The new emphasis on turning posts into ads will encourage more users to interact with brands' most engaging content. Sponsored Stories will piggyback on that to drive even more engagement, consumer influence, and interaction, and at the same time help to improve Facebook's yield. Sponsored Stories yield an average effective CPM premium of 60 percent, and advertiser results can far outperform that premium, so the shift to this strategy makes great sense." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109492746950&s=8442&e=001N0dE4I1t8vIw4WzGPFPUgP0s2q_rtZYFm_qg9oq0xkXr8qHsFA6VaQVh8sEUECoHKZBO4C3Qs07cENKu04zIYBXETaRHsfFojBOlHkVl2cRuVhIoBHIDW2oCWMgQGQvu89NOJlFt_PyulprmBCVkFg==>  


The Google Network


Google's content creation efforts are paying off through partners on YouTube says The New York Times. "By introducing a layer of content closer to television than home video, YouTube believes, it will attract a steadier stream of viewers and advertisers, and the company is spending more than $100 million to help develop the channels," writes The NYT's Ben Sisario. Read it. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109492746950&s=8442&e=001N0dE4I1t8vLBY5UqEwqMcKjyXw6W5qytvpnocEZL2LGqjyJyXPWa9hqS7ZGjsZWqSYn8th8JVLj-HhcqMZ9knjZb8WWqTqysEgSwYFdKHxxZ_EaTF0ywBVKFeYaWUSgESakxUszJXYDTMCOmCtCDQD5JR8Fbca8QKv5iN2PW7QoZYeZnbC7ebqlO4Tcffta--C_s655aeHT0IewDeqZZv6xF9EFYxIKx>  Is this the beginning of the YouTube cable effort? 


Crowdsourcing The Performance Agency


Facebook and search PPC marketplace Trada (AdExchanger Q <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109492746950&s=8442&e=001N0dE4I1t8vLU67a2PMSXrhZRlegX1deSmu1yjrWpj2rxGELSCTYDQdKCmD9SEgJEmi9RGU8HDll6O0V_F4Jzqgo9j6UYiSjvQ17jRy4i3CRWri_XKgS4IipfSdKCkvUse3KfRU5gRC09WyuUPuZIXoG1l8n39w5RjTqQCfLDCqk_fFHPkN44HXQW3j8o5zvT2LaEWLhty4b1ALsKHjMHUob54k7WEFtAa0WwsxRFTWqLat73J-Ywcw==> &A 2010) was featured in The Business Insider late last week as the startup's CEO Niel Robertson offered up some stats to TBI regarding the crowdsourced contractors who implement campaigns through the Trada system: "'We now have a number of contractors making $65,000 a year and two making $200,000 a year,' says Robertson. Trada itself takes a 25 percent cut. This isn't an Amazon Mechanical Turk knock off, either. Most of the contractors are in the United States." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109492746950&s=8442&e=001N0dE4I1t8vK9CL16NcLn4cJa6Nle02g4D6LgjjDCjgyfHX6gzavZJf5RZ3K8HwjBbVSddVfh0pdTpzzlT35hv-yu9yFdTCwSX8JpbDgNUHq1TuLDZl7Kj4a2Omu7tDBoFzOdMnHAqtk_K5aSYAqXNr_20vKgko8ABE5vT98htyj8qDFawivo1xnA1Au2SayyzsMLsclmAtyT1CrPG_3TlkwdZb_mMn54UBbiHWKJcEpdjlP07ShdOA==> . And, see the company's indoor beach and tiki bar <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109492746950&s=8442&e=001N0dE4I1t8vJYFIX6IPzR3drEiBgHCUiOGxRtML1bigK8irdKbZG7Kc8PlsYn1s4hxbgafOqQZ-5oxQQs1iVhK1JsWkl_9CXofI9PF51KMACv2mOuIJ0OqAjqa6g5xaPoPyZc1kojzGqJDf4fOgaLOq9HtZctzGlyiTuqsLaqjb_ZghW7VVyDQHHDajRtSFjhQ0SBeXDd6tWPPalkF5Bsu0i8JFcRuy5q> .

*	How Can House Ads And Oversupply Of Display Work Together Effectively? <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109480536389&s=8442&e=001hRKhqwvu3zE8zlpPhXK1tFTUvEBY6Gsrc_TYLyoD0g4ySWU_xs0AwAzyi9E3trL9WouEocKRcMUGAjCiqdsxcHwHPY6wqhjHSjTrn3dHle0uWiQ5meDLDgh64LMo5XDajrkixdO_a4uffln2ApbNkDaX1E58KhIuIl3z-SOl_b4=>  "The future is about making your inventory more desirable than other inventory. Bottom line, expensive products in any marketplace are sold with lots of details about why they are the superior products, not by selling the unknown item behind door number two. And RTB is the only way to get price discovery at scale..." (visit AdExchanger.com)
*	Creative Ad Tech Firm Gazehawk's Founders Moving To Facebook <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109480536389&s=8442&e=001hRKhqwvu3zFj9dwmlSpPsSOz7U-9ee-Ki9lUiBfMIWGv6sqU_CpDRkzLJz1niJ21khGFdw120fJSLPzgNGQdKLPCdl5rEEYtAzcqfo9K3dVx5bdwuHJRXp_egBpbiZEAWAHQIyYiJEExIJoiQ95AGfrmg13yto-YSTWkgLy196s8juPTBrzUjyfd-ou4EupiaFt8rWdBYm0=>  "The company's founder Joe Gershonson and Brian Krausz announced the news on their site. Joe Gershonson tells AdExchanger that the the company's tech and intellectual property will be sold separately..." (visit AdExchanger.com)
