PubMatic Adds To Mobility


PubMatic announced the acquisition of MobiPrimo as the company looks to bolster its efforts in mobile in the sell-side platform (SSP) space. The release states, "The transaction will allow PubMatic's mobile platform to integrate directly with the leading mobile networks, ad servers and demand-side platforms (DSPs). In addition, the acquisition more than doubles the number of employees on PubMatic's dedicated mobile development team." In fact, the acquisition will add 16 developers according to the company. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109480536389&s=8442&e=001hRKhqwvu3zG8tpQVe9vPJISyZmP-MPJODTlA4WvfLe1vfvqdx3fDTZGrm4RqUxJwcNXvKgF1hFGpOrXVZmjRQdKr2w49n_11biafjLkrLx3xfjVKaILv6ERSURDGpNEy7YvParwcUTZuby9EIqTGwwtbgjF0R13K> . MobiPrimo was co-founded by Aditya Kulkarni and Samir Karande (LinkedIn) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109480536389&s=8442&e=001hRKhqwvu3zGE6yZ-3o1cq_wAErcse_AJQrn1X8PX0RY_3vSCZFW40uEYREI8ee9BMF9c9YQSIFnqdENWK5vp8BbJGkeSgntvroKt5dya4WjELuoT04Jp4jLLUmr2gtg9e0_qP-dg7Ok4rfRjHyJhGSzN08abrJsh>  who positioned the company around "Location enabled mobile search solution for local businesses, web, enterprise data as well as local store on your mobile," according to MobiPrimo's website <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109480536389&s=8442&e=001hRKhqwvu3zFKdkHwAbFeZhFxN-BF0TeKMC8zgtyeyi22CSceiATGokraLi6xHzfKZPtzJRKb3gw2hxWYGbss4WrP6KTptQ58ZWi_u6U7YzCSsiQX8DyzmXu1M3v1vd7y> . Terms of the transaction were not disclosed. 


Collective Adds CFO


Collective announced the hiring of former PayPal exec and eBay North American Marketplaces CFO, Aman Verjee (LinkedIn <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109480536389&s=8442&e=001hRKhqwvu3zFxSBI0SCbZ8Gnm4kRKfQMz8rwcS55wJI7eYWTQMZGQ3YwTMmXJU-3SPO1d3UCazXXVRXt5jvU3T7OyRDsOSoTodVZ45ZRQb5mJ5dsAyMKjQ5cQkYE5Ji3teV_n7-0BuIL81qWjheBHdHHWOg07rp8a> ). In announcing the appointment, Collective CEO Joe Apprendi did not hint at an IPO for his company, rather, acquisitions and products, "Collective has aggressive goals for future M&A opportunities as we work to consolidate and automate the data-driven advertising landscape." See the  <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109480536389&s=8442&e=001hRKhqwvu3zHVrKYFfabimCd8HgKucg6Z7oTKVdbtRGlIjXBhpt2aJAEU9MCPZ-LHdmRhWQ4JxQ-7XIOrrE0LIn7sU8iR4kH5tWOmAH3SI0QHG-AIIQz0_CSLTtbXJ921> "About Us" on Collective. 


The House Of Time


New CEO Laura Lang is putting her executive team into place - hell or high water. First, she's fired two exec, hired Bain to do some consulting on how to get the media behemoth headed in the right direction (that's a sweet contract), and then, "The three-man trifecta that ran Time Inc. for most of 2011 after Jack Griffin's ouster seems to have cemented its place. Lang announced the creation of an Office of the Chief Executive comprised of the troika's members, corporate executives Howard Averill, Maurice Edelson and John Huey," according to Adweek's Lucia Moses. Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109480536389&s=8442&e=001hRKhqwvu3zHWNDdFCkq5WaRytKPs8i-70m3HxDwrZSRzNkBYbUnF4jVEiX64jqN6-M8VIQIsP5cpdBMiM3KF-cgmL5MkE6MHHEuWXRtFAGODK6EqsOaC9GPvgtW-wkRkUYK417AhOFLlipBDrmhHeZj-eunBTleAUjY06R_lPgD4MWOR9TAuNw==>  


iPad For Ads


Forbes' Rob Hof says that the iPad is going to be a big deal for online advertising in a Forbes article. He writes, "Advertisers can run rich, colorful brand ads in a way that never has worked well on the PC, because despite its name, it's not very personal, or at least not cozy like an iPad you can touch." Read it. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109480536389&s=8442&e=001hRKhqwvu3zFa1hO5EeyWAyCN9BKc-Y03yQ_TQU5uKtnS15ovHqgp2vqL5IUz454lomwvP7PpXU4hOquCunpmQ_PE7vSSlh9MmlXiDAdf3gwRnyFz1pbmsR1QQXD8VE1fSQPIn5B-P-dbHeWbHAzQ1fINjUNuKPim4CZDOj9ksKCS3vpfuo1_XZB9ZCy8a3F_ENr_wpA3AfAgOfNleDCCiWkOVjdxCh1HFzkX2esihk0=>  On Street Fight, the iPad is seen having a beneficial impact on local ads. Localeze' Gib Olander says, "Already tablet owners are proficient local searchers - 64% conduct local searches on the device daily and 86% of local tablet searches result in a purchase, according to our 2012 Local Search Usage Study. With SIRI hopefully to be one of the new iPad 3 features, these rates will continue to grow." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109480536389&s=8442&e=001hRKhqwvu3zHdg_SSKHLYkCdsLe5V1JhXiO-FdSMyGtS5kaYAnpQXLta3bl9NeaQxaRmQfuuIYcNfNXdrhcT_fmrT-p_Oh48D9EljtrKgN4Lwm2MmDkhhb-d-Gnd9UYeSjDZMwX3WMINA5-y7gN8PnPclhDDpXUcUGYBmaUG7XTRPpaPczWCH0ycjJzKc85H9gYkvMKFUNl6FKwxK5ASforYtsW033JhE> . 


Display DOOH


Don't forget the out-of-home display ad. Harris Corporation doesn't want you to forget because it helped deliver a campaign for its 7-Eleven client across an in-store ad network. Brick and mortar matters! From the release, "The new Nielsen Fourth Screen Report confirms 7-Eleven TV advertisers are reaching targeted demographics and attracting viewers, with approximately 93,500,000 monthly ad exposures. The report arms media buyers with valuable audience metrics on one of the nation's largest digital out-of-home networks, with targeted impressions rivaling the top four broadcast TV networks." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109480536389&s=8442&e=001hRKhqwvu3zGrwczaXm3cd4ekXQNARXxU1kMXElmwKPJtkaMFdnRPv38mVuecIHkCSc0Rq0viF1rN5qZ6_Sy9q1nEtl73pFXZk-wofvv7Ay5Dxz-WWh4GvaCpMk-4uUzE5vIiaRIZowEl5dpNGi0e8vDUGxqqZKqg1IP5luQYxb41ZvOef84PRRP5rmMLxxG_iZy6Qxg9PgWUqHDj1hhcOqGww8MJ4PThQRmQGJ5BtPsrclyeRfXtHA==> . 


Engagement And The CFO


Sure, everybody's talking about engagement being the new ad metric. But what is "engagement"? BzzAgent's Brian Carroll provides an observation on the CMO's challenge in the C-Suite in an opinion piece on Ad Age: "The problem is that CFOs aren't impressed with engagement. "Likes," and the like, represent value, but not ROI. ROI is a financial metric and it must be stated in dollars and cents. There's no column on the balance sheet for likes. Likes are the new click-through rates -- an abstract statistic that really makes sense only to the resident digital-media guru." He sees the need for "old tools." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109480536389&s=8442&e=001hRKhqwvu3zGrwczaXm3cd4ekXQNARXxU1kMXElmwKPJtkaMFdnRPv38mVuecIHkCSc0Rq0viF1rN5qZ6_Sy9q1nEtl73pFXZk-wofvv7Ay5Dxz-WWh4GvaCpMk-4uUzE5vIiaRIZowEl5dpNGi0e8vDUGxqqZKqg1IP5luQYxb41ZvOef84PRRP5rmMLxxG_iZy6Qxg9PgWUqHDj1hhcOqGww8MJ4PThQRmQGJ5BtPsrclyeRfXtHA==> . 


Co-Opping Display


SQAD announced in a press release yesterday its new WebCosts Index which looks at display advertising CPMs gathered from a cooperative of sources. The index is then used as a forecasting tool by subscribers. A finding: "Comparing the WebCosts Leading 15 sites for 2011 against 2010 there were eight that showed a decline in Average CPM and four that remained steady in its respected category and three that showed positive gains." Overall, SQAD says that CPMs remained steady with "premium content sites" faring a bit better. This could a data feed, eventually, for programmatic futures markets. Read the release. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109480536389&s=8442&e=001hRKhqwvu3zFvDK9shUGphZnXLAHVW0T3Kvy5MvqLxX1d_9TavfWLs-ZM28YUM24PK2Kmh2Mc5xYiWXB0JcCYgO3GcPPkt_Ph0ECbTcgU--vfvQG5LbAKjTfPfr0hiUSc3QSXQpK4C4KBCghyjx3K7iVn2U5DyNwK3o9R0bTWzkzOV0NSpHoKzBWMdub83MY2WCksQ0-8NV5ieFgVic6-9o4lYEvapGly>  SQAD has been around the 70s and provided reports from aggregated data in the TV and Radio markets. 


Money-Back Guaranteed


Undertone returns to a form of the "money-back guaranteed" idea it originally proffered in 2008 <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109480536389&s=8442&e=001hRKhqwvu3zFL3a8lDoiES6RFb8dWdrDoqQEbkAVBt4DvN4XaDJnDfTuNzOGQVxxsJb0QRFfbzYu_mDdd000BsfmHbwBdaJShPKjKtDPYc6gxh-ExXhkg1j20boS9WMb3yiKGIVhUbO6iDTuxMSurznNN5Acb6TzkGxnfKrb2FlXYy6-YKUAW2G3sUPUjzLy3bEY5bUqOULbcJ5HfrONUiQ==>  saying that it will provide brand-lift or else. Gavin O'Malley covers the story for MediaPost, "'This is an industry first,' said Eric Franchi, co-founder of Undertone -- before noting that certain publishers, including Forbes, already offer such guarantees. (Forbes representatives did not return requests for comment by press time.) The 'Standout Brand Guarantee,' so-called, is being powered by a partnership with Vizu, which is providing real-time data based on consumer feedback." Read more details <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109480536389&s=8442&e=001hRKhqwvu3zFwMZTGhtFnptJ75SGMGi3zeJhFM0d0PtdEIAOEysRvGE7UJ5YJK6RtoLyMMwumaERhRKeqjghCU5z57sXnaX7uNnXvP4275LWO1RJu5XkwLO5LOnj7MkWItPNt160YfW64rgQ_M890fyevOqmG0yDH_m9B2RSGLjXVruOWkKYqdgngFmOX5UE0lQqN19Hin1m6egHznVZo_3q_x_t8uNTB> .

How Do I Subscribe?


The online subscription model has moved beyond movies and Netflix as companies BirchBox <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109470431146&s=8442&e=001Ij1cM55NHFxloiCDmO__yTOWpJ621mXFw5fGUQXOttSaIi48xvqnoiLIdR_7-C641n8inyV7IU0jMnQzUduVegSTzrDMmuUAjlXnvtT13yqPb28TqWh5AQ==> , PetFlow <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109470431146&s=8442&e=001Ij1cM55NHFyc8OEwb_7-NvfgxtDrhwb_6CshPAUYAEgc7H5lDO7XeBahkpuRKmmXIHOfE_XgXC9HTXnVwIa-fCZNKTPPxEAXX6E2E2tfRiEZGXoVNXKVyw==>  and Dollar Shave Club <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109470431146&s=8442&e=001Ij1cM55NHFzQzuXicXwTW6R8HjNGEP8mrd_cAQda6I5BYiNOkVGUeYAuCv0vWE_GeJkiqo9k9CqFlfRbdENWY3oHjgLO6WfSxULOCMRKqx_i1WY0u3CfHVV1agG-fMrt>  (no, really) are aggregating consumers around particular interests. Former AzoogleAds guy and current PetFlow CEO Alex Zhardanovsky tells The NY Times, "This is the best business model you can ever have because we can place inventory purchases against future sales. I will be shipping out 24,000 products next month whether I land a new customer or not. I already know how many bags of Blue Buffalo brand chicken-flavored dog food I have sold in the next 60 days." Recurring revenue. Yummmm <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109470431146&s=8442&e=001Ij1cM55NHFwqkH0s08yA5g8FLWX0Ek5IOz-uobuPaw59chpEAWmqyPSQLVHKa5nwfykexKJ38-1z-sRaD-RtA0pahl_C4QP90TX4f1yLu-b3D-N56235LlCZ_QAmBYnDQBQ7Qfce2XTStiCTZHXYNlfIGU5LVN0a5oqcuH-o9X4de9KQWgXeXKFX4fc6QJvcNIY_THm3pxJ8qz997ycWPog50DGZvx2V1sqw7ZDMJ_gPhVRWuQ37yvrhTURLNwsU> . Think vertical publishers can leverage their brand to create their own, relevant subscription models? Why not?


Widgets Are Back


On PandoDaily, Erin Griffith reports that "anti-display network" BlogFrog has managed to raise over $3 million in new funding. Griffith gamely tries to describe the sponsored conversation product which depends on embedded widgets: "With sponsored conversations, top bloggers compose a piece of content through the BlogFrog system, which is then pushed to their blog with the brand messaging integrated (and, disclosed, of course). BlogFrog tracking data and commenting system captures all the shares/likes/comments/what-have-yous, so that the brand can redistribute them anywhere, like, say, on their Facebook page." Sounds like a healthy, targeting data business from here. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109470431146&s=8442&e=001Ij1cM55NHFxWETy5LU3-AwInlmsplvjpRSIZn9KHShPdtldyJCLPjlsyM1rFAi-noMo7oOflD2hYTaTWoyWXZCU5zaeFwyxdBNzJZu5SOoLbZPTVDJL4lWUtYcmZAVxLryJJsm1yq_NQUCKPOJFU7Xi7wW0zmLPvq6kQozu8-EvoembFAsjCgaJGzX5gT-AyJTooG1UVGCmz5t_moTs76XNgs6F_JMDlFeDfRY2Xy8cbQ-tWVoeQlw==> . And, visit the site. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109470431146&s=8442&e=001Ij1cM55NHFx2SnGUMD7h8UbRg9r8kr95LaQINF4BN6owSIkmORh1XwSLp9cHnTXRik4j_6kS5lZlZ7czKZMqfO8GQLWtxD1Tt2sWC3Oueenf0ETLs4QXBg==>  


Close On Exiting


Upstream Group's Doug Weaver shares results of his recent survey of digital salespeople and why they leave their jobs. Weaver writes, "When asked to choose 'the best description' of why they chose to leave their former company, only one in five - 21.6% - chose 'Got a much better offer.' A much bigger percentage -36.2% of respondents - said they left because of an obsolete business model, unattainable goals or both..." And then there was the biggest reason of all... Read about it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109470431146&s=8442&e=001Ij1cM55NHFwayeL3Z6fHwQbDAftJeQEqhgrJe7SAl-22fNVQ56X7kXo7KFK_Ye_9d7c8nfuiGOfEWFWWkWEZqgvVOdcqa8NJmTQfnH_qhbeWXb1m1MOJreHWrsNq7kSHH14-wClgQCI=> . 


Real-Time Socially


Real-time social ad buying platform Taykey is Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109470431146&s=8442&e=001Ij1cM55NHFyn3LV4IWM2AgXU82BRfmNocvALwIFK9Ms_XkIDZMWiKHlD0UM3t5a6FO0Ue6JwomyzNLBXFkHXnjOoTrDIRvASi-YArs2tcoKhOmn92ykAdFsJjYJo6EncWzlcVfLvveZfrAY9F8NUVdn9TDb9--3HZ1er9iKkSbg=> . Taykey CEO Amit Avner delivers the medicine to TechCrunch readers: "Simply put, we use trends to make your sh*t perform. Whatever it is. Social, search, Display. Trends means new highly-relevant keywords that no one has, so you have less competition so it's more efficient. And we fish where the fish are, so people are more attentive." And, Taykey has added Invite Media founder Zach Weinberg to its board of advisers. Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109470431146&s=8442&e=001Ij1cM55NHFyn3LV4IWM2AgXU82BRfmNocvALwIFK9Ms_XkIDZMWiKHlD0UM3t5a6FO0Ue6JwomyzNLBXFkHXnjOoTrDIRvASi-YArs2tcoKhOmn92ykAdFsJjYJo6EncWzlcVfLvveZfrAY9F8NUVdn9TDb9--3HZ1er9iKkSbg=>  


Cross-Platform Buying

Mobile demand-side platform Tapad says it's starting to offer mobile cross-platform buying services - meaning personal computers, cellphones and tablets in this case. Ad Age's Jason Del Rey explains, "Because cookie-targeting doesn't work across screens, Tapad looks at other available signals, such as data from publisher partners, advertisers or Wi-Fi connections. [Tapad] CEO Are Traasdahl won't provide more information than that on the methodology. We'll give him a pass, given the rush of companies looking to create similar offerings." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109470431146&s=8442&e=001Ij1cM55NHFwOlSEfD1OomZA7ocPgiVmc67lcLmXpQ_Yhz6ezrguXZQqrBt5CSdvGVvDnPIYe584kLk34LMQabLXvmzJIOwiUDqlf-ancKCyb7tqRZRbLgxX5igrSe-b9bULR1Zq1RAuUWHOisXBOhL_SrUwrauHfUSyrk_4TA1Ik33DUkY5UpOkHtaPd_pI_zDYRtr43Hj4=> 


Let Display Be Your Guide


Finally, it's here! On Search Engine Watch, UK-based agency Periscopix' Alistair Dent writes a piece titled, "The Definitive Guide to AdWords Display Targeting." Read it. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109470431146&s=8442&e=001Ij1cM55NHFyxIetVOVFg6-fxY_qSAEuXrzO5F4mRvnRnkPDs7X-5lNlkVlMlmqdkEYroOv75EMm8r6iJXbzOl1zIuQl9yK9PXr5dttSQ_2E5_uBailuKRfnenOt15XNS9HmorTZGsgoZUZiU0KhoK6KvkM7MTKx0XUU1MWolA9RLUah37JReBB3qeHqiHzBOwVPKZGSx3nYJ1ibDwcg0nA==>  


The Third To Last Impression Matters


MediaMind announced that it will be integrating a Encore Media Metrics' (AdExchanger Q <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109470431146&s=8442&e=001Ij1cM55NHFzDdR2IWb7TXJKDZGkxQ3LKhyVl17DgGJJ9GwFp0V-BgwEvr7eMMD-M0W3ky_l2YcxMCld9FdtIUFrqraY4quFlY8DUUFF48mAfPgMTXgmYFFQgvTGAkGBv16HBVo7K44tGb6EjCBEnoSqrOwnWIqMLWjK50zhA888=> &A) solution into its ad platform in order to bring attribution capabilities to its clients. The press release claims, "Attribution solves the 'last-click' problem by allocating partial credit to each impression, click and interaction that influence conversions." Read it. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109470431146&s=8442&e=001Ij1cM55NHFyys_4adDKgeb1-WYlGEZX5MjQkgGeXfbWpLCY1LaIczEplvxgAZ2qAv5s5HsqYR74DFiS_70D90gLt_7BRIkdwzqFLxo-Er8Xc0ZE236ZYXYmswQe72HEEJC8mOOT6Pp7wZ1TdQ_ZfHCmIboCcbK5JSlpkovwlB5QDQxfG4rOVl4dogjMb6rs7NyOtV3eXmhedUOCVVQcfiEdzabziipbUq0lkjkGmW6Oumg8VS6asGA==>  Progressively, more and more data is being brought to bear in order to unlock better ROI for the advertiser - and that's good for publishers with valuable audience. For other publishers, good luck. Encore's Steve Latham offers his view on what attribution is on MediaMind's blog here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109470431146&s=8442&e=001Ij1cM55NHFxPbCheY_0B89uIKM3-hhevhpALTxGl5xQ7pOqG_bG7zgUQNes9LM3T6xDcMiq7K1k607znrbEhOqceAid-UchOZC12mjmNMat84llBs_AWAmagxTf3fnVI11vluI0CaC9gBuimwxbV1YpvnqQOYbwW61OkWdTq46NgR6U4kWuY9teOoPbofTIdIH_AjKrc4BoqVMxP6yb9gmqAlH-iA2bm> . 


HTML5 Transition


Folio says that mobile ad network inMobi's Sprout has been called upon to provide HTML5 ads for Heart Digital's mobile sites, which also are steadily implementing HTML5. Hearst Digital Media vp of product strategy Mark Weinberg tells Folio that Good Housekeeping was the first brand to undergo the transition to HTML5 and "has had record monthly uniques." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109470431146&s=8442&e=001Ij1cM55NHFy8bsQ59cICQ0kZzY02XrkSvupxN-jonRg67KIcuYV0T96NiQNoxNr-W44C3QBt9Fsu3DOGSTaBq_zukDkUhySQwZQsF-lUny1b_sppcyn5VOeYuUuPqDjSTAdfl12tz8Ky9HLLSrardPIzeDofNXwPt7Y6TtkSQaoQQX5VaGS6lU4KbXrf8rQt> . 


Windows Ad SDK


"iPad 3 or 4... whatev!" Yesterday, Microsoft was busy touting the beta for its Microsoft Advertising Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8. Microsoft's Jenn Creegan writes, "Within Windows 8 apps, advertisers will be able to utilize the interface as a rich canvas to tell engaging stories that put the consumer in the center of the ads in a brand safe environment." Read about it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109470431146&s=8442&e=001Ij1cM55NHFyXa9L1RAgHN3h71tBc7B7wpJGUr1G6uGGeWiA3nPjOucWaO7mJ95ratyXCPxDcOw4INw57HZZo4LgUXNCt1dRqPPFwZ79TpfvVacNhM3ZjVvHiNk4618G6gSLYdp6c_aLS5uddCIbCfMkRv8TovT8v6xrUC_dHOdRW8XX_mXWX9eNw0_ZRJXZnVXYdRQnLKCEx1oZ5QcDeK4sKdTT7gQzbPJqbvyt8nsc5obXnAzbZgmjWyRRamCFiLaTudcxCLw0hR18C8za_PvYH9ERIkRhWsL3kjLZ-vLc=> . And, then get the SDK <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109470431146&s=8442&e=001Ij1cM55NHFz-u18qvWZ0GJLH1Gj2665nnxDDAV9W1P1Lap-tJp_blP0ShKIdtFzdyzh58Alu-YaBIj4AAqRm8xsg8fw4uuI0p1Pkebjd4q7Pf9T9Q-tQsZWTUL7gKAOVbaL9gvw0H3L2NqJSHLxz4vibWenrvgz7LTQHQNswoLM=> . 


Supply Beating Demand


In another case of supply winning out over demand, Pandora reported its earnings for Q4 2011 and said things are looking good as users continue to pile into the free music listening service. Trouble is, the Pandora ad sales staff - and the traditional radio advertiser - isn't quite ready. The WSJ's Rolfe Winkler notes the discrepancy in CPMs between online and mobile may be hurting the company, "Had prices for mobile ads matched those for desktop ones last quarter, the company would have had revenue around $150 million instead of $72 million. And much of the difference would have fallen to the bottom line." That's a big "had." Read more (subscription). <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109470431146&s=8442&e=001Ij1cM55NHFxu5PWBXohJuGWwDaJyp2x5EHyuPDxh0D_2qT8iAnU-aoEzvb-JcCz_Tj9EaNKeLZlBpobtVUsqOORAxRoQpa8dICdoj5wB76IpR-RGlenFQ61kDF4xmwTOR2gB0mdPIR5hEMYIsFCOkKnBQowTYoSv8TCorUewDp0tTS7MXQRDXDpXfJbOLedq>  


Selling Remnant Is Honorable 


Mediaweek UK says Google has agreed to sell publisher (and broadband and phone company) TalkTalk's remnant display inventory via Google's digital ad products including DoubleClick Ad Exchange, DoubleClick for Publishers ad serving solution, AdMeld and Double Click Rich Media's ad formats. Quoting comScore figures, TalkTalk had 4.5 million uniques in January. Read it. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109470431146&s=8442&e=001Ij1cM55NHFxVXO8zka2W2CKG8uO4KO8ccrIPahFgUbppWr7iFKW2vCkEOy5l-fS4Y0gS5Ss3mAk09UUO-KvDI6UFbMTG_3GPe8keK4QR85UShieiXOFbPF92vWsIonPud_DMHF6ZzgEIdlGJcCFMIsmb3d_s7qr9oHXKZJuPu-uRMFq8Y6YjHUa39WQox6liZ1KEH8wXgN1f1LSkxd1vWw==>

We believe this void presents a dramatic opportunity for a hybrid agency/SaaS company that combines the simplicity of Google Image Search, specialized tastes of Pinterest users and the back-end power of a Google Analytics on steroids..." Then they were all shown the door when it started to look and feel like Right Media. Now they're inviting them back? Hmmm... Hope they solved the nested iframe problems. But for an SSP to backfill with GOOG is flat out waving a white flag..." (visit AdExchanger.com)

"This makes sense for Google and could make display transactions things simpler, but if I were an SSP or network, I would view this with suspicion. By using AdX, you are effectively saying that Google can sell your inventory better than you can. This begs the question of your value since networks and SSPs are in the business of helping publishers monetize. If I were a publisher..." (visit AdExchanger.com)

Amazon Ads at $1 Bil?


According to an anonymous source, The Business Insider's Henry Blodget hears that Amazon is trucking along at an ad run rate of $1 billion a year and is providing a serious challenge to Google in that regard. Blodget makes his case, "One big threat to Google's core search business is the potential for Amazon to usurp Google's position as the 'start point' for many product searches and skim off the revenue that goes along with it." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109461251736&s=8442&e=001DY0ZBlIqus0frBeGwoMHJuTHZrLIbLKtzJkLXkHpc8BdbFwLO76ckGW6opRwDw_C8JqmiYZWa2rq1zTY1VVg8J5TVOLPSNnrUgEb8rrk7yyPBTucBENMdbkSs31v1M86eprVDOlo5hdSL9yBuVnlvJ9fBvTFz81F> . 


Social And Exchanges


A new report from Advertising Perceptions says that social media spending is going to EXPLODE in the coming year. What's more, according to Ad Age's Jason Del Rey, "The study says the budget gains for social seem to come at the expense of other platforms, with a decreased percentage of spending on ad exchanges and networks, as well as a slight downtick in the share of budgets going toward spending on portals." Social is sexy! Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109461251736&s=8442&e=001DY0ZBlIqus2jfuItXDGfuYV1QNXy-zeN6QnAZ-qS5rEY4h-Q7DAYM6s98V_r82RzJxDMlUjiQWwJnQwaUg1a0HUPtEL4VqtRb8s9qyCXb-xaS825xCgS4BCbTVXSu6vuhwXdzxF0rL1iQX6SO9mFqyh-SxNjIj6p10rR020l9lHRBYKPEfUqLH2Vu4_lUrzgcvd_1m7OBfHRDAT_RT49xw==> . 


Googling Publishers


The Doubleclick Publishers blog announced "DFP Optimization" yesterday as it appears the popular publisher ad server is progressively getting into predictive analytics for guaranteed and non-guaranteed media by using machine learning to optimize a pub's inventory. According to the blog, DFP Optimization "is fully integrated with the DFP ad serving platform, and can be easily implemented across all of a publisher's inventory. After activating DFP Optimization, the system will continually learn, process, and adapt; this happens all without any manual intervention from your ad operations team." One less person in ad ops? Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109461251736&s=8442&e=001DY0ZBlIqus08VLmGcMqmS8EpPQj7fJv-d0ce0RqAf-dnDX8onpMZgqC0Ta8FZu33bcH8OVDqp4tfiiCAfH9Gqn2cTzItfqwwB5q_yZnmnCs2H_p8d8UlvVTWRW2dq_lES5Sqvjo2YhDG8jn15OP-mTeLYAB42GzHxtj4NkJPNuqdrl77AcF_BULNJxM_B5XTEmd2RrofW06UuDJrm9FsSQ==> . And, read about new ROI algos <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109461251736&s=8442&e=001DY0ZBlIqus2CQsiwuJpMK8qAyYvErdT1RbteTk8MVodQ0PGlD7FqIg98GeOPPzRWFa8hMbR81-7sIy_YiWmHUIA-QGuGFhg4GOygQwI_WAucKHSAEpD4EXsFNHCfdQ8DMZNCmlevf2mzcM5AYHEZklRVNHYUZ0boIi_jbN2umQPrgnSAQWgJ2dhBka5SYzF76oOzVhDqJTs=>  that the DoubleClick Search blog says will impact "CPA, ERS, and Floodlight tag bid strategies." ERS = effective revenue share. I knew you knew that. 


WSJ Hackathon


The Wall Street Journal is sponsoring a weekend-long hackathon called "Data Transparency Weekend" which will encourage the creation of "tools that let people see and control their personal data." Will ad tech companies choose to participate? According to the landing page, "The event is free but is open only to qualified participants -- those with engineering, product-development or technical research backgrounds. In particular, we are looking for great coders." The WSJ's Julia Angwin, who is in charge of the 'What They Know <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109461251736&s=8442&e=001DY0ZBlIqus3-ARljpzczyDPagtU0YUEanw3XUacFBKj3CVAdlI9kA2F7B2jHWpCA6a_-lk97E8lG9kXfUyQaYqN_77LQnffbJag9cYXIWnHpsRQP95duUJRKbk5Mc33QmE9XpcdbiGnivBqrI9MjxlLOcGGO0CtR_IYaoX8eJmMWXuZ8Fe-B-w==> ' editorial, will be leading the event. Apply here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109461251736&s=8442&e=001DY0ZBlIqus3grQ0ideF8KlC58mWxNtcmQBO9xuWLTV_E9Ud7b8QnPC3tTLDHZxWmfiST9CwYc6PsV2Y1wTvLS30CvrGefrQHhP7bkMyjyBMRKRSGcDty5sCs2NShJJzd> . 


Marketing Content


Content marketing tech company Outbrain has released its very own "The State of Content Marketing 2012." No surprise, the piece shows interest in content marketing. And in addition to visuals, there are insights gleaned from a survey of marketers including the marketer's favorite content marketing opportunities. Can you name them? According to the study, "87% of marketers create video content, making it the most popular medium. Written content, such as blog posts (67%) and articles (44%), also has a place in content marketing strategies." Content marketing - feel the fever. Download it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109461251736&s=8442&e=001DY0ZBlIqus2dxgCPzFrVzSOkY2jjJEltu3glJy4OPofzkeZviW4gyMuBfGkn7BI6a6apxhh6AoyDcS0jfyORxeSFFiKDW7PQ0czVsLNfucqwhpISBkEJ_8VvG0Mr-bRG> . 


Gimme More Mobile Ad Tech


In Adweek, Mike Shields and Ki Mae Heussner takes a look at new mobile ad platforms from SessionM (no relation to FunctionX) and Zumobi. SessionM is run by Quattro Wireless (which became iAd) co-founder Lars Albright. Adweek writes about SessionM, "The idea behind SessionM is essentially to increase app usage and retention for publishers while improving mobile ads overall. (...) SessionM's answer is a standardized platform that lets publishers weave advertising into apps of all sizes while borrowing elements from the gaming world and even credit card reward programs." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109461251736&s=8442&e=001DY0ZBlIqus0dag8-4hMkvQbaTt7XmGS-8L_sZ0aAckgyo4javCIo4qWykiEZMBmNRGOHW1h7-qmr34W8NdTWMmhcCRjRkqo0xG6nMDNoaca1hzhH8gJTSZJs6yE4IbdRYPl5yhEKdktwxkZV4_0DBqby9wnOIUSFBK7SOk42iLosrqv6h0kBdei9u3MejmONkmVmjxGUzJ_IWIDYl61r4sekkZSTn_e8> . More and more mobile tech cos. are running into the marketplace as targeting is at a premium - let alone the impending decline of the PC. Schwaaaaa??? 


Funding Spillage


Seth Levine (AdExchanger Q <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109461251736&s=8442&e=001DY0ZBlIqus090kFIzFojry4pVjEXM99Z3qVBvjtX33_N8uUkXhj-d_ZwV7og2WHu0h-Ot8KXP6AwOQT5e0QzVDELy7T2mEIodQPRUCD5guYCQ6iUIsAlQwwp2ajfKY6qO-PyaIK-wyHvq2Qf1keX0ZbCY2nlz8q8> &A 2010) at venture capital firm The Foundry Group says he's worried about the current startup environment. But, it's not so much the startups that are the problem... well... He writes, "I'm worried that in offering term sheets after a single 60 minute meeting, and in pricing early stage deals like they were already late stage successes and most egregiously by constantly running around self promoting and self aggrandizing, VCs are falling prey to a cult of personality about themselves and forgetting that their jobs are to help companies be successful." Read it all. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109461251736&s=8442&e=001DY0ZBlIqus0iKLL-WuaguwPei6mqGgu3CtqP_Gb6JIBahGbgJYutnPQ1-sztCKnzuJL_l3d_INvoa4aQ5MdvaugWQaHg2S1gqUjk8sVCF4OxU8yGXqESFwv0QmT0qNG6Kf5PD5YtD4RB8K4e2HqETwSRDnwzTzDG9g9-I4hlXZkCyage9YPnFQ==>

Verification Integration


DoubleVerify is letting bidders on AppNexus real-time ad platform use its brand safety data to making decisions for display ad auctions. The release claims that benefits of the integration include: "Provide campaign specific brand-safety targeting parameters, general brand-safety tiers and specific sets of advertiser and industry profiles to identify the right impression for advertisers' pre-bid." Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109450701859&s=8442&e=001WyMgR4e5Kp7A-CqjTktAKu3IP-s5BndpDbBrXrs0UH-fWWcnpuDJaKGKmgBZqquCZzP4kk_cm1QemlA0NEV9ZjoeZHetaiUDsBCuYGZVpz9WZT5eac0kngfogdE9cz0fyfNhcg_8J0xRs6gRE5hD3SCp-YcEwOaZgC1c4WB_KoB1QKi8o5ztUbOOfpFZUGkKVFh9M-lDFJDczrwnoeVwfZHz1MEWMFFu5Y3CDIqNlWTjMEu3KZ_J-KepMWtIm3WLCkISslegvlRymd6BWVKopg==> . 


CAPTCHA FOR VIDEO


Solve Media announced it has brought its CAPTCH technology to video advertising as now video advertisers will be able to measure video ad engagement in yet another way. (There's never enough data!) All Things D's Peter Kafka explains, "So, rather than watch an ad for Toyota's RAV4 before you watch a video on AOL's Huffington Post, you can now type in 'no time to waste' and go right to the video." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109450701859&s=8442&e=001WyMgR4e5Kp4ArKlxoEEIOZQ2zqmtgGxB5c7KXlkyWL1ou4FkNs2ndKm4i4pbyxIV6l8y7xrwFF9lsbTUZJSmYIOauqW59vbVI9CImYlOUW7gLTBYqui2Eg6IQXAIS6U5FlmyhgI12eqj_dJqnyLxF8u61M-ii8W7am0jf_11vA0eeOkla0bbygFrSIQeMt3_YjSpHgr2jz5vDYsTBM0h7A==> . 


Engaging Ads In-Game


Can a successful ad business grow out of the virtual goods world of Zynga? Adweek's Mike Shields explores the subject with Zynga CEO Mark Pincus who says, "We built our entire business model around engagement. Now advertising is the fastest growing part of our business. At the end of the day, we're in the middle of really an amazing, magical secular shift to free gaming. We think it very quickly surpasses TV as the next major worldwide free consumer medium." SocialVibe and others have had success here. Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109450701859&s=8442&e=001WyMgR4e5Kp7K9lkTMU-HdIr-ZNfhXJwDR_GhquMyckEAg8_eGqKJ_26mNVcp9jebfeD1fSuZl3p0k0mbkNe4yqlOVLsWpOyB-7oe2Vx3_zXAoB3A50CShX3uHaIw5zT2ZbnQSnwuqXel-pvqTjQIVFuEwA08meZZJqMz7YYnokK5AN4aA-c9kFzdH7y-7qlMAN4abEh_pP-T_R2NtHGBpkqNxABf9KvVtq3qlElObaU=> . 


Measuring Display


Product marketing manager Pablo Cohan at MediaMind delivers his "5 display advertising metrics you should know" message to iMedia Connection readers. "Our search-display overlap research revealed that one of every five users that arrived at an advertiser's site was exposed to a display ad. Measuring search activity can be a good way to assess if a display campaign is performing. For example, if users are searching for the tagline from your campaign, product name, or other branded keyword, you can be confident those terms are resonating with users. If there is no increase in branded keyword searches during the campaign, it may be time to revisit your ads." Read it. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109450701859&s=8442&e=001WyMgR4e5Kp799cNC2rcUIpmTMNY7kAh9ZEHjvxU6Yw7KqE69L-OykdvqRgDq-QDQsZEzJbgzrlI7zOMqcjKZNzbltqeXAXCyFsLGHdkyFiHR3Pf2V3I3ms8w0ifP5xi0oS9-cPlEhA6XEbuJfmUaqQ==>  


TV Reach Dwindling


Simulmedia's Dave Morgan follows up his previous week's post <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109450701859&s=8442&e=001WyMgR4e5Kp5rj3Tyen7VsOmM237HdF6l9xdSj56shMy6GhyRQeuvLWBU7byaux8m2DvX3RMmRJA4zRubzG1mjYX3Wq59PwepOzZFTVkkymDA_dQ2fDbi9hx_zLPqFVUlfxPPO9oYGHZVfWaoRT_-mov9y4ClgYpH8cL3dZ5mkrpYjOdyvqLboFDVtEx-bagq>  on Ad Age about TV having a growing reach problem with a still more emphatic response on why ad apostles should care. He writes, "TV has plenty of available audience, more than it ever has. However, while audience fragmentation was dropping the effective reach of the average spot, the tools and audience data have only gotten slightly better and the industry's post bundling and buying practices have changed virtually not at all." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109450701859&s=8442&e=001WyMgR4e5Kp6cpS1t0XWT3_KAj4GbIwM8jYE4jf9KObRyDxToSbKAWNI7ce-DE4duq9h9zh61mu-Rk0S6GJRXt5U1vHNLhFEUb2MR8ttJZBHocbAihYhHLwAVKC8arnwsA2-LwITUpvCDLbgjE-juM0Vnn69buALpstF3yDfopIhhQCPfWAtYs7H2SabItZqf> . 


The Trackers


The Atlantic's Alexis Madrigal continues his review of the online ad ecosystem and his concern for the use of cookies mingled with consumer privacy. He singles out The Drudge Report for "trackers" and writes, "While I'm illustrating the problems of ad tracking with the Drudge Report here, let me be clear that what they are doing is only different in degree, not in kind, from what nearly all the national news sites you visit are doing. I tested other prominent websites using the same methodology we used to look at Drudge. I found The New York Times deployed 10 tracking tools from 7 different companies and The Huffington Post used 19 trackers from 10 companies. The lesson from Drudge is that you can't judge a site's business-side sophistication by the way that it looks on the web." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109450701859&s=8442&e=001WyMgR4e5Kp4vNH99P_fILG4VyROweI6usiiT9M6k67PvoNZly3EESaCBes31LR-rBfu5CH9-i6kjRgur0ptsR3dac2NvtVsOMVmHo-zmtzxeSEZneycIlqTyWYQYoMEEDq6Ko0KBr7LAK0t65DHHB1YMqL5rtnZTYSGPJixKYSns0f3lauCTvL5stvcS8hG3qSmkj_Aa3vFQyyxhPl6czxp5VG5LKxsXd-Tk6Zd1xMpRa7GufbonedjiZPzNGzBZyNwpFFtqhKJbsL6pdN5QAg==>  


Display For News


A new study by Pew Research looks at different ways Newspapers are trying to bring digital revenue to their traditional business models. One key finding from Pew: "The majority of [news]papers studied focus most of their digital sales efforts on the two categories of digital advertising that are the largest but are not growing -conventional display (such as banner ads) and digital classified. Those categories account on average for 76% of digital revenue at the papers studied. These are the same two categories that have provided most of their revenue in print. And 92% of the papers studied said display was a major focus of their digital sales effort." Can RTB targeting local reach save the day? Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109450701859&s=8442&e=001WyMgR4e5Kp5TZt9i34oS1oHm2Q0rCadgYTPE9fg8P1rF9YixpHBHua5nq7BWy257ouPWFfml1hKqpVmI0Hzqb8UiVZ_QoFNCrJUHw0JfMMB43OsEg_l2uQzbt-RkopMHqtOc616k7f4LlymbGERwBBBjfEwmLuJeFWC1Lmutc-8=> . 


Publishers And Tech


Digiday's Josh Sternberg interviews Federated Media CEO Deanna Brown if digital publishers - including Federated Media - should construct themselves as a media or tech company. She responds, "We're both. If they're not both, they're not going to win. You can't be in the media business without having a true technology platform and a differentiated tech point of view. You can't succeed if you don't have really talented tech execs or teams." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109450701859&s=8442&e=001WyMgR4e5Kp6muluukgUDsdf7nALbyh94UOpzm96zcCNUlmSFU9BSWjq2jtDLIoMqHDWjEHYPPD9_bzfd76lDNOlbqJoXFR98chbMYkf-N2bbc7wX3-TtF3pPvjqBHCT1jr0gTs6SvE4xy2sUEotruTh94d8Zg8yOHXLXU0tzM5yXCUUy9CZfVQmnRw_WDE0i> . 


The Virtual Agency


On The Agency Post, J. Michael Roach argues that the agency model is being transformed and everybody needs to get with the program. He writes, "The best talent, in today's connected world, simply doesn't need a 'job' anymore. Loyalty to an agency is a thing of the past. Most talented designers, copywriters, developers and marketing strategists are perfectly content to freelance. What used to be an agency's constant struggle of finding, recruiting, training and losing talent will also become a thing of the past." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109450701859&s=8442&e=001WyMgR4e5Kp5rybT2xnVfEqNT4JFjHJAh1TFpqvvNRSzV13gNl3_Ank3m5p5sXdG7z2sNqvjBxQfUgrz-yiimuvZ63AL0u2sKHHECqKRFPTaSUEG9F1kOvc8MqKdNyjxhguUorFAaULVsWTR_876sr2kyd4CoKne6s69CAhROUUmj4wONpIEdeQ==> .

*	Monday, March 5, News Round-Up <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109433840084&s=8442&e=0012RFicVJQHJ1RqQCkbO42ZWZPm9phFj66-NU8x5NKnHfQFcdbBKGUyNwbgO3jvw6E0qThL8O-z4nUbLEVHjRF5gQ8FU5_2wbm6_ik6Dun4OR4GRDKq9H2F9-qzlyFitVlSPoDrtXZrsStlkYpgBRNtxvmaFXxupZMKB6c4IXGVLY=> (see below)
*	Mediaocean CEO Wise: Media Buying Is Broken, We Plan To Fix It <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109433840084&s=8442&e=0012RFicVJQHJ0aMzWFC1bulIiJAJJLoFSmo5CMl2c9nP6qzYDSTartD9cIdT0ptJcqBLGwCJclExOPVixiiJF-YX1TXLD0zBAp1RwsCgfJho7pYEveg1x_XfYUbQ5UJ3GQz3Ddd4qgqsGrCdhVkDqrpNq9pwF_FCH8>   "After two hours together finalizing the deal, I leaned back and said to Michael, 'I have to apologize to you.' He asked, 'What for?' I told him, for the last two years, I have villainized you because we competed so fiercely. And the man is brilliant, passionate and genuinely cares about his products and the uses of his products. When there is something that goes down at DDS, he has to be brought in because no one knows that company better than Michael. " (visit AdExchanger.com) 
*	Adap.tv CEO Ashkenazi Makes The Case For Online Video Upfront <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109433840084&s=8442&e=0012RFicVJQHJ3IiwI9P40t6UuBL-cG7gtVsran1rhVZdcjwoQhCQXsBJ73QbncZwlp7vErYor59z5rDKKqx2Toqt3fJ7mk9tRcYOl96FroLLo92leekVq0lMQoHKAUUvrB6k_Oa55cdPUjiW1ynamhyWfN3BpR8A1fGKWzd2JyWFeOTeUiYbQKlQgRjhs2RqO0>   "Unfortunately, there are a lot of misperceptions regarding automated buying and selling, such as RTB. The reality is that in RTB environments, the seller has complete control and can not only segment their inventory based on value or price, but also can restrict the buyers who have access to this inventory. The notion that RTB or other forms of automated buying is a "race to the bottom" is quite unfounded..." (visit AdExchanger.com)

Social Ads FTW


TechCrunch says social ad network RadiumOne is looking for a $50 million fundraising round At A $500 million valuation. Not bad for a company that started in late 2010 (AdExchanger 2010 Q <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109433840084&s=8442&e=0012RFicVJQHJ2hrCDp-5XURZZh-BIyOB87l8AzQDKVzmcNwcMkq7TnS2Vlm1LgUobmLYZPC07EvNOUdceFjQwtUKwroqA1VyYZ_tdYzgBhSLY8gZioEQXM9kwrOcE_6IkJpNn_2pk4kKGFi-sMHQ3F1w==> &A). TechCrunch's Leena Rao adds, "We're hearing that the company is on track to surpass $100 million in revenue this year. And clearly the company's valuation has increased since its last round in 2011 (AdExchanger 2011 Q <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109433840084&s=8442&e=0012RFicVJQHJ0U6PP-9bqai0PHYer9dWObpBwGYIJgR26-EnaKmrt1uJ7u8hdAZIjmXT-q5U2RywVZI654WI6Unq7C8Z4sPlEra7xWYvfTanJzXhgeu1qtTBvUjv2V2LuDDG3pUrAwIkjh6ulrsrthCSzzlAmRlhSSckv8n4fITfqtfigV0OZ7NA==> &A), which pegged the company at $200 million." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109433840084&s=8442&e=0012RFicVJQHJ0c8J-zPHoC0dr-ueybl2bCUpDisT5Ri-Qwf4jyy-5foyXSSW4nJNPjoP0SDQYnunK6aROPb_QzHh6Nl_2-lWk7bnksE9V98_aTGX3kEJDq3eyjPanwo-F3GMWy49SFGU5WHWf_8l05Zdg-49yEKCCgEezFnTfNmH0aomhs2mJ_QC2pNj-fUeJRNisCFCWIhUg0gJKW-w7C9YpuJl1iRjmHj0kYo3fho5dsK9W-YNYayA==> . 


Reviewing The Paywall


Russell Adams reviews newspaper paywall strategy success or a lack thereof in The Wall Street Journal. He shares some stats for what seem to be some of the winners compared to other lowly numbers offered, "The Star Tribune in Minneapolis has attracted 14,000 digital subscribers-equivalent to about 5.7% of its existing weekday print subscribers-since it started charging readers for its website in November. The Boston Globe has sold about 16,000 digital subscriptions, which include those for mobile devices, in the three months after it launched a paid website last fall, compared with its daily print circulation of about 200,000." Online ads isn't making up the difference. Read more (subscription) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109433840084&s=8442&e=0012RFicVJQHJ1OFbuJ1YueB3KNSIxdvHZUzOMVLRxKK08yOlzfyu9nnpbqraw7RFDLN9jolc6aZ-SJhVhzhpD7VleLLL7FodD5idiN8k2orE1GH1CkNItP6SDbs05TntdyNq3GFWLplo3ItQL79m6kFJ4VDXskyOKx4VtLUaEr-6gHXvJQ9aIspuGRi0DrgMNz> . 


Retargeting In-Store


If you're tracking the digital-out-of-home (DOOH) market, then you're likely intrigued by Verifone's acquisition of LIFT Retail Marketing Technology. From Bloomberg: "LIFT's digital displays, which sit next to cash registers at gas stations and convenience stores, assess items consumers have in their shopping basket and suggest additional products they might want to buy." Verifone says that this can lift sales 5%. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109433840084&s=8442&e=0012RFicVJQHJ2aN3VNKqZzPXG9ztZHvwG1QScHwaOdFxkGtVqHuS9f3W7teUyuLAcDw-Y_XjEO3FDhwhd718J_blnin8KLAeYlrpWZo_VkEIju5954sYCuqGxr_J1v3aOjS7YITVT28QQOeWXpM87UecChr7GI4RtCeGQucAiFlyxEZJqqjRp_9WDGaFdJzNtgCWq_So6cceH5yupEY1V1U3oX7k1v67Ar8PkhZM1EszM=> . You may recall, Verifone is active in other DOOH areas such as a taxi cab network (AdExchanger Q <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109433840084&s=8442&e=0012RFicVJQHJ1QdzagXHNrZGdgOKab79wFJ1fcSMZWhkyQHUUzkOqo7VxvMKFfzdnU2_8w4SUIOoqP_03pDRiGyRy4L_XS2sFj2zhh1pLOz9zXHblBX8f_xQeFCEYl6ZU5_QI4VwXU-lo05i1aq9O2ICFcHmtCRLWBlLp5tvEgIKo=> &A). Is the next step online (and cross-channel) for Verifone and its ads strategy? 


Mashing The Display Data


Ad verification company AdSafe Media has released its semi-annual review of display ad data pulsing through its plaform. Good news for ad networks and exchanges - kinda. A snippet from the report: "Impressions that represent a low degree of brand safety are deemed moderate- to very-high-risk content. For publishers, the overall proportion of risky content increased by 25% in the fourth quarter while it decreased by 14% for platforms/exchanges and by 40% for networks. Despite the overall increase in risky content for publishers, the portion of very-high-risk content for this channel is still significantly low compared to that of platforms/exchanges and networks." Download it (PDF). <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109433840084&s=8442&e=0012RFicVJQHJ1s8TMOqtJUr6KXh9_LhbrDOyq84MmEcS5z3E5qoyXgp_0bpakkCSsLFc3nH6F50wBshYvNJK7HSHHvUo45fZsjU8nXU4P3pstFb47fX8vvOA-rhx6Phio70Zq_GBpPLCLX4Y9FfrDAR1ZbGS2h8DLSpHFTMcUxKS1BFlwoi7BvAA==>  


Reviewing "Ad Tracking Firms"


Last week, senior editor Alexis Madrigal at The Atlantic published a feature on the data-driven online ad ecosystem titled, "I'm Being Followed: How Google-and 104 Other Companies-Are Tracking Me on the Web." Among the highlights Madrigal finds the number of companies in the space "dizzying" while using the LUMA Partners ecosystem map as reference; and, he does not trust self-regulation in the least. He concludes, "...We know that this data is not going away and yet machine intelligence is growing rapidly. The results of this process are ineluctable. Left to their own devices, ad tracking firms will eventually be able to connect your various data selves. And then they will break down the name wall, if they are allowed to." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109433840084&s=8442&e=0012RFicVJQHJ1H-VxyTMwkoKeOP8SmnG1SoKYapZOI5HdKWejuZxYsnOv9wPoIVlSHRh0vA8iqZsl4MQs2X2z8t3_we-eXypgVA4u8PZN3abu3OQqijo83meS_d9lNRxHWYmY5LVEXFRBx46fiWGnIb-ujCiNpig0N6K5-0piMsMf7zmW11-TkrkobadjHe_2SYl3B6Ys9byk44Gd6uzSvOP93HyGbv5pLvaWVQ62ZgE31diXE_l-xAgLA9f52qh_Tpjbp50zK_5UGiCpM9GReoWtjFo_zoODW> . 


Display Ad Alliance


In an article late last week for Adweek, Mike Shields says Yahoo! is trying a new tactic to fuel its display ad alliance, "How badly does Yahoo want other publishers to join its fledgling sales alliance with Microsoft and AOL? So much so that it's holding content distribution deals over the heads of some prospective partners, while looking to entice others with the promise of getting their content on Yahoo's traffic-heavy homepage." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109433840084&s=8442&e=0012RFicVJQHJ0oBNRj2K8JkqFTojEbvy1U2YJmcbVaRDrrydw1FbsAYZhlMMwRic0s4SpkCEdjplMsyVeyBTxo5tpfYKdfdAoh2YNFtTK_0avzbbwALjtObwj2SD0s_pg9bNJ-h_W4IxbtCncQ8oFFEQKrv6kFiTrqmfxt-WbbNIMtxxHLpy45AMc8KPp66Kl3pyaXK_FC90KWbTYr1CXQUA==> . 


P&G Event


Federated Media is bring its well-developed flavor of data-driven, "Signal" events to Procter & Gamble headquarters on March 8. P&G announced in a release last week, "During Signal P&G, we'll bring together a powerful list of digital leaders from across the digital spectrum, from major platforms like Google, Twitter and Facebook to innovative startups in advertising technology, mobile services and cross-media data providers." See who the lucky presenters are <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109433840084&s=8442&e=0012RFicVJQHJ3d4OV7pn5X0VAMHGJYfWjsnikqyYxsO3xYljrfh1iNYCumyO-_qal-hg5d8MCtIIR2X4f07nTqzRGxeaS9SJna5F0qzrY1ZOuj0lU9vu78gj0CWGJa85d8I-9Rh6Td7lNL4SxL9Mt0S5tBdRXEQwkM7ZI6oLhQ_8mnf4nDDyb6B8TZvEby2u5BdwdftJUbgdlzkIsmaLEXJg31iUw-xqw6bFdT0Ip3I6E=> ! 


Ad Ops Insides


In the first of a two-part post, Adopsinsider <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109433840084&s=8442&e=0012RFicVJQHJ3_QLLtboxyM1oETfpNUBIiZAx6yZr5T35fNMmno8pXL6gqJvBtbzuNZNMf4SGB7Z7q0IeN2QaEh1vL-enhWAkARQJmH7PGqsnwJe_8uwnCvg==> 's Ben Kneen returns to Adzerk's Run Of Network blog and gets down to "brass tacks" on conversion tracking. The how-to includes this from Kneen, "Simply put, a conversion is success; it's whatever a marketer wants to measure from their ad campaign. For some marketers, a conversion might be driving a user to make a purchase at their online store, for others, it might be getting a user to fill out a form, submit their email address, download a coupon, or maybe even as simple as just making it to their website. You might ask, why wouldn't a conversion always just be a sale?" Read the answer <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109433840084&s=8442&e=0012RFicVJQHJ3jy_asBoBzPMD7Cw388PBqlOp7FrrABW78e52VM_QIZ6psrXKhw6cN1XMmN-SCw4_WJfVHJVqyg61fJxa482rGqbmmaUP-nIFb7ExCxMOGwnfzpwqus5UJiex_cjjd1e6XPd6_UqBG3C8Sx9ExZi4CAfdPBkv2N8gc4tavdUiK4LXtMCHOI1MB-rO2y9p9LlCcJ6oWVObFxA==> . 


Coming And Going


All Things D's Kara Swisher reports that Yahoo! Labs chief and stategy exec, Prabhakar Raghavan (AdExchanger 2011 Q <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109433840084&s=8442&e=0012RFicVJQHJ0j-jN7euFUu7kHR1kGzqKcExV_xGh3YCRWqiIjra0FOb87rA12TQHeDF-VyYbkEq2GgGKkRoXanOY69BcC0SHLNBqV9TBnaH9exWSrn7sLPBjnptWeoPpSYTOCi9CZZ3APwfwotpOEuf87Uqf0-iWl> &A), is leaving Yahoo! to take on a yet-to-be-revealed role at Google. Swisher writes, "[Raghavan] was very well respected within the company, which seems to be curtailing its commitment to research as it attempts to turn itself around under the new leadership of CEO Scott Thompson." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109433840084&s=8442&e=0012RFicVJQHJ3WvNcA4R4qXnWMUC9cxwE5sp2rR8AHGOOrcvH9Y508Oyfi-IO2EtKwarpJMBZrjhv7-0HBGqaiq6Obo0NVf3ORiBu6p-N_aCBCOBN5qAOWYQFGtfx7wtHxA74Gv-hrbQoSEZH6WIOGYTd8FN75gebsX79jd8UYUXxtLos5bHUFVpG1TuGo0hY9S9kxngKRp54=> . 


Yelp Worth A Lot


In case you missed it, local reviews site Yelp went public on Friday and now has a stratospheric valuation of $1.5 billion on $80 million in revenues with no sign of profit. More millionaires mingle among the digerati. But, The Business Insider's Henry Blodget is not impressed, "We realize that investors are starved for growth stories. But wouldn't they prefer to wait for an opportunity to buy these growth stories at a cheaper price? Look what happened to Groupon's stock after the IPO. Look what happened to Demand Media..." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109433840084&s=8442&e=0012RFicVJQHJ22xROOjA-O3A35d4vMqCfB2tfj7f1in7J4wrxju6iKI60w-wsdmqnds0zvEypr3U-b7bjN8KdoHDtKDbla3O2PdnS9uKuBV2z3WkQsrpMs-pb9ikPjYD6VK_NZzZJIOi9a9EkP9EhU4Q==> .

It comes down to, in our mind, where do we want to focus the business? For the time being, we're focused on our core customer, which is an enterprise customer that needs to market a huge company in the States or a big global business..." (visit AdExchanger.com)

Amazon Dipping Retargeting Toes


Ad Age's Jason Del Rey gets wind <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109422470761&s=8442&e=001mwULUjTIgOPYiwWJ3Fdjg0BxRE9fY-CG2uqaCcVFRhic3etvLo3N4dWNhdWV4RqJHf1aKwl_av84HJJET1fR0Dgv3VrOm4q4HpRoy6PWxxsMYpFfKJRVMiePX9T4eIUjYd5wy_p6ARxs3nkV9vQddm2SKxC4G8_C1FfBuDLoYU0A9g-m8KiZlg8wA49OWXDnYYsGqk2QAxU=>  of Amazon asking the agency trading desks at holding companies if they'd like to taste a little Amazon inventory for retargeting. But, will Amazon part with their data? Del Rey writes, "All of the agency trading-desk executives who spoke to Ad Age for this article were intrigued by the prospect of working with Amazon because of its perhaps unparalleled insights across countless categories. But almost all of them said they'd be surprised if Amazon sold segments of its data to shops to combine with first-party data." And at this point, it would likely be way too expensive for most ATDs to buy from Amazon if Amazon's deep-dive, segmentation data was involved - especially the targeting criteria that could be derived from login info, buying histories, etc. But who knows? The potential for Amazon's targeting of trade dollars and selling retargeting to marketers (and their agents) remains huge, too. Del Rey says Amazon is getting busy with that. Indeed! (April 2011) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109422470761&s=8442&e=001mwULUjTIgOMMCPyiayf9l5QiJqZuFYXxkBo7RVJkyiw8erLqlGeVVMEcdeOshYvNY5fn1AJZ6JqOJ-N7nrxHyweFfMvuftDojQQdf2q72bi59JvzhthvVmfY6UNR63UqpP6WChFMyH-mxPUbMH2hjUGefo2SbgisXUzG2PRdLJUAgliX7vo9ACigdHWQjSPv>  How long until we hear that Amazon has formally layered a trading desk/media agency on top of their business and started executing in a way that impacts an Amazon earnings call? Del Rey gets Amazon to talk a little - which is a lot more than they have EVER done in the past about their media plans. No doubt, Amazon could do a lotta audience-based buying business quickly, and it would be very healthy margins compared to the comparatively skimpy margins they earn on ecommerce. Beyond owned & operated properties, the inventory from Amazon's enormous affiliate network could be intriguing to ATDs, too. Gonna need to optimize that yield for publishers, though. And, it goes without saying that Amazon will need to plow through any hoopla around privacy when it comes to ad targeting.


Ad Network Expands


India-based ad network Komli is continuing its global expansion plans as the company announced on Wedneday that it has acquired Singapore-based Admax for an undisclosed sum. According to the Economic Times, "Admax, launched in 2006, claims to be the largest online advertising network in the region, with a presence in Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines, Singapore, Thailand and Vietnam. Admax will give Komli access to a publisher network of over 4,000 local and international websites." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109422470761&s=8442&e=001mwULUjTIgOO6M2lGzusGlaUq-1s8vr9HRMXvXW6vSkleJy2KXPfBHdpf3aR-dXFgB0NZeDdik8uztgRiFKwnek-N35ByzYijLD0mgi0LK1vE5VqQE7gDhNu1Hg64SIva8w2KIOaB8_h_2DFhx4Wxzyn5TmXUiEUi_J_mi0pxnXqdsLpPamNlAIeKSQHhKcYYkEU2EX9htrK1B3o1oWm89M0r5tmD7KSJk4ZjQ9TPFFFrue-_PmT3JRt2f60WJxeyvu46cRNObV8=> . And, read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109422470761&s=8442&e=001mwULUjTIgOPLVU4OiMt8noNCC32MvzS6fuGcRNjYkZJaay7smaOfXqBDuBwykGS9fFCt4De-dPBQqkpeetOlUj0ofCYMjlswtxowxwr0vualgArNRuQZiC4z28bIssK7WdCn6vfcSc9tXNppfd7zs2Bq41ms6a_v> . 


The Ad Network & The Apps


Social ad network RadiumOne continues to look to mobile apps and content to create proprietary social signal which can speak to advertiser's reach and audience targeting needs. From the press release, CEO Gurbaksh Chahal says that the his company's "Labs" unit has created a mobile app called Via.me (iTunes) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109422470761&s=8442&e=001mwULUjTIgOOZldf9uqg5Z77ifV7M0MwCUoaRDPJMYGE8Z-NMnt2uLwPhjGwSo2dGZL4tiYeW2CiwuquaA56jCA3_BK89YwHKBf3woGxhdqwo-RuEaKa2Y-bCDCtUt1sY4YSwUmbYO7bIuYFHqUjY5BpSCNBGLmIu>  to enable "publishing multiple types of content from one place across all your social profiles." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109422470761&s=8442&e=001mwULUjTIgOOozlrRyEf7L24-9lMXdOPsRgUIRm1jE7cXq8eDLpEbrWN-bFj6gqFAm8ArhScNtD3omn-F30QOVj-FURFiF3Et6oY5R29mkcRTF9MDUS29RQYTM2l2H2ryzaPH-1zlGf1v-NOXWPSyhzUNDrVfq-w3BjYtQAFI2vNrcIwMwj5J-NMdK1EYaO-5kyS1yyKkZNVwC5Qoe2Yp5ZpQL_3OpHTz> . The company says Via.me follows the launch of mobile messaging app PingMe <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109422470761&s=8442&e=001mwULUjTIgOP972oj6t89nRwqGPnYb6vgQosJmcx8-ydSSUkN_dDgpYVHVE2xK8p0LlnLmnSw9A2cg1aEkVyFbXGYGfo3LVD05l08yfRX3cOtWswJtjmQMb1EglsdomIlBaAKlccTprugXh6oGthMCjtVJVc6ckD3xP8e-JVaaAI=>  in September. As companies like Chartboost (Q <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109422470761&s=8442&e=001mwULUjTIgOPGwRD8-VtGdJ2K6AqIU6fCX58hy6ro5-2s6hIGHIirVb-OaF3mkcFBDASBO7biJUXn-ozGc89fC6B9N0itisFHp0HHksCHQpL9vfbGUtLvg35cKSJZbUMp1ZRpUEl-PxUO3RNjnn60Ew==> &A) have recently shown in AdExchanger interviews, the app promotion and install ad network business is big and growing. Using companies such as these (or app ad networks) to get your social networking app installed, and start sending valuable signal, could be a cost effective way of creating differentiation with mobile ad data. 


Sky Publishers


From the Google ITA software blog (yes, there's a Google ITA software blog), Google announced yesterday that it has customized a complete, soup-to-nuts website for reservations with Cape Air - a small, regional airline. A familiar theme - Google is capturing the long-tail of airlines. Over the long haul, the efficiencies it creates and learns about could make it even more attractive to large airlines (think big publishers!) and include deeper integrations. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109422470761&s=8442&e=001mwULUjTIgOMOv8ffkqOIkXeCgjjo0yUHf8HzgiWYNLkk_qfWGOJpbVXyV-qHaSh2-LQ6H2erkI1CdvGQu6shU2jw2guMKp8NWVtPNnivvkBD-e1h1mwm_GFR5sT1nV7jzkebARZZNgBFm0aNvj_sDi6QtfPD92jdSpwW2GwuEmbQY0jAk1VqJbGZpk4LCM4t162YgxP-Ta4=> . Think of the data available for ads! PC World notes that Expedia, Kayak, Sabre and others originally were against Google's acquisition of ITA software and "contended that the deal could result in higher travel prices, fewer travel choices for consumers and businesses and less innovation in online travel search." Google could definitely eat the margins of those companies as it can let the margins go, capture market share and increase efficiency for airline partners. Read it. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109422470761&s=8442&e=001mwULUjTIgOM9BrvNDwDUzfc9Uyw9CZpx_5FZS2XSzZVNhL9rjvMO6BbLXs5IpRdKGrJMIOUhAHx_LlfbDJH0fAR3M0bO198h5OtfqNU9f5kdzsuBH-ptBHu6_Ljmwo5mJA_DX4qSb2Mv-fFo_RtZYrVBWrPKDqM0hD4zMMQC3xC1yopvAmCS-TxSpsXP6c3uHPe1R_M66D4lH5ADN6NY7Q==>  AdExchanger Aside: Cape Air is the only airline which lists 35th street and 8th avenue in Manhattan as an airport. Schedule now <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109422470761&s=8442&e=001mwULUjTIgOOs-AAGNgHzugcPpzWahQrLoiYhxIoTV2R-9UcckqFWwJ_b8I_GQs2gTsYzovuCB-NUaNf3rkvnU4ogwnv4O6zbq2iZARVz-gyyNduoCUtpqA==> . 


Negative Selling


On MediaPost, Amy Auerbach of agency fame and Tremor Video's Jason Krebs discuss the topic of negative selling - i.e. when you say nasty/negative things to your potential client about other vendors. Neither writer is a big fan of the negative. Krebs offers the views of "revenue legend and current CRO of Triad Retail Media, Brian Quinn, for his advice. 'First, ask the client if they agreed with any of what was said, and address concerns. I may also call the competitor's sales head and tell him/her to cut the crap." (Note to all of you, please don't cross Mr. Quinn).' Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109422470761&s=8442&e=001mwULUjTIgOOGP5Tgw-d-Dcd-RiYXfD7MdQ1zEpG6fhqKEawu-KkYdhT_lNFD56L004MLkmVgKnbCvs2_P3uNG9Py6-hFoLXCli2hxYqgfdkUzjHkd7Qte65KhGOWFRU-rOV3Y4XRQQrpH7NQH0MSgQnFaDoCl8FrJToYMzQSZNdI08sXLCRfK4YvSqqernRXxymAgmic8Wow72nbI1pQwzGdFIjMIrir> . 


Publisher Networks Hit AdX


More updates are afoot at Google's DoubleClick Ad Exchange. Google announced on the Doubleclick For Publishers blog, "We've revised our policies to allow publisher networks to use the Ad Exchange even if they own & operate few (or none) of the sites they represent. As always, every partner site has to meet the same high-standards of quality as every AdX publisher." Google wants all (brand-safe) publisher inventory hooked in - why wouldn't they? Over the long run they can potentially disintermediate the mediators as liquidity builds in the exchange. Will PubMatic and Rubicon Project start selling through Google? Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109422470761&s=8442&e=001mwULUjTIgOOA0gu8QGkp5GjN2MKeLw5OuwEkEgQDIrFQTR-o95aCHwiGzWcqr8OAN7G_-m9KaSbpr3XZqgf5lx6FYfePzHJSUAfI6a9AEK8JMcQOHUG-x_3Q-ApBVe9lrnZ8TgN5rvbp94mxF_V7N2S9_ZG7HJvGgPjFdSg6l3eBqZTQwyJtYUZqTkJcu3KEfHuYHHSz61u4NkAVZpKFCQ==>

Mobile Ad Anecdote


Mobile app marketing and platform company Fiksu (AdExchanger Q <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109422470761&s=8442&e=001mwULUjTIgOPttzaRWxCZ30URB-dyb7bO0FYqbNmn6jB2hNdqw7lEyRxckXS29g-n5Y1PlWg4RcT3SZscw_3lb7T3-BYGsS2ECG4wEXi_goY69i-fbDATCxB6-XTPyET0dvA0NSiNJf0=> &A) says that according to its data and indices from January, mobile marketing costs decreased 59% in comparison to the month prior. From the release, "The Fiksu Indexes reveal that, while many advertisers joined the rush to spend over the holiday season to drive up app store rankings and acquire an elevated volume of users, January provided one of the best opportunities for mobile app marketers to-date, as volume reached an all-time high and costs approached an all-time low." Read a bit more about supply and demand <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109422470761&s=8442&e=001mwULUjTIgOO0HAbDaAUi7aSEPFVC6E2h7e8zMkeomNgUVYez3myX8HWHR9VaNqmYODorhle_lFRAw5-qgSeAdfju7BkAqJPENvgr5sJ7kjqkSlqxyMJcEFW1G4Sb9MCMH6w56Hu435CNVEbVbmMv9pye1YV2FcGvZMsh4zwfh_ytshxcw3voD9rBbO3HEqdQy-fX8Xx0idi0tLjceY3DwkCeLIQw67ezSDszpdRae1gpJ4ToVRJK56WVQI27eaMaNxuVvmcUHN3T93_Y3XNKbQ==> . 


RSVP: CPMs And RTB


DMP/DSP Turn's CEO Bill Demas talks about European expansion and RTB with AdMonsters Gautam Srivastava. Demas provides the pulse on CPMs these days and more: "We're using the U.S. as a model: increasingly what we've seen in the U.S. is semi-premium inventory coming up for grabs - it's not longer just 'remnant' inventory going through RTB. I've seen $20 CPM bids coming in for some of the top stuff and that's exciting. We're expecting this pattern to emerge in the UK and Europe too." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109422470761&s=8442&e=001mwULUjTIgOPrWG3zTvRAOFoGiQr5d29AYZS98QwAsi4PXn243yysPgilSjWWfy1UgHI-wCn8nmDiVlT-quzjuvm6-pA-Cef3P5J8dfj3Tt_TqYLcSFHsWEvJLJt2JG34AVe2hwHSUcGuhtFlY3SvTLMJs-E1Ve9p5F662fPHa5KNaUeb85vHqORbtRagqvgzvHbXMhyQmi-zIVN1omi6IRiC0Y28PMDXtyh82dnoS69S_qLBMim8GaCk1R71Y6-6> .

(visit AdExchanger.com) 
*	True Action Network Chief Creative Seabrook Seeing Data and Performance Driving The Creative <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109413045039&s=8442&e=0017TrtjdYQfM3Otr1ojFZsoelJfWOYNyVMvFoW7Dv2pGZtsy0Uu18bts-adxrNY08A8ZinHjRrksAedRpEQW6kC4KJOW9AtL2sP91l7W3t0m1S82CFjhRGyW851oR1RWY15GQFzCA57ENi7oNZecs5LvEyzruFlHunsYWEQONaJo0=>   "People have different definitions of what a 'big idea' is. Our particular flavor is ideas that drive response, spark engagement with the user and create a chain reaction of user interactions and user feedback. That's our litmus test of a big idea, something that is essentially contagious, and sparks a series of interactions between the brand and a customer. But, it has to drive results, too..." (visit AdExchanger.com)

Facebook Premium


The premium ads play by Facebook, originally broken by GigaOm <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109413045039&s=8442&e=0017TrtjdYQfM0MiJpHKVhKyswMgv_r8yxrY_DxT7c1yU0zMKXIk18PNumOmnawmFf8bo4XmmZUYk4A9RYRxg6VTJrORFfH_Ud3HVuS4DKwrgC_7ldeiXtviB2sxzQN-smcfbWDVIzWOvvw149Bv4lRiaO_04nw-71dePhkuN-lW6RC4SDtgSdMMOZMZ3JU09lti9OXiDjpn1o=>  last week, was made official. At The Facebook Marketing Conference, Facebook's executive team rolled out the new, bigger ad format which includes bigger images. Also on display was the new mobile ad exeperience for its 425 million mobile users and the advertisers that want to address them. Reaching for those brand dollars, according to The Next Web, branded content will be a key part of the picture, "Starting today, brand stories will be eligible for distribution on the Facebook Newsfeed, to be displayed alongside updates from your friends and family. To put it simply, marketing on Facebook is going to feel like the rest of Facebook. And Newsfeed isn't just on desktop, it's on mobile and tablet too." Content as ads or visa versa. Facebook is trying to balance between user experience and providing the advertiser a bigger, branded opportunity. There's plenty more from the Next Web <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109413045039&s=8442&e=0017TrtjdYQfM3rV0otCfl9ebEhXU3do7vg7PZlBJyARXskwuC7LfKReayZK9U3JWVx9NbkaDxe4JDkvUSD_uMwCjkHQ_tjGKJNJ6PUGGFV-mjwYnxJJVRGhd2XPw_5w6J1cF24sTE_HxAvQ6tbf7XTk-MrGcElPAN2-qSAK4Bw0n9RSfIDoweXNP4GjFsmOcQeHgLn61APBBngWS2FokXibkmkWGgnF0ee97OEAggvQ_g=> . And, Adobe's Context Optional (originally acquired by Efficient Frontier) blog offers its take on today's fMC (acronym = Facebook Marketing Conference). Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109413045039&s=8442&e=0017TrtjdYQfM1DCP8I4zZY9gPZpcSbBJyVE7eq8lBXEqXEkN2Jfu9v5icLw6hJ5nJsncWfZxqlVpUQ0E9sZlYmumPWjg4qYVcKr6VBccJghb4IPs8bMKAa3cjV3gLL03XzlH3Wdz2nSCMdPESHVKeVxV2RY-CO8hFCBrwGx8KqMUSnV5eYd6CRgnoygi_h5dkH-UKP-JIEqC4=> . 


Updating Display Apps


Update time. On Forbes, Tomio Geron reports on the latest update to Flite's display advertising platform. Geron writes, "With the new cloud-based Flite Platform 3.0, brands can move quickly, like a presidential campaign, uploading new content every day and having it show up on ads in real-time. For example, videos, text and other content can be changed depending on what events or topics are trending online." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109413045039&s=8442&e=0017TrtjdYQfM0ONgT1QvKv-k9sBwPW47YOxaKD5t8B8GbGl6aEjf15oZyPc6CmnvTgzOMNUYsazR6xqIXO-3NEN821USsCDadRGYS8Oaz2S7n-FzIpcVHVAH4c56MQY68KmvLCkl762Pkd0D9JIK-m1UeweoNPKaZhzQaH_Vcpn79LBubg7dQTeYoJReRup23vRaMHGbYQKv5iOs0BKp0OQN63ks2zZsVio-qWDXQ1qa8=> . Flite was an early adopter - if not the first (only last September!) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109413045039&s=8442&e=0017TrtjdYQfM10-DGIwxUCytHM24baKcfIp36Rhplgm7_gSy-8Fkohxj8pJtgAKUIgsdkHWtvjkdc55O6f24Dpf2H2KjhPWAy3zGyWHA2t8zn6vK0A-t2NUxJ6xxDbHa8_bInqNcv3mfRX_piy9jbgXzWF_RHCXZnDInHEKdTFZqk=>  - of the app model for display advertising. Read even more on the Flite blog <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109413045039&s=8442&e=0017TrtjdYQfM0ONgT1QvKv-k9sBwPW47YOxaKD5t8B8GbGl6aEjf15oZyPc6CmnvTgzOMNUYsazR6xqIXO-3NEN821USsCDadRGYS8Oaz2S7n-FzIpcVHVAH4c56MQY68KmvLCkl762Pkd0D9JIK-m1UeweoNPKaZhzQaH_Vcpn79LBubg7dQTeYoJReRup23vRaMHGbYQKv5iOs0BKp0OQN63ks2zZsVio-qWDXQ1qa8=> . 


Creative Ad Valuation


Safeguard Scientifics reported its Q4 2011 earnings and, in the process, provided insights on its recent investments which include ad technology companies MediaMath and a newer one, Spongecell. From the release, "Safeguard deployed $10 million in Spongecell in January 2012 and has a 23% primary ownership position." So, some back of the envelope math puts creative ad tech company Spongecell's valuation at a healthy $43.5 million. For context - though not a perfect comparison -, dynamic creative optimization firm Teracent sold to Google <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109413045039&s=8442&e=0017TrtjdYQfM2t4D_4q7qenAzd8tfWalyEzmuMeDCMHEPMxYTtiO7shAEIu_H0IOr5E1ZtFw_D_L5XubswtK54bCOGwfeV8QK5rIUSbpJnCtoSDhbtiKeNpgOYY19Ac8jcLSuh40NDhMhSu84RoQN6qcahrhKvBkT2_L8EYJyScH4=>  for $36 million (the $$ figure is according to sources) in 2009 according to sources. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109413045039&s=8442&e=0017TrtjdYQfM3SYzQ4xJVz5Hf2k1KOUHeMQQ0-HfQljdgUNuqAJQxFxmx8ug6d6j2IIAibpu7BUzHkWjmav9YWuChDbFdS-m6JLcXcNDcFqVEHPdoGwPFzn249lNbx4dCtAv6z2VW28NKrE7buiiW9oVG8SPPcrBmHm07ROGwwNwzVPgclRTDaEgAb8dIb7c_af0G5AwUeXiHl70AOkhrn5RHkVUY7Eh_4XGls1HIjQsqZhYJI54-K0A==> . 


Breeding Planners


On The Makegood, (Publicis) Razorfish head of display Jayne Pimentel takes on the hot subject of agency trading desks. She, in turn, provides a fresh take on the changes afoot in the agency. She writes, "The art of planning has shifted from planning direct buys to planning a suite of technologies in order to access inventory sources efficiently, effectively and to analyze data to indicate top performing audiences and nuances that were not fully realized prior to running those technologies across biddable media. Media Technologists are the new breed of planners." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109413045039&s=8442&e=0017TrtjdYQfM3C6le7CewPR38RobGHJibIUTlsj1YnF0VVzAwvbxjrHY1axRN5pRd93ePhw7sj_RNA2-kBJSFm9g4UZHJQwnVYYK00g_57JGzTZzdwkPPvf8NvwLdUNk84YIf8mZhNS8eMuX9Oq_8ym-rUVdBi-jwSKLQT_QvLW4tVmHDxmITP2XY_InGYgNDML68he7UJgd0=> . 


DMP Chat


Buying platforms keep going more horizontal. Or is it vertical? In an update to its the data management platform (DMP) component of its Origin marketing platform to be launched on April 9, x+1 says that it will be adding "automated real-time decisions for email, SMS, call center, websites and chat." Chat? Here's how according to the release, "Triggered by a customer interaction on a web page, or any [x+1] Origin-enabled touchpoint, the DMP can invoke a client's (...) chat service so that relevant, personalized marketing messages can be delivered to consumers in real time." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109413045039&s=8442&e=0017TrtjdYQfM18ApDwy0qMwWR4vkSOq-b-MFBMORGSVAhlg5hdATHts3GXHcNk-hjgm1qxsw9zG8opu7i_6HSiudQDXw40zT54mggxTktCh8-LKr3TMwgWfQ-W_OCUsLypsh3nd-roSPwk2WngCayfYv_2O0E52l7JYRKQecKD4Pns05H2MRWj_ysMDgdec1patJkQlJN_KT-fO25N1R36qqb3QPhcuWgAOOuGyNZWEzo=>

Display Ad Lawsuit


According to a local television station in Texas, a 4 year old photo from a dating website, which belonged to a U.S. soldier who was killed-in action, was allegedly used in advertising recently from two dating websites - True.com and PlentyOfFish.com. The soldier's parents are now suing. From NBC 5 in Dallas-Fort Worth, "'Vancouver-based Plenty Of Fish told NBC 5 on Monday that it did no online advertising in December 2011 and that 'hundreds of thousands of third parties advertise via POF.com every month, the majority coming through networks such as Google AdSense and ad exchanges.'" Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109413045039&s=8442&e=0017TrtjdYQfM3YvTJV67H5l-1V3iPy8wXadupGVehGJIzii_FVu7Sr1WlHqoe23pZsPKsmD3-tl6yO_t6s9YyfXNSD6jbwHcPSL2p38aQJ6CR_83ZWiJZAatP80nzzHwPoTqp5x-98PRrOE_45hA05byFgmxVc7e1DSxER5ofUirq0naCyl7IuU8aGJul8vqXFZypYtKIm0llv6g0RQ6Stxk4rfVMKPg6O> . 


Ad Network Research


ValueClick Media released results from its December 2011 survey of 267 advertisers - which presumably are or have been ValueClick clients - and advertisers were positive about ad networks coming into 2012. "The top media formats advertisers plan to spend more than 25% of their digital budgets include ad networks (45%), direct publisher buys (40%) and SEM/SEO (37%)." What's more, the data showed that compared to spend with demand-side platforms, advertisers said they will increase their ad network spend even more. See it (PDF) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?et=1109413045039&s=8442&e=0017TrtjdYQfM0XW443KaA3EX0aOLZEKddL6xAAngrLk0ZZwa7yAj9W9FKt56X7xxgZaEFdVTg0_24yaXvmocK3Wnvkpe7O6W36IOterCU9bKfjWD9Ut9y9u3aPzRhYsz5sjL_OfelN3Tl_UrUUG2aeI6a4fPL9Nw9V484l1rUbnHmw5M3HWV5ygw==> . ValueClick's Dotomi advertisers could help tilt toward demand-side platform spend or direct-to-publisher spend (for first look access) in future surveys.
